author: {'steamid': '76561198099499691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1702754253}
review:
Wish there was a Meh option.

Game says it's inspired by jak&daxter/Banjo&Kazooie while having almost nothing in common with those games. It's a linear action adventure game, NOT an open world collectathon. Main gameplay is from punching and dodging things, and occasionally using a ranged attack.

It's not bad. It's just falsely advertised.

author: {'steamid': '76561199473642293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1696442371}
review:
The Last Tinker: City of Colors is a visually vibrant and imaginative action-adventure game developed by Mimimi Games. It attempts to blend elements of platforming, exploration, and combat into a unique experience set in a beautifully crafted world. While it has its moments of charm and creativity, it also falls short in some key areas.

Let's start with the positives. The game's art style is undeniably captivating. The world is a colorful explosion of creativity, with distinct neighborhoods and characters inspired by different colors. The artistic direction here is commendable, and it's clear that a lot of love went into creating this unique universe.

The platforming elements of the game are generally enjoyable, with our protagonist, Koru, using parkour-style moves to navigate the city. The controls are responsive, and there's a sense of freedom as you leap, wall-run, and swing your way through the various levels.

However, The Last Tinker does have its share of drawbacks. One of the most significant issues is the combat system. It feels somewhat clunky and unrefined, making battles less enjoyable than they could be. The camera can also be problematic, occasionally making it difficult to see what's happening during intense moments, which can be frustrating.

Another aspect that may leave players wanting more is the depth of the story and characters. While the world is visually appealing, the narrative and character development are somewhat lacking. The story lacks a strong emotional connection, and it doesn't delve as deep as it could into the themes it touches upon.

The game also suffers from some technical hiccups, including occasional bugs and performance issues, which can detract from the overall experience.

In summary, The Last Tinker: City of Colors is a game with a lot of heart and a visually striking world that will undoubtedly appeal to fans of unique art styles. It succeeds in delivering a colorful and imaginative setting, but it falls short in terms of combat, character development, and technical polish. If you're willing to overlook some of its shortcomings and appreciate it for its artistic merits, it might be worth a playthrough. However, for those seeking a more refined and immersive gaming experience, it may leave you wanting more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085105526', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1695227862}
review:
Fun lighthearted game worth the price for the amount it costs on discount

PROS
* Being able to go back within the same save file to easily complete achievements
* Fun game setting you can acquire with the collectible tokens like ex: big head mode, inverted colors etc.
* Collectibles are neither too challenging to collect nor too many

CONS
* Controls can sometimes feel a bit sluggish (on keyboard and mouse at least) especially when you miss a jump off a cliff because the game didn't register you holding space

author: {'steamid': '76561198041600464', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1693491314}
review:
Disclaimer: I played up to the point where you obtain the green spirit before I couldn't take it anymore.

The game's pitch sounds great, and it has some good character designs. On the surface, the game had everything it needed to succeed.

Sadly, it ended up feeling unpolished. I can forgive a bit of it since this was only the studios' second game. But things compounded.
The limited controls you get at any given time do not feel responsive enough. Koru is clearly quick and agile when he is doing things automatically, but sluggish when it comes to executing the commands you give him. The camera, especially early on, has a nasty habit of picking bad angles. And with how few abilities Koru starts out, new powers are given way too sparingly.

A bit before I dropped the game there was an encounter that had a nasty habit of spawnkilling you repeatedly if you mess up. The responsible attack even goes through walls. The detection mechanic on that enemy was a mess, and it revealed the inconsistent way the game handles hitpoints and respawning. If you have an attack that forces a respawn, don't also reduce HP for the next attempt. Pick one. Oh, and that is before we consider that the death/respawn animations are way too long.

As for the plot, I get what they were going for, but along the way they broach the issue of bullying, then handle it pretty poorly. In general, expect the protagonist to be mostly adressed with slurs. Not that he really seems to care.
And then there is a "side character" that is an annoying game mechanic at best - you can only call him from a very short distance, the game doesn't tell you that you can keep holding the whistle button, and you spend a lot of time waiting for this character to do things for you instead of doing them yourself. This character actually has a few powers, but will cower in the presence of enemies rather than helping you, because he is not given any agency whatsoever. At the same time, he will willingly run into static hazards that would "kill" him. That's if I'm being generous, because at worst, he is an ableist stereotype as well, one that is treated as completely expendable, too. Which is ironic because a major theme of the game is racism.

It goes without saying that I'm really glad I picked this one up in a 90% sale, because it certainly doesn't feel like a 20‚Ç¨ product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198450345569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1681398040}
review:
i review games on steam after i 100% complete them! check out my reviews to see all the games i have completed!

the last tinker: city of colors is a action-adventure game developed by mimimi games and published by daedalic entertainment in may 2014 for the PC and PS4.some consider this game a platformer, but with a caveat: no jump button. this can result in some awkward controls during platforming but it's interesting nonetheless. 

as far as graphics go, that's where this game excels. it's built into the story and everything, but the setting is colorful and vibrant, while also giving psychonauts vibes. it can all seem a bit childish, as can the story, but the story definitely has moments that would go over a child's head but mature players will identify the themes of civil unrest and other interesting narratives. the music is also cheerful and enjoyable.

the game rewards exploration, which made 100%ing the game a lot more fun than if i were to just do a main story playthrough. this feels a lot like a old-school PS2-era platformer. one downside for people could be how easy the game is. i played through on hard and never died once. i'm sure kids would have a harder time but i think it's still too easy in a general sense.

they recently raised the price of the game back up to $20 in auust 2022, which was a weird move because they lowered it to $10 in june 2018. as a result, you used to get this game for 99 cents when it was 90% off (which it is often), but now when it's 90% off you'll pay $2 instead. it's not a huge deal and is probably just because they had a lot of people buying it when it was only a dollar. still, you can routinely find the game for 90% off on steam. 

overall this is a decent indie game that comes from a studio of only 9 people at the time. i am excited to play their other games they released after this (shadow tactics (2016, 2021) and desperados III (2020) because it looks like they went in an entirely new direction after this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059333569', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1662372461}

author: {'steamid': '76561198953756162', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1636070431}
review:
A platformer-like collectathon adventure game with basic God of War like combat with the message SAY NOT TO RACISM as we pull together to overcome the greater challenges that society throws at us all.

Yes, there is no jump button, but the character does jump through commands like certain combat moves or approaching ledges. It is not that controversial.

The game's visual style is colorful and appealling and the world-building is appreciated.

The script and narrative may comes across fairly juvenile but does have a decent amount of depth and is in a somewhat cliche way fairly well written. The game would have benefitted from voice-acting. Characters do make noises to express themselves.

The game plays nicely with a controller which is the way I played it, but I don't know about keyboard and mouse, I'm sure its fine.

I received The Last Tinker as part of the Daedelic Gigantic bundle but is also available as a stand-alone product, often for less than a dollar. 

There is a lot of nostalgia factor for the type of game like your classic Spyro The Dragon and Jak and Daxter games (and Psychonauts) so it can feel a bit like those games when you play The Last Tinker: City Of Colors.

review:

Colortown'ƒ±n kenar mahallelerinden gen√ß bir √ßocuk olan Koru, bu duruma kar≈üƒ± koyar. Kasvetle y√ºzle≈ümek ve evine mutluluƒüu ve renkleri geri getirmek i√ßin destansƒ± bir maceraya atƒ±lƒ±r.

The Last Tinker 90'larƒ±n oyun √ßaƒüƒ±na ger√ßek bir geri d√∂n√º≈ü. Oyunu √ßocuklarƒ±nƒ±zla birlikte oynayabilir veya kendinizi bu renkli yolculuƒüa kaptƒ±rarak i√ßinizdeki √ßocuƒüu yeniden ke≈üfedebilirsiniz. Zƒ±plama d√ºƒümesinin olmamasƒ± ilgin√ß bir deƒüi≈üikliktir ve oyunun duygulara ve ekip √ßalƒ±≈ümasƒ±na yaptƒ±ƒüƒ± vurgu onu diƒüer aksiyon-macera oyunlarƒ±ndan ayƒ±rƒ±r.

Colortown'un canlƒ± d√ºnyasƒ± g√ºzel grafikler ve m√ºkemmel bir m√ºzikle hayat buluyor. Oyunun benzersiz mekanikleri ve platform zorluklarƒ±, oynanƒ±≈üƒ± taze ve ilgi √ßekici tutuyor. Genel olarak, The Last Tinker sizi ne≈üeli ve memnun hissettirecek keyifli ve canlandƒ±rƒ±cƒ± bir deneyim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070961017', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1677106710}
review:
Juego que, aunque a primera vista pareciera destinado a los m√°s peque√±os de la casa, trabaja muchos sentimientos y temas como la depresi√≥n, la rabia, la pasi√≥n e incluso el cambio del miedo a lo desconocido -o el miedo a lo que esta por llegar- por curiosidad e intriga hacia los misterios y nuevas barreras a superar del porvenir. La correlaci√≥n que muestra entre el color y el sentimiento es muy educativo; siendo los azules los m√°s pasionales -tristes o sensibles-, los rojos los m√°s iracundos y los verdes los m√°s temerosos -pusil√°nimes o aprensivos- hacia el mundo que les rodea. Es un juego con el que entrenar la inteligencia emocional; descubres por ejemplo que, detr√°s de un crimen de vandalismo, se escond√≠a el miedo y la desesperanza a perder la buena imagen que siempre tuvo una localizaci√≥n.

Por otra parte, la jugabilidad es muy simple, casi de manual. Algunos combos, mejor√≠a de habilidades gastando monedas, combate simple (aunque combinar los distintos usos de los colores en el combate me ha parecido buena idea).

El apartado art√≠stico es una delicia a los ojos. Tanto las edificaciones, la fauna y flora y los personajes dotan al juego de un cariz fantasioso incluso on√≠rico; mis personajes favoritos son las setas sin duda.

Para ir acabando... Me parece un juego ideal para ir entrenando a los chiquillos al inexorable mundo de los sentimientos. Y si tienes la oportunidad de obtenerlo barato, no dudes en comprarlo aunque parezca infantil a primera vista.

De jugabilidad simple, personajes agradables y una historia profundamente ligada a la gesti√≥n de los sentimientos humanos m√°s primarios, The Last Tinker: City of Colors nos ofrece una historia apacible y llevadera de la que no saldremos impunes sin aprender algo m√°s -por √≠nfimo que sea- de nosotros mismos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198429074257', 'num_games_owned': 1453, 'num_reviews': 1349, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1661864433}
review:
Wanting to save his little friend, Cora unknowingly helps the Mist break into the City of Colors. Now, in order to restore colors to the world, as well as to save and unite the peoples, Kora will have to go through many trials...

[b]Pros:[/b][list]
[*]+ Nice graphics
[*]+ Parkour
[*]+ Achievements
[*]+ Gamepad support
[*]+ Trading cards
[*]+ Great soundtrack
[*]+ Suitable for all ages
[*]+ Hero upgrades
[*]+ Story about the value of friendship

[b]Minuses:[/b]
[*]- Slightly faded colors[/list]

[b]Total:[/b]
Great game, gameplay based on parkour. The player will jump a lot, jump, solve puzzles and fight against numerous opponents.
The story is quite simple and truly childish. But nonetheless, it's interesting. We will have time not only to get acquainted with the many diverse inhabitants of the City of Colors, but also to solve an intricate detective case, lead an entire orchestra, and even take part in the Great War!
Nice soundtrack that changes depending on the zone the player is in. It includes both calm melodies and rather upbeat rock melodies - which will resonate in the hearts of many.
The game is great for all ages, and will be a nice gift for the younger generation.
I recommend this game to buy and play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 1788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1658251060}
review:
"The Last Tinker: City of Colors" ist ein kindgerechtes Third-Person Action Adventure.

Was nicht hei√üen will, da√ü das Spiel nur Kinder spielen sollten, denn wir k√∂nnen zwischen vier Schwierigkeitsstufen w√§hlen, die das Spiel auch f√ºr Erwachsene herausfordernd macht. 

In der Farbstadt gibt es Probleme. Differenzen der Bewohner, der drei Farbgebiete haben zum Aufkommen der Bleiche gef√ºhrt, die sich ausbreitet und die ganze Farbstadt bedroht. Wir sind Koru, ein Affenjunge, der sich zur Aufgabe gemacht hat, die Bleiche aufzuhalten. 

Welt und Geschichte wirken zun√§chst etwas eigenwillig und ungew√∂hnlich. Hat man sich aber erstmal an die merkw√ºrdigen Orte und Gestalten gew√∂hnt, bemerkt man, da√ü alles thematisch gut durchdacht ist. Die einzelnen Farb-Gebiete haben Bewohner, die emotional zur Farbe passen. Die Blauen neigen zum zu Melancholie und Traurigkeit, die Roten zu Zorn und Aggressivit√§t, die Gr√ºnen zu Vorsicht und √Ñngstlichkeit. Passend dazu m√ºssen wir nicht nur Aufgaben erf√ºllen, sondern k√∂nnen sp√§ter auch Spezialf√§higkeiten erhalten, die zur Farb-Emotion passen. Mit einem blauen Schu√ü k√∂nnen wir Gegner zum Beispiel spontan traurig machen, wodurch er kurzzeitig von seinem Angriff abl√§√üt. 

Das K√§mpfen passiert zwar h√§ufig, noch h√§ufiger m√ºssen wir allerdings Spungpassagen meistern oder kleine Logikr√§tsel l√∂sen. Das Springen funktioniert recht ungew√∂hnlich, denn wir m√ºssen nicht f√ºr jeden Sprung eine Taste dr√ºcken, sondern lediglich die "Akrobatik"-Taste gedr√ºckt halten w√§hrend wir in die entsprechende Richtung steuern und schon h√ºpft unsere Figur selbstt√§tig von Stein zu Stein oder schwingt sich an Stangen weiter. Das klingt erstmal recht simpel und die Bewegung ist dadurch grunds√§tzlich auch einfacher als in Genre-Kollegen, allerdings kommen sp√§ter noch Timing- und Ausweichpassagen mit ins Spiel, die durchaus herausfordernd sein k√∂nnen. Am besten sollte man √ºbrigens mit einem Controller spielen. 

Das Spiel steigert angenehm langsam den Schwierigkeitsgrad, f√ºhrt neue Spielmechaniken, von denen es reichlich gibt, stets sukzessive ein und bleibt dadurch angenehm unterhaltsam. Die ausgebreitete Geschichte ist dabei durchaus episch, die Spielzeit, die bei normalem Spielen vielleicht etwa  acht Stunden betr√§gt, aber nat√ºrlich massiv variieren kann, ist f√ºr das Genre auch recht umfangreich. 

Richtig zu √ºberzeugen wei√ü der  Welten- und Levelbau. Das ist sowohl kreativ und abwechslungsreich als auch detailreich und verspielt. Eine eigenst√§ndige Welt mit ihren eigenen Regeln, die man gerne erkundet. 

Die Grafik ist rein technisch zwar nicht beeindruckend, √§sthetisch aber gelungen, in sich schl√ºssig und rund. Der bunte und s√º√üe Comic-Stil l√§dt zum Spielen ein. Auch die Sounds und die Musik sind simpel, aber gelungen. 

Das Storytelling ist rund, bietet ein paar √úberraschungen und Wendungen und ist sogar p√§dagogisch sinnvoll ohne mit dem erhobenen Zeigefinger zu kommen. 

Insgesamt ein sehr gelungener Titel, der nicht nur Kindern gefallen d√ºrfte. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
8/10 Atmosph√§re
8/10 Story
8/10 Grafik
8/10 Sound
7/10 Spielmechanik
8/10 Balancing
8/10 Spielspass 

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Bunt und farbenfroh.

[h1][b]8/10 Gesamtwertung

review:

Certo vuole passare un bel messaggio sull'uguaglianza ma non lo consiglierei a qualcuno di et√† superiore ai.. abbondiamo.. 10 anni dai. 
Nonostante questo la trama √® carina, il sistema di combattimento √® semplicissimo e i personaggi hanno un loro carattere distintivo. La grafica si rif√† ai cartoni animati per bambini con gli alberi in cartone ecc.
Avrei dato un pollice a met√† strada tra il si e il no che steam propone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987376405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1643941861}
review:
Want a substitute Spyro? A bargain-bin Legend of Zelda? How about a demoted Donkey Kong 64? Then this is the game for you. Here is the Bad and the Good.

The Bad:
1) The Last Tinker. Tinker is in the name. A tinker is, by definition, one who repairs, adjusts, or works with something in an unskilled or experimental manner. You definitely are one who is repairing the world. Kudos. Stated in the game, though, you are a creator. What do I see in the game? No creating. The world is F#$&* paper and glue and color. Maybe, [i] maybe [/i] not mention being the last person in the world to be some who "imagines something and creates it", and then go about not creating anything. 
2) There is something about using those mushroom dudes that feels...wrong. Like I'm using someone with special needs to perform my dirty work. 
3) The world is fairly explorable, and yet there are empty spaces that feel underused. No easter eggs, no extra collectibles, no extra art. I'm the guy who pokes around in corners, who checks beneath the hood, shines light on the shadows. If you let me explore those spaces, reward me. 
4) Speaking of which, but maybe let me go back to areas to collect missed collectibles. There are only the paintbrushes, might as well open up the space to let me get a good look for them.

The Good:
1) The soundtrack slaps, especially in the Blue area. 
2) The colors Duke, the colors! (If you get that reference, you are old, and deserve a popsicle). 
3) Like the intro implies, this is a wanna-be N64 game, with a quarter the time and difficulty. If that is what you are looking for, that is what you will get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022458781', 'num_games_owned': 2808, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1642880704}
review:
[Quote][h1][b]Per altre recensioni segui üëç il nostro [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40165899]Curatore in lingua italiana[/url].[/b][/h1][/Quote]

Questo √® un gioco misto di azione e a piattaforme. Il nostro protagonista infatti deve guadagnarsi il pane a divertire i giocatori combattendo e saltando, maggiormente su piattaforme e binari. Spesso questo tipo di giochi prevede anche progressione del personaggio principale in qualche sua caratteristica: in questo caso c'√® la possibilit√† di acquisire tecniche di combattimento, sia all'arma bianca che a distanza. Naturalmente c'√® una storia di tipo 'lotta al cattivone' che fa da filo conduttore del gioco: il nostro protagonista, che possiamo ascrivere ad una razza di scimmiette, si ritrova ad essere a sua insaputa ad appartenere ad una classe di guerrieri 'tinker', praticamente una specie di factotum aggiusta-tutto, che in questo caso deve scongiurare la minaccia di vedere la sua citt√† deprivata dei colori. Come prevedibile da quanto detto, la grafica √® da cartoni animati con i personaggi non giocanti che si esprimono tramite fumetti rettangolari. Il sonoro √® adeguato, le voci dei personaggi sono assenti e sostituite da semplici trilli monosillabici.
In definitiva gioco di modesta difficolt√† adatto a passare qualche ora di divertimento. 
Consigliatissimo l'uso del controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401925621', 'num_games_owned': 1136, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1637388591}
review:
Got this in a bundle years ago.  I assumed it would be just another one of those sh!t bundle games that would sit in my library for all of eternity.  Thankfully I was moved to try it out and was pleasantly surprised at how much fun I had with this game.

If you played the OG 3D platformers on the N64, Dreamcast, or even some of the early PS2 titles, you‚Äôll feel right at home with The Last Tinker.  It certainly wears its influences on its sleeve.  I can see if you weren‚Äôt a gamer from the aforementioned eras, you would likely find some hard faults within the general game design.  For instance‚Ä¶

The camera is kind of wonky, much like it was in early 3D platformers.  If you‚Äùve played similar games before‚Ä¶ you‚Äôre used to it and can adjust.  Players unfamiliar, however, probably wouldn‚Äôt be so tolerant.  Same with the auto-jump (like Ocarina of Time).  This wasn‚Äôt an issue for me for the majority of the game but did become a bit of a thorn in some of the later levels.  But I can see how not being able to jump at will would be a strange design choice to some people.

Beyond that though, I found The Last Tinker to be a sweet little love letter to a beloved era of gaming.  Graphics and sound were solid, controls were sufficient, good variety to the levels, and the game length was decent.  Story is kinda dumb, but there are a few chuckles to be had here and there.

If you can grab this cheap (or in a bundle like I did) and are a fan of old school 3D platformers, this will most likely satisfy with some warm feelings of nostalgia.

And to anyone that may be concerned, don‚Äôt worry.  The Last Tinker will not tinker with your stinker.  ü§≠

author: {'steamid': '76561198046669010', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1642165883}
review:
This is a well designed game! You actually get every basic mechanic in the book in the right order. And I love the story and presentation. The sound the characters make while talking will get to your nerves quick, though.

For those who say it's easy, It is, kinda. You need to use your powers the right way to feel god-like. And did you done the Orchestra? That is the most difficult thing invented in video game history. I kinda hate that that is there.

And for those who say they expected 3D platforming like in Crash or Jak & Dexter, you are right, sort of. The description claims that, but the game hasn't got any platforming like activity. You just hold forward and it's automatically done. I love that! I played Wexx and the like and I was there when the games started to become 3D and I just DON'T want any of that confusion! This is chill and relax and full of entertainment.

The only bugs I have encountered is the game starts up only like the 2nd or 3rd time, and it diappeares when you click out of it. Maybe I saw some visual glitching in the shadows once. Other than that, it's solid!

The rails, yeah you won't go through some of them the first try. You need to learn the pattern. But the respawn point is always just before you hop on them. And this is true for most of the game, so there is no huge penalty for trying things.

Over all, this was an enjoyable experience after the brain breaking logic puzzles and rage inducing platformer games I play most of the time on PC. Thank you!

review:
I really can't recommend this game. 
In the beginning, it was cool, decent gameplay, amazing soundtrack, but as you progress to the green neighborhood it gets you stuck after escaping a giant sound pod. That phetus-shaped door traps you forever and prevents you from progressing the story. 
Don't buy it for one simple reason: you can't play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059361840', 'num_games_owned': 1182, 'num_reviews': 1030, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1639616266}
review:
First, I must say that this game was clearly aimed towards kids. A quick look at the art style is enough for a first assumption, but once you get into the game your assumption gets confirmed.

This game pretends to be a platformer, but you will just run in one direction most of the time. There are way less platformer elements than expected.

The animations look bad and junky. Same for the controls. Also, if you don‚Äôt have a controller, don‚Äôt even think of buying this game. It wasn‚Äôt optimised for keyboard gamers (I tried both out). Having bad controls in a ‚Äúplatformer‚Äù is the worst.

The story was okay.

This is one of those games you may try once and never pick up again. It was not very fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561199149771323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1116, 'last_played': 1636765081}
review: I really wanted to play this game. it had a cute storyline, unique idea, interesting enough characters and easy (but hard enough to be fun) strategy that is exactly what i like in a game to just relax.  However, the controls are just....super hard to use on a PC with mouse. The camera (even at it's lowest setting) swings wildly around when turning, and with so many actions using the same buttons, you die a LOT because the game just doesn't quite do what you want it to.  After about 15 hours, i have had enough and probably won't finish it... at least not on a PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050051452', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1912, 'last_played': 1634724224}
review:
A great game! I really enjoyed playing it. Exploration was smooth, puzzles weren't too challenging, boss fights were difficult till you figured out what you need to do. As for the achievements; I completed the majority as I played through my first attempt (finishing areas and exploring for paint brushes), gems were not difficult to acquire to purchase the skill upgrades. 
The only negative I have about the game is that I thought the ending boss fight DIDN'T utilize the powers enough that you'd just spent the entire game retrieving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067032507', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1632522958}
review:
During the tutorials you need to complete two missions that award 250 coins each, so you have the 500 needed to progress. After completing those (+ all the coins I got around), the game informed me I had a total of 409 coins. So I can't progress unless I spend an hour punching boxes or start the game again (hoping it won't just bug again).
A quick Google search told me several other people had the same issue, so...

Besides that, gameplay seems very boring: you just hold a button and the characters runs and jumps all by itself, so there's actually no platforming involved, and combat seems to go that way too (press the button, character aims and dashes/slides towards the enemy).

author: {'steamid': '76561198109330701', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1630839287}
review:
Very creative idea and decent story. Not the best one you'll ever come across, but unique setting and the story gives a very good explanation for gaining new abilities. The gameplay isn't too hard or too easy and you can switch difficulties at any point. I'd recommend using a controller though, seeing as every type of attack has a colour (red, green and blue) and the red attack is B, the blue one X and the green one A. The music is good and not too repetitive and fits well with the different levels. 
And for the achievement hunters: Getting 100% isn't difficult and doesn't take a great amount of extra time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047760378', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1629928708}
review:
This game was a fun little find. I got it on a really good sale and it sat in my library for a while. I finally got around to it and was surprised at how good it actually turned out! Love the story, the visuals and music are quite enjoyable, and there are some really cool mechanics in this game! I'm surprised it's already been out so long and I just got around to playing it. It aged extremely well. It could honestly be a new game today and still be amazing. It's not a super long game story wise, but the achievements make it a little longer and are pretty fun to get. I also love that you can replay chapters if you missed collectibles or achievements without losing your progress. There are several difficulty levels, though I will admit I played it in Kid's Mode because I was just looking for something easy and engaging. Even in kid's mode it had some really cool puzzles and challenged my noggin. Definitely recommend for all ages.

Edit: Also! Love the Rob Boss cameo so much! There are quite a few cool things in this game that reference real life stuff. I spent a decently long amount of time admiring the paintings in a certain important place in the game. Enjoy all the Happy Little Accidents! <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198167173649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1621001058}
review:
Pretty good game, not too long, around 4 hours if you rush it, 6 hours if you take your time to look for everything.

Straight forward, point A to point B with only going off the path for a collectable. Not too difficult though an enemy or two can be confusing on how to beat due to game not telling you how and you need to guess work.

The art-style is nice though only thing really keeping each area look different is really just the colours, otherwise most of it will blend in.

The collectables are fun to take your time to go and get, they are rarely in hard places, just most times in a path abit to the right or behind something but collecting them does unlock concept art and some fun little modes you can choose to play with. 

The achievements are not as hard as the % count makes you think, most are just from doing each boss/chapter area while the others are easy to find and don't take much out of your objective to do. Just sucks not many who have opened this game have given it a chance past the first hour of the game.


My only gripe with the game is if you missed a collectable at end of an area, you need to rewatch the cutscenes and do everything again just to get back to that point. Cutscenes cannot be skipped and clicking off the game while you wait pauses it. Just a small issue which may ruin it for those going back in to 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075106695', 'num_games_owned': 1774, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1120, 'last_played': 1619320270}
review:
El juego se presenta como una aventura infantil caricaturesca con est√©tica de libro de cuento y con una historia interesante, aunque predecible.
Somos un ni√±o mono llamado Koru que vive en la ciudad de colortown en Tinkerwold, pero hay un problema, en el pasado todos los colores viv√≠an en armon√≠a, pero ahora todos los colores se han vuelto unos contra otros y han dividido a colortown en distritos separados, Koru por infortunio y sin querer desencadena un problema mayor "la monocrom√≠a". Esta comienza a extenderse en forma de avalancha de color blanco amenazando con neutralizar todos los colores. Koru, como el √öltimo Tinker, tiene la tarea de encontrar y hacerse amigo de los tres "esp√≠ritus" principales de las facciones (verdes-azules y rojos), encargados de usar sus poderes para detener la causa.
Jugar The Last Tinker: City of Colors fue un aire fresco, un ant√≠doto perfecto para lo que ven√≠a jugando en su mayor√≠a juegos modernos de colores mon√≥tonos, quiero decir con esto que el mundo de The Last Tinker est√° bellamente coloreado y dise√±ado, con personajes expresivos y dise√±os llamativos que disfrute jugando. Como la mayor√≠a de juegos de plataforma debes recolectar, en este caso, gemas para mejorar las habilidades de combate, de salud, etc√©tera...,adem√°s los poderes basados en el color que acumulas durante el juego es genial, es f√°cil moverse en los escenarios con controles muy f√°ciles de dominar (jugu√© con control Xbox 360), los combates son muy complejos, realizas ataques con un solo bot√≥n contra monstruos que te superaran en n√∫mero, los poderes que desbloqueas cuando reclutas a los esp√≠ritus son divertidos le dan un conjunto nuevo de herramientas, combates y acertijos para resolver haciendo que se conviertan en el fuerte del juego
En general, el juego estuvo bien y nunca lo encontr√© tedioso, es un juego para ni√±os muy f√°cil de dominar, si eres un adulto es posible que este juego te resulte un poco aburrido, igualmente no quiere decir que no valga la pena jugarlo, el t√≠tulo es corto aunque se puede alargar su duraci√≥n si recolectas los 80 pinceles coleccionables dentro de la aventura, as√≠ podr√°s desbloquear trucos como un modo Dios o nuevos escenarios como una arena de combate para superar oleadas de enemigos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994796062', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1575807708}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 43.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038712305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1613643996}
review: Think the auto-jump issue is overblown. It's not like the game was built as a platformer and then they just took out jumping. The "platforming" in this would be awful if you had to manually jump, the levels are clearly designed for auto-jump. It's similar to how other games have implemented parkour - devs probably should've called it that instead. Story's decent, puzzles are solid. This is an excellent game for kids. Adults might find it a bit easy, but I had fun throughout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059825119', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1323, 'last_played': 1613332428}
review:
This is a solid platformer. 
It has a nice story, that is wrapped up nicely at the end. 
I liked the idea of a city made of districs of various colors, and each district/color has different inhabitants and architecture.
So the graphics is surely ok, also the sound. 
The game on the outside looks like its made for kids, but it isn't so. 
Some puzzles and obstacle paths are slightly challenging, and some parts of the game are even unclear in the beginning. 
To resume, buy only if you are a fun of platformers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198396580468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1662222732}
review: A wonderful adventure game with a very cute story! It's like Mario with extra punch skills but auto-jumping like Link on the N64, having also superpowers from these adorable four spirits, and all this in a very colorful and funny world like Banjo-Kazooie. Lot's of humor and cute characters. The negative reviews are just wrong, I almost passed this gem! Definitely a great game. We need more such games: bright, colorful and hilarious.

review: Pretty fun game, it's been ages since I've played a 3D platformer game, rekindled my love for the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128709967', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1612313974}
review:
I'm glad I paid 99 cents for this because this game is BORING.
Shitty Arkham style combat that's mind-numbing.
You practically never use the other color powers in combat.
Useless color powers that never get used outside of main objectives.
Autoplatforming in a platformer.
None of the worlds are fun to traverse.
A very basic story.

Honestly, the only things I can maybe like about it are the visuals and music, but that's a BIG maybe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056542054', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1611764769}
review:
The last tinker
Un monde ne vivant que pour la couleur perd de mani√®re cataclysmique ses teintes, le pinceau est entre vos mains pour vaincre la grisaille

Les points positifs :
Gameplay simple : simple mais diablement efficace et qui ne s‚Äôarr√™te pas d‚Äô√©voluer au fur et √† mesure que vous progressez dans l‚Äôaventure
Histoire simple et classique : simple et classique, s√ªrement, pour qu‚Äôelle puisse √™tre rapidement assimil√©e pour les plus jeunes, mais qui poss√®de une r√©elle trame sc√©naristique ainsi que de vrai morale sur la fin, enfin un jeu qui ne prend pas pour des d√©biles les plus jeunes
Traduction : en fran√ßais et compl√®te s‚Äôil vous pla√Æt
Prix : 10 euros pour un jeu d‚Äôune telle qualit√© se font tellement rares.
Bande son : l‚ÄôOST du jeu est vraiment belle et toujours dans le vrai.

Les choses √† savoir :
Graphiquement color√© et chatoyant : le jeu est beau sans pour autant √™tre magnifique, surtout que cette patte graphique ne plaira pas √† tout le monde.
Un jeu enfantin : car oui, le jeu cible un public relativement jeune, ce qui explique son manque de difficult√©, mais il n‚Äôoublie pas pour autant les plus vieux, qui sauront voir quelques clins d‚Äô≈ìil ici ou l√†.
Dur√©e de vie : j‚Äôai mis 7 h 30 √† finir le jeu en essayant de chercher les secrets, ce qui est une bonne dur√©e de vie pour son prix.

Les points n√©gatifs :
Pas de sauvegarde manuelle : la sauvegarde ne se fait qu‚Äôa l‚Äôentr√© de la zone, donc quitt√©e en plein milieu reviens √† dire qu‚Äôil faut reprendre depuis le d√©but du niveau.
Trop peu de boss : 2 boss et uniquement vers la fin, r√©ellement dommage, car ils manquent dans la 1re moiti√© du jeu.

Conclusion : The Last Tinker fut une r√©elle surprise √† d√©couvrir et √† jouer, poss√©dant que tr√®s peu de point n√©gatif et qui se paye le luxe d‚Äôavoir un bon gameplay et une bonne histoire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109527387', 'num_games_owned': 4398, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1611682880}
review:
What a nice game!
I love to paint so I really enjoyed the idea of the city of colors and that each color represents different feelings and temperaments.
Nice little platform game with a cute and unique graphic and voice design (the voice of the scared green spirit is absolutely amazing).
My one complaint would be the feeling that this game is...quite short. Also it would be a nice thing to be able to run around freely in the color districts after completing the game.
And one more thing to not forget...the mushrooms (Biggs and Bomber) are dangerously funny and cute!
I am giving this game a solid 8.9 out of 10 and a big thumbs up! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197983320876', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1611330898}
review:

I recommend this game only if it is on discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201620245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 1365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1365, 'last_played': 1604766337}
review:
Superb design (special mention: one of the coolest villages in games.)
Superb music (special mention: nah, all of it.)
Superb interface (special mention: you control the scrolling of the end credits; clever.)

Fluid, varied and fun gameplay.
Plenty to explore. Plenty of secrets to sniff out.
Easy enough for even adults to be able to play.

Not many flaws. One annoyance, though: talks are displayed character by character. Only potoo birds learn to read like that. Anyway, skipping already seen cutscenes equates endless button smashing. Which will halve the lifespan of your controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966524862', 'num_games_owned': 1737, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1604150075}
review:
Un tres chouette petit plateformer 3D, graphiquement c'est un peu dat√© mais √ßa reste tres mignon et surtout la DA est tres sympathique. Le gameplay est simple et efficace, le jeu est propre (pas de bug ni de soucis ou imprecision), l'ambiance est enfantine et color√© mais ne sombre pas dans le pu√©ril "con con". C'est mignon et si l'histoire est tres basique elle a une petite moral un peu evidente mais malgre tout interessante et surtout evite le manicheisme.

Du reste le gameplay fonctionne bien, les saut sont automatique et les combats evolue avec la progression (on gagne des "pouvoir" et rencontre des ennemis qu'on doit combattre differemment. Le jeu n'est pas tres long (5/6h) mais vraiment agreable. Pour les amateurs de jeu de plateforme 3D qui cherche un petit jeu sans pretention, efficace et "leger" c'est tres plaisant. Pour les parents qui veulent un peu jouer avec leurs enfants c'est parfait, quitte a se que vous repreniez la manette de temps a autre pour passer les moments un peu difficile.

Le jeu est a 10‚Ç¨ d'habitude et franchement il les vaut. C'est mignon, avec un gameplay sympa, une chouette ambiance, une histoire interessante dot√© d'un fond enfantin mais bien pens√©. Il est actuellement (31/10/2020) en promo a 1‚Ç¨ jusqu'au 2 novembre... je l'ai pas eu a ce prix mais dans un Bundle, et bien je regrette vraiment pas de l'avoir fait et m√™me si je l'avais achet√© 8 ou 10‚Ç¨ j'aurais pas regrett√©. Bref je le recommande c'est un jeu tres sympa, bien fait et bien fini

review:
Tries to be in Spyro's or Ratchett and Clank's footsteps but falls short.

Everything else, graphics, exploration, sound, story and mechanics are acceptable. Leaving out the jump button is a nice innovation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112630547', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1593110599}
review:
[h1]Ein Abenteuer f√ºr Jung & Alt [/h1]
[quote=][b]Ein kunterbunter Abenteuer-Platformer mit guten R√§tseln und viel Spannung. Die Geschichte zeigt mehr Tiefe, als es anfangs den Anschein macht und vermittelt wundervolle Werte.[/b][/quote]
[b][u]Hier wird es ausf√ºhrlicher:[/u][/b]
In einer Welt, welche aus vielen Farben besteht und einzig von Papier und Klebstoff zusammengehalten wird, scheint alles nahezu perfekt, bis man hinter die Fassade blickt.
"Papier und Klebstoff helfen nicht, wenn man innerlich verletzt ist" ist gleich eines der Zitate, ziemlich am Anfang des Spiels und zeigt damit schon sehr fr√ºh auf, wie ernst dieses Kunterbunte Abenteuer sein kann. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2180550711
F√ºr die Einf√ºhrung in die Spielmechaniken und die Geschichte l√§sst sich das Spiel besonders viel Zeit. In dieser ersten Spielzeit lernen wir einige Bewohner von Farbstadt, in der unser Protagonist Koru lebt, kennen und werden mit Minispielen, so wie kleinen R√§tseln in das Spiel eingef√ºhrt.
Auch wenn das liebevoll gemacht wurde, ist diese Einf√ºhrung, mit √ºber einer Stunde Spielzeit, leider etwas zu lang geraten. Ich kann mir gut vorstellen, dass manche Spieler zu dieser Zeit bereits das Spiel, welches bis dahin fast wie ein reines Kinderspiel wirkt, abgebrochen haben. Jedoch verbirgt sich hinter dem kindlichen Anfang eine wundervolle Geschichte f√ºr jede Altersgruppe. Es werden Themen wie Zusammenhalt, Mobbing, Gleichberechtigung und Diskriminierung auf eine Kindgerechte Art angesprochen, welche jedoch auch √§ltere Spieler zum Nachdenken anregen wird.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2180550794
Optisch bekommen wir hier eine ganz besondere Erfahrung geliefert. Das Spiel hat, wie in den Trailern schon zu sehen, einen sehr individuellen Stil. Alle Charaktere und die Umgebung selbst wirken so, als ob sie tats√§chlich mit einem Pinsel und Farbe bemalt wurden. Sogar kleine, angedeutete Pinselstriche sind auf den Charakteren zu sehen. Sprechblasen und B√ºsche wurden zum Beispiel als bemalte Pappe dargestellt. Das gesamte Spiel wirkt optisch insgesamt sehr stimmig und passt wunderbar zu der Geschichte rund um Farben.
Die bunten Welten bieten zudem einen perfekten Kontrast zu der farblos dargestellten Bedrohung der Geschichte.

Musikalisch bietet das Spiel sehr entspannende, leicht an Country erinnernde, St√ºcke. Die Musik kam mir zu keiner Stelle des Spiels unpassend vor und macht somit genau das, was sie soll. Besonders positiv √ºberrascht war ich von einem Musik-Level ziemlich am Ende des Spiels, bei welchem sogar bei jedem Sprung, den man gemacht hatte, passende T√∂ne erklangen.

Die Spielmechaniken werden, wie oben schon angeschnitten, ebenfalls sehr gut und ausf√ºhrlich beschrieben. Etwas verwundert wird jedoch wahrscheinlich jeder Spieler, der sich zuvor nicht mit dem Spiel befasst hat, √ºber die Mechanik f√ºr das Springen sein. Obwohl das Spiel einige Plattform Abschnitte bietet, gibt es n√§mlich keine wirkliche Sprungtaste. Mit der Taste, mit der man rennen kann, springt man ebenfalls auch automatisch, wenn man die Taste gedr√ºckt h√§lt.
Auch wenn das sehr ungew√∂hnlich ist, mindert es dennoch nicht den Spielspa√ü. Im sp√§teren Spielverlauf gibt es viele bewegliche Plattformen, bei denen es sehr auf das Timing ankommt und welche nicht weniger knifflig sind, als bei Spielen mit "richtigen" Spr√ºngen.
Ansonsten ist eine Besonderheit nat√ºrlich das Einsetzen von F√§higkeiten, welche man im Laufe des Spieles freischalten wird und welche passend zum Spiel, verschiedene Farben widerspiegeln. Diese F√§higkeiten sind besonders f√ºr die K√§mpfe sehr hilfreich.

Die K√§mpfe selbst sind sehr abwechslungsreich. Auch wenn sich einige Gegner wiederholen, so kommen im Spielverlauf auch neue Gegnerarten hinzu. Die verschiedenen F√§higkeiten, die man mit der Zeit freischaltet, lassen einen auch unterschiedlich an Gegner herangehen und sind f√ºr einige Gegner auch unausweichlich. Dadurch wird gen√ºgend Abwechslung geboten.
Was die Schwierigkeit betrifft, so bietet das Spiel 4 verschiedene Stufen. Somit werden sowohl Kinder und Gelegenheitsspieler, als auch Spieler, die mehr gefordert werden m√∂chten, ihren Spa√ü daran finden.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2180550890
Abgesehen von K√§mpfen und Plattform-Abschnitten gibt es auch noch einige R√§tsel in dem Spiel zu entdecken. Diese f√ºgen sich nahtlos in die Umgebung ein und bieten gen√ºgend Abwechslung. So gilt es manchmal ganz klassisch, etwas Bestimmtes zu finden und an anderer Stelle muss man ein Musik-R√§tsel l√∂sen, um eine T√ºr √∂ffnen zu k√∂nnen.

Insgesamt bekommen wir hier ein sehr einzigartiges Abenteuer geboten, welches besonders mit seiner Optik und Detailverliebtheit √ºberzeugen kann. Jedoch hat auch die Geschichte selbst viel Potenzial und kann zum Nachdenken anregen.
Wer ein Spiel sucht, welches Kinderfreundlich genug ist, um es gemeinsam mit den eigenen Kindern zu spielen und welches gute Werte vermittelt, ist hier genau richtig.
Wer jedoch schon aus dem Kinderalter herausgewachsen ist, dennoch den optischen Stil des Spiels ansprechend findet und fantasievolle Geschichten mag, wird ebenso viel Spa√ü an Korus Reise finden.

[b]+ F√ºr jede Altersklasse geeignet
+ Detailverliebte Charakter und Umgebungen
+ Ausf√ºhrliches Tutorial
+ Interessante R√§tsel
+ Verschiedene Schwierigkeitsstufen
+ Vermittlung guter und wichtiger Werte
+ Spannung
+ Entspannende Musik
+ Eine Spielzeit von ca. 10 Stunden
+ Errungenschaften zum Sammeln

- Sehr lange Einf√ºhrung (es dauert √ºber eine Stunde, bis die Geschichte richtig beginnt)
- Steuerung mag am Anfang ungew√∂hnlich erscheinen

author: {'steamid': '76561197983152533', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1595433097}
review:
When it comes to The Last Tinker: City of Colors it is somewhat hard to tell that is it just boring or have I just grown too far out from the target audience. The game's story is simple and you play as a young, sporty, self-confident monkey who must save the world from evil terror. There is not much else in the story, but I found most of the prime characters funny and personal. Shame though that there is not any voice overs to lift cinematic experience to a next level.

Graphically the game is beautiful and there is a lot of interesting designs on levels and if I had not done some research I'd say that this was based on some real kids' cartoon. The world is filled with colors and they are inhabited with animals with many colors and it was nice to see  the game speaks out for equality. Red-colored folk for example are racist until they realize that uniting and fighting for common good is better option. Music deserves praising as well.

While the graphics and concept are in shape it still does not mean that it should be enjoyable and unfortunately that is the case with Last Tinker, which has fighting, puzzles and platforming, but all this is so simplified that I couldn't avoid feeling that I was being stalled bit too much. For example fighting is fun maybe once or twice but then it begins to feel just like a heavy marble chained into a leg. There is a bit variation on harder or boss battles, but not enough. Same goes with platforming and even as I call it with that I am not sure is it actually platforming or automatic proceeding because all climbing running and jumping happens automatically if you keep pressing specific buttons. So it is definitely not same kind of experience that you could have with Crash Bandicoot or Spyro -games.

In conclusion whether The Last Tinker: City of Colors allures with the graphical outlook the cons in gameplay outshine the pros. But if you are a kid or are buying this for a kid between 7-12 I believe that you might have a decent game here. Peace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061225352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1593528702}
review:
The Last Tinker: City of Colors is a fantastic, vibrant and fun game to play and I think it would be very suitable to younger children as a platformer game. 

There's plenty of playtime for what the game is and even boasts challenges at certain points but overall it is an easy and simple to understand game. The story really pairs with the scenes and environments you see in the level design, showing contrasts as well as in-your-face colour schemes. It touches on social issues in a more light-hearted way than some games might as well as supporting the idea that life is boring without colour!

I loved the characters and collectable challenges throughout the game, even though the Tinker Music achievement took me several attempts it was well worth the fun! 

Additionally, I love a game with a good musical score, and this game is no exception. The music really suited the gameplay.

I thoroughly recommend buying and playing this wonderful little game.

review: Es un juego algo entretenido, principalmente enfocado para ni√±os. Su nivel de dificultad no es muy alto, imposible compararlo a un banjo-kazooie pero para iniciar a un ni√±o en los videojuegos puede servir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262626587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 373, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1590437787}
review:
What is The Last Tinker: City of Colors ?

I discovered this game during a sale and I was kinda surprised due to how cheap it was and the previews in the store page showed that it didnt look bad at all, in fact it looked great and well-polished, I didnt know what this game was exactly about other than it was a cheap indie that looked beautiful but the tags said it had platform and adventure elements and as someone who loves those types of games and wish for more of them from time to time I gave a go, it was cheap why not ? sadly this game was pretty disappointing and despite being cheap, its not just because of the price but also the fact that you have invest your time on the game, it doesnt matter if its cheap if its not good enough, a game that isnt good enough will not make the time you spent on it worth it, unless youre just looking for a game to increase your library size this review is for people who discovered this game and are deciding if ITS WORTH PLAYING at least and Ill explain that below.

Again, I didnt know what I was getting into but the tags and the game's description on the store page compares it to a modern take on Banjo-Kazooie and as someone who loves that game I expected a similar vibe, a similar type of gameplay, I expected us to go into separate stages with different settings each through a hub world, getting collectibles, learning new moves and such, you know the same formula we saw on those classic platform games, the game description said and compared itself to that, Im not lying here so based on that info I went in expecting a platforming of sorts but it isnt really, the platform we actually have here is just holding space and seeing the character doing everything himself, why a platforming game has no dedicated jump button to let us freely jump, why the platforming is automated ? why take the control away from the player ? let me do my own shit, theres no dedicated jump button here, also no cool stuff/puzzles to solve either by using your new characters abilities or tools, maybe a few times in the game interacting with objects or like using powers such as stop the time or creating a shield to protect yourself against instakilling stuff but those are rare and their usage is barely noticeable, theres no actual puzzle or stuff to solve here that would award me me with something, for a platform game we only get 2 collectibles, a crystal currency to improve my damage and health points and the other is just a bunch of concept art photos.

It was a lie from the developers to compare or say this is a modern take on Banjo-Kazooie because despite the mumbo-jumbo language and the light-hearted vibe, this is more comparable to a lego game than anything else, you just walk around and fight enemies in a pretty linear way, theres no specific hub world or different stages, youre always going to a objective marker, the game is very linear and the gameplay is so simplistic it gets repetitive, I have no complaints about the art design, its colorful, detailed and beautiful, soundtrack is nice and the story is fine for a game like this, its a beautiful-looking and cute indie title, the shame part about it is that they choose the wrong gameplay to insert into the nice world they've built here, if the devs had an actual inspiration from the classics they said they were comparing this game to, maybe we coud have gotten an engaging and fun gameplay, instead of this extremely basic and simplistic repetitive boredom, theres personality and potential here but sadly once I finished the game I was already forgetting about what happened on it and I cant recommend it because of that, it was a very mediocre experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073636789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1590265822}
review:
De entrada voy a matizar que pese a que no lo recomiendo en general puede ser una opci√≥n factible para ni√±os muy peque√±os. Ahora pasar√© a hablar del juego:

The last tinker es un juego de aventuras (que no de plataformas), conviene recalcarlo porque aqui ni siquiera hay boton de saltar, por lo que nadie que venga buscando plataformas debe esperarlas. A partir de ese punto nos encontramos un juego basicamente mediocre en todos sus apartados salvo a nivel gr√°fico. Pero en lo que se refiere a la acci√≥n y todo lo dem√°s es muy muy simple, tanto, que es practicamente imposible que llegue a divertir a un adulto.

Hay gente que lo compara con las buenas epocas de juegos como Banjo kazoiie o Jack and Daxter. Hay que estar como una regadera para hacer semejante comparaci√≥n. Banjo kazoiie siendo un juego de 1998 es infiniamente m√°s prfundo y divertido a nivel jugable que esta cutrada.

Asi que ya sabeis, si es para un ni√±o puede divertirle, pero si veniis aqui por nostalgia como ha sido mi caso, preparaos para una decepci√≥n a no ser que tengais las expectativas por los suelos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066847575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1589342879}
review:
Good:
Story - So far, interesting.

Bad:
Bullsheet Lvl design - Everything is a 1 hit kill on the  environment. Bushes kill you if you accidentally touch one and there are EVERYWHERE. There are other hazards too besides bushes but what is the point if everything kills you in 1 hit.

Bullsheet Jumps - You dont actually jump, You run towards a ledge and hope for the best. It should jump on its own but sometimes it doesnt, most of the time you are  little bit off and many times you wonder where the f you should be going. When it does jump you have 0 control over it so more often than not you might be falling to your doom.

How angry can you get from bullsheet jumps and bullsheet cheap deaths? A LOT. I cant believe how bullsheet the mechanics and design for this game are. I am so angry and only played it for a bit more than 1 hr and a half. Most of that was replaying bullsheet sections with cheap deaths. 

This game is S H I T. <uninstalled>

PS: For real, the story was decent and wanted to know more. If you can get past the BS migh be worth it. Get it on sale if you must.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202080828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1651410094}
review:
√à stressante. Punto. Anche giocato a difficolt√† "per bambini".
Essere colpito una volta sola, a distanza, e riportato al precedente punto di controllo, senza potermi difendere, e anche lontano da quella che sembra essere la zona di azione del nemico, √® poco piacevole.
Alcuni livelli sono molto lunghi ma √® disponibile solo il salvataggio automatico, che a volte viene segnalato anche senza che uscendo e rientrando in gioco si riparta da l√¨.

[AGGIORNAMENTO: Ho provato a contattare il supporto, per sincerarmi se lo strano comportamento fosse dovuto a un bug. Hanno risposto in tedesco e inglese, dicendomi che l'assistenza era disponibile solo per i giochi elencati in fondo al messaggio, ovviamente questo √® escluso, e che per tutti gli altri giochi dovevo arrangiarmi.]

Encomiabile che abbiano provato a trattare un tema come il bullismo ma, almeno fino a dove sono arrivato nella storia, √® trattato davvero male.
Dal punto di vista del protagonista invece a volte deve tirare un pugno a un PNG per liberarlo, e va bene, per√≤ √® anche libero di picchiare chi vuole senza ragione e senza una reale ripercussione.

Il sistema di comandi √® migliorabile: quando corro o scivolo senza potermi fermare non sempre prende i comandi nel momento giusto.

Gradevole il sistema di dialogo a fumetti, ma a volte per leggere i fumetti secondari devo avvicinarmi e girare apposta la telecamera, scomodo.

√à colorato, certo, ma (a mio gusto) meno gradevole di quanto appare nelle immagini nella Pagina del Negozio.

Very nice adventure game, that suffers the colors and worlds (different bioms) shortage.
The gameplay is really smooth, the 'mumbling' (voiceover) is cute, the music and graphics are nice.
"The Last Tinker" also utilizes it's own game mechanics, which are good.
Go and play this.
And, hey, the only thing I really don't like - is how they use poor Biggs and Bomber. Guys, this is unfair - we're striking, smashing, blowing our good friends over and over again!

I instantly liked this title. 
Easy movement system.
Bit weird "jumping" but after 30 seconds one have gotten used to it: Not yet in my muscle mememory thou after 30 min of a first try.
But yes this I like.

Recommended at a sale.
Perfect starting game for a 3 year old to get used to moving around in a 3d environment with and entertaining enough for an adult to become "hooked".

En general es un juego m√°s que decente y divertido. Eso si, el dise√±o art√≠stico del juego es una pasada. Si te llama la atenci√≥n y lo ve bien de precio, merece la pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326524999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1584839931}
review:
This game is boring,  no voice acting which isn't a big deal but definitely better than the "noises" each character makes when talking, The platforming is Okay at best but when the main part of at the game is Okay, then we have a problem. 

Despite my laptop being a fairly good laptop, the game ran weird. It looked like it wasn't going 60 FPS despite me first setting everything up at 1080p Medium Settings and the controls are annoying.  

A part is somewhat glad there is no jump button because playing this game on mouse and keyboard doesn't feel ideal to me. It works just fine but I never felt confident in what I was doing because the game never felt "right." 

There is basically little to no challenge in this game, automatic jumping is involved and the combat is okay at best. I never felt stuck anywhere and I was never confused. The enemies are total pushovers and the first boss was straight up disrespectful simply because of easy he was. 

I don't like any of the character designs with the exception of the Main character simply because he looks the most unique character in the game. Every character I have come across looks the same and I don't really see any uniqueness. It doesn't help that there's a character who is kinda like Navi from Ocarina of TIme only except less useful and has a noise that I find more annoying. 

Really this game is just Okay at best but it's definitely not worth the 10 USD that it's originally priced at but for 1 USD, I guess it's alright.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290186073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1584850492}
review: Let me just start by that I expected the game to be extremely childish, which in a way it could be as it is absolutely kid-friendly, however the puzzles in it and tasks are fun even for an adult. I'm playing on normal mode and found myself stuck a few times, never for too long, but this game uses logic and tactics and while it helps you a lot, some things are really up to you to figure out. The story is very likeable too, it is simple yet interesting and very symbolic. I would definitely recommend it. Never expected it to be this fun, especially that the first half an hour of gameplay or so seemed very Sesame Street to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054544473', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1584236071}
review:
A great game for kids that even adults can enjoy. 

The controls are simple enough, even in normal mode, that it should be easy for even young kids to get a handle on. If you're an adult and you don't mind having a relaxing game to enjoy once in a while I'd recommend this one. The story is simple enough to understand and has good morals to teach the younger ones playing. No one color has to be the best, everyone has their positives to share, work together to defeat the bigger enemy, ect. Just enjoy having fun for once without having to have the game punish you to feel accomplished. 

My only major complaint with the game is the end boss. Not hard but because of how it's set up it's based on pure luck and I found it painfully tedious for no real reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198446486079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1582761093}
review:
Genuinely lovely to look at, with a neat soundtrack and very fun gameplay, it would be best if you just enjoyed it for what it is instead of holding it up against the games of your youth. (Let's face it, none of us are objective about those games anyway. We loved them as kids, and so the rose-colored glasses are firmly on us as adults.) 
At any rate, I've been playing it all afternoon and having a genuinely enjoyable time. No, there isn't a jump button per se, but I really feel like everyone should just relax about that. The hold-and-jump parkour effect is perfectly reasonable, and you still get to make timing decisions in your leaps (in case that's something you love and don't want to miss out on.) You gain powers as you go that allow you to choose how you approach combat (if you want to punch and do combos, you can do that, but after a certain point if you'd rather punch a guy and aim to send him running off a ledge in terror, you can do that instead) you do a lot of parkour through some very pretty landscapes, figure out some varied puzzles, and help out a lot of odd denizens of your world as you attempt to bring both color and harmony back to your town. It's a great deal of fun and worth a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075282807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1542505292}
review: I have no earthly idea who the audience for this game is.  The gameplay is a bit complex for kids, but the narrative lines up with a kids' game.  Whatever, it's good enough to play through once at least, but I recommend the higher difficulty for adults.  It crafts a believable world and has a few truly good moments and core mechanics, such as the aforementioned lack of normal jump functionality.  It's not a jumpless platformer though, as you jump automatically when you can and are moving to do so, but this doesn't make the platforming simple by a long shot.  As a result, it kinda feels like Assassin's Creed parkour at certain points, probably on purpose.  Give it a gander if you're looking for a decent game and have the money to spend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122258825', 'num_games_owned': 3711, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 1035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1581898433}
review:
[list][*][b][h1]Morlan's shorts:[/h1][/b][/list]
A teen (or even jounger) audience, is more likely to enjoy this colourful adventure game. This doesn't necessarily mean though that other..generations won't appreciate it. Basically it is a feel-good game as the challenges are hardly taxing and you'd play it mostly for the story and the warm messages (and the silly over-colourfulness). The world looks nice, although it could do with a bit more colour, and the music suits the game nicely and is kind of transparent; it doesn't become tiring to listen to. Bar a few camera angle annoyances, knowing the simplicity of the gameplay you're walking into.. it could be fun (while on sale..)
[b]Don't waste more time reading lengthy reviews.. time is of the essence![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198102252359', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1578991801}
review:
Fun 3D platformish collectathonish game. I add the ish because it has some elements of what you would expect from those kinds of games. 
The art is wonderful and overall the story is fun and quirky. 
Some annoyances with the controls, but nothing you don't eventually get used to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026465707', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 8347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5436, 'last_played': 1622367026}
review:
A game a bought for my 4 year old's birthday, that has been absolutely perfect for him. At first I had to help him quite a lot, but now he plays the game flawlessly.

Nice story line, beautiful colourful scenery, charming mechanics, nice soundtrack: the game very much reminds me of an old PS1 game like Spyro or Croc.

mimimi have released 2 lovingly made games now, I look forward to what they release next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075146276', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1577657024}
review:
Recommended.
One of those games you expect to be silly/too easy/for kids but no!! There is challenge throughout the game and it surprised me a lot! Nice intuitive mechanics and LOTS of humorous reference, from Monty Python to Bob Ross.
Congrats to the develop team. Reminded me of the days of Jak & Dexter or Ratchet and Clank.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042807247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1495059305}
review: A charming and kid-friendly adventure game. As the game advertises, there is no jump button. Instead there is a parkour system kind of similar to that of "Assassin's Creed" where you hold down a run button and your character will automatically jump from platform to platform. The whole mood of the game is lighthearted and, while not difficult by any means, I had myself having fun throughout the whole playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094616078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1576392618}
review: This reads like a mix of Jak & Daxter meets Inside Out and I'm really surprised I hadn't heard of this game sooner because it's really neat! I like the design themes how the game manages to weave color into a story, with unique characters, memorable levels, and an interesting world to explore. There's enough content for achievement hunters to spend a dozen or more hours, but the core game can be knocked out in a single sitting if you're keen, although perhaps breaks are better. The game is solid technically: I encountered no bugs and overall found it polished and tight. The one complaint I had was the rail jumping segments, as the quick speed and slow camera made the obstacles a bit hard to foresee and react to. Everything else presented as a fair casual challenge. All in all, I'm very glad I decided to give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198394732752', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1574644421}
review:
A little while in, my heart sank, because I realized that it was true: this is a kids' game.  It's here to remind us of 3D Platformers on the N64, of which I've never been fond.  It has the goofy characters, the grunts-and-gurgles "voice acting", and the wonky world design that makes you never really sure whether you're supposed to be able to traverse any given area or not.  It's a little clunky, it's somewhat buggy, and it's a 3D Platformer in which jumping is just something that happens automatically, like in a 3D Zelda game.  And yet...

The story is surprisingly well thought out; without getting into spoiler territory, the citizens of the eponymous city of colors all distrust each other, and the overall goal is to bring them together with the power of yeah yeah; you've heard this song and dance a million times before.  The thing is, though, that the way the same old solution unfolds isn't just some nonsense about the power of love and friendship; it shows a very believable development of the unity between the different species that live there.  "Racism is bad" isn't that unusual or profound a message, but it's a very good one, and if you're going to be a kids' game with a lesson, teaching your audience to just get along instead of worrying about what group everyone belongs to is a fine lesson to be learned.  Showing the value of working together is a good way to teach the message, too, and that's important; a great message is worthless when it comes off as naive idealism, even to a child.  When you're exploring a world and solving puzzles, it's easy to forget what it's all for, but this game does a good job of weaving it into the very design of the world you're trying to save.

The world is extremely praiseworthy, too.  SO MANY games take place in "a world much like our own, but with way more ninjas and dragons and zombies and stuff," but this world was designed like they actually cared about it.  It looks a bit of a mess at times, but that's also part of its charm; you're not just treading the same grasslands, forests, deserts, etc. that you have a million times before.  There are a few familiar biomes, but they've been decorated in a unique visual style that doesn't really look like anything else.  There are also quite a few towns to explore, each of which would be distinct even without the coloration.

Though I have my qualms with it - it's no masterpiece - the gameplay is at least good, and that's the most important thing.  My recommendation comes mostly because the team designed this game like they care - sad as it seems for that to be so noteworthy - and the result isn't just one hot creative mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974487036', 'num_games_owned': 789, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1703468749}
review:
I'm not much for platformer style games 3D or 2D outside of Psychonauts (never played Spyro or Crash) but Tinker is the most laid back and beautiful experience I have ever had in a game before. The story and art style are absolutely whimsical and to me very engaging. I honestly feel like I want to help the inhabitants of the City of Colors and getting to explore their world while I do it is just a bonus.

PLEASE NOTE SAVE SYSTEM SUCKS FAT DONKEY BALLS. It totally doesn't save when you finish things and is horrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120391870', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1562060364}
review:
I really loved this game. It is pretty casual as far as a lot of the puzzles are concerned but at least their is a difficulty scale for the game. 
I enjoyed how completionist friendly it is, with the ability to replay levels at will and the collectable amount saves when you leave. 
The overall art style is just absolutely charming which marries beautifully with the OST in this game. 
The story was really heart wrenching and despite it aim towards younger audience touches on some heavy subjects.  Overall the game is worth a go if you love platformers
