author: {'steamid': '76561198044541487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1560208869}
review:
Really enjoying this one! It's more than worth the price, and I got it on sale which made it an absolute steal. 

This is a fully fleshed out, beautifully rendered world with its own simple but coherent lore and honestly a stunning scale. The story is definitely kid-friendly but not without substance. Visuals are wonderful, characters are silly but fun (a notable lack of female characters but... what can ya do), music is GREAT, puzzles are unique and fun; I've really been having a great time. 

I'm bad at the fighting but that's typical of me for most games. Controls are overall very fluid and nice, and the pathfinding of the NPCs that you control is surprisingly tight, which is cool. 

I will say that I had some difficulties booting up the game; the current version would take 10 minutes to load and then not  register my keystrokes during the first cutscene, so I had to load the "troubleshooting" beta (which works great). Another thing of note is that if you're playing on PC, a middle scroll mouse button is ESSENTIAL to progress in the game past about the first third, which was problematic to me as I was playing on laptop touchpad (an external mouse obviously helps). 

These are inconvenient issues but honestly this game is worth it. It's a hidden gem, pure pleasure with real thought and care put into the details; it's unbelievable that something that is honestly AAA quality (it reminds me a lot of Sly Cooper and others) was made by such a small team starting as a UNIVERSITY project. It's a well-worth-it romp.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030533698', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1560929070}
review:
All right. First of all. If you have not played this game yet, buy it, play it. NOW!
You will not regret it. The scenery is beautiful and the colors just pop.
If you are looking for a great game, make sure to add this one to your wishlist.

By the look of the game it is clear that it is aimed at children, but teens and young adults can get a kick out of it too.

Make sure to spread the word about this game, because it does not get nearly as much attention as it should get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040037265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 468, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 919, 'last_played': 1706121955}
review:
[code]Puedes ver m√°s rese√±as como esta en la mentor√≠a [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34129733/][u]PIXEL 404[/u][/url][/code]

[h1]Esta rese√±a no contiene spoilers[/h1]

The Last Tinker me ha parecido un juego √∫nico en muchos aspectos, pero, sobre todo, en su nivel art√≠stico, el cual es simplemente magn√≠fico. 

El juego nos pone en la piel de un mono que vive en Colortown, un mundo donde los colores son los protagonistas y todo est√° hecho a partir de papel, cart√≥n y cola. 

Al principio de la historia, y una vez pasado un breve tutorial, el mundo de Colortown se ver√° sacudido por un terrible suceso y nos colocar√° en primera l√≠nea para salvarlo tanto a √©l como a sus desdichados habitantes.

El mundo de Colortown se divide en tres zonas con tres colores principales: rojo, verde y azul, y cada uno de ellos tiene sus propios esp√≠ritus del mismo color, los cuales tendremos que encontrar para poder avanzar en nuestra aventura.

Que el mundo est√© hecho de papel, cart√≥n y cola no es un mero detalle, sino que estar√° presente durante todo momento. Los decorados que se han creado para este juego son simplemente preciosos, con un colorido y originalidad fabulosos. De lo mejor que he visto en un videojuego de este estilo. 

Tal vez hayas le√≠do cr√≠ticas hacia este juego diciendo que no es un buen plataformas. Eso es obvio, porque NO LO ES. De hecho, hasta se informa en la sinopsis que este juego es una aventura de exploraci√≥n con peque√±as dosis de beat ‚Äòem up, pero desde luego no es un plataformas.

Nuestro personaje tendr√° que explorar las diferentes partes del mundo, hablar con los personales que lo habitan, buscar por todos los rincones, resolver puzles de mayor o menor grado y enfrentarse a jefes finales. Es cierto que para llegar a algunos lugares tendremos que saltar sobre plataformas, pero el salto se realiza autom√°ticamente cuando pulsamos un bot√≥n determinado cuando nos encontramos cerca de una plataforma, pero eso no quiere decir que el juego sea un plataformas.

Los combates tipos beat ‚Äôem up no ser√°n nada dif√≠ciles la mayor parte del juego, aunque mientras m√°s vayamos avanzando m√°s se ir√° complicando por el n√∫mero de enemigos y el da√±o que causan.

Aun as√≠, no puede considerarse que sea un juego dif√≠cil en ese aspecto, sino m√°s bien tirando a f√°cil. Aunque no te librar√°s de morir en bastantes ocasiones a causa de los enemigos, eso seguro.

El juego sabe implementar muy bien las diferentes caracter√≠sticas que nos presenta, ya que los puzles ser√°n tremendamente graciosos gracias a unos personajes que viven en ese mundo y a los que tendremos que manipular para conseguir avanzar en la aventura.

Para esto, dispondremos de diferentes poderes, basados en los diferentes colores, que har√°n reaccionar a nuestro entorno de manera diferente seg√∫n el color que utilicemos.

Esto no es algo menor, ya que es muy original y se utiliza perfectamente dentro del juego. En ning√∫n momento tendremos la sensaci√≥n de que se nos presentan puzles o situaciones forzadas para utilizar nuestros poderes. Ni mucho menos. Adem√°s, en algunas ocasiones tendremos que pensar muy bien c√≥mo resolver alg√∫n que otro puzle que se nos plantea.

La m√∫sica por su parte, sin ser nada del otro mundo, es agradable y cumple perfectamente con su funci√≥n. La mayor√≠a de los temas son tranquilos y relajantes, y algo raros tambi√©n en algunos casos.

En definitiva, The Last Tinker es un gran juego que ofrece originalidad por los cuatro costados, con una presentaci√≥n gr√°fica realmente sobresaliente y una jugabilidad tremendamente divertida y original. Muy recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 5607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5607, 'last_played': 1555438997}
review:
The Last Tinker, while being a game clearly aimed at a younger audience, is a very neatly programmed and uniquely designed little action adventure with a good mix of story, exploration, platforming and combat. Not difficult, but not too easy either. I was actually positively surprised by the well executed balance of mechanics.

the art design is somewhere between cute and Paper Mario, most of the props in the world deliberately look like cardboard cutouts and while at first it looks a bit weird, it feels authentic to the game world and was properly designed around that particular setting.

Don't expect something too complex, but expect to be properly entertained if you decide to go along with the ride. While the game does everything in its ability to look cute, the actual mechanics are well executed and don't have to hide behind other games of its genre.

For a little indie title, I was positively surprised, even although the lack of budget shows especially in the lack of voice acting. This was masterfully disguised with floating and actually 3D-rendered cardboard cutouts for speech bubbles though, so it does not feel detrimental at all and actually adds to the style of art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142363867', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1554865894}
review:
As usual, Daedalic never ceases to publish a game that is well-polished, heartwarming, and an overall great experience. Furthermore, I think this is one of the best games they published so far, developed by Mimimi. This game was buried in my hidden folder for ages, after I tried it for 5 minutes, and never felt very comfortable using the controller. After looking through my folder (and getting the hang of keyboard and mouse controls), oh boy, was I wrong in waiting this long to play this.

The story is actually amazing. I got super emotional in the [spoiler] green [/spoiler] and [spoiler] blue [/spoiler] section, as I could relate, since I know what it means to be gripped by anxiety and depression, respectively. [spoiler] I got super emotional watching the reds and the greens bonding, after finishing the green section, and it was equally emotional when, at first, you made Admiral Bluebeard feel safe, but later, you feel safe in his presence, further showing how the blues, at their best, are the color of fortitude. [/spoiler]

These are all examples of how well the story was written. 

As a video game music enthusiast, the music of the game was just excellent. If the game has an OST, i'm definitely getting that. The art is simply charming too, and the fighting is actually well-made, fast, and id-quenching. Though, a word of caution, if you want the game to be fairly challenging, never go normal mode. Hard mode makes it play like a fairly tough game. 

Overall a great experience, and the only thing I can feel, among all the bittersweetness since I just finished the game, is sincere gratitude. Thank you for this experience, Daedalic and Mimimi, and everyone who worked hard to create such an amazing experience.

Tl;Dr : ye, its gud. buy it. Practically a crime not to buy it.

review:
great game. The story itself is equally fun, you play as a monkey that has to unite 4 different factions against a common enemy

challenging at parts but overall an easy game to play if you're looking for something easy going it's definitely for you. Although it is a relatively short game (100% complete in under 15 hours), there are lots of levels (20 or so) that are full of combat, traversing obstacles and easy puzzles to deal with with a harder than expected boss at the end that incorporates everything you learn throughout the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027319322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1545841347}
review:
This game has been sitting in my library for 4 years, until I decided to randomly choose a game to play. This game is what I would call a HIDDEN gem. Who knows about this game anyway? What is it about? A colorful 3D platformer about colors, friendship, separatism + unity, teamwork, creativity. In the first hour I almost gave up, because it was really easy and shallow, but then the story, the puzzles and the battles started getting really interesting which hooked me. It is still a very linear and easy game, but regardless, one that deserves your attention. Ah and Bob Ross is in it.

I love the music and the really silly (childish?) humor... and of course, the graphics: I'll try to find more games with this kind of art.

EDITED AFTER FINISHING THE GAME: well, the game is worth it just for the musical level, the orchestra and the ending of the story. It didn't disappoint me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000082399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1401794205}
review:
"Do you recommend this game?" Absolutely. Mimimi Productions brought back a lot of nostalgia with this 1 and it didn't even require a remake. They did it all fresh & from scratch while creating something unique and their own.

I enjoyed the game from start to finish and the gameplay was nicely varied between puzzle solving, grinding pipes, riding weird mushroom people etc....

The story was intriguing although a little bit cliche-ish, it is however a semi-childish x teen game. Very reminiscent of the games it was inspired by like Crash & Jak.

I really do hope we get a sequel for this because the developers are like what Naughty Dog were back in the 90s and there's not much of that around these days.

At just over 6 hours of play as well, it's a pretty damn good price for around $15-20AU. Definitely pick this up if you're looking to get in touch with your inner child & teen or if you're looking for a unique adventure game.

review:
[h1]Good Game for kids[/h1]
Runs Smooth, looks good and sounds good
BUT the simplicity can make it near impossible for adults to enjoy it

author: {'steamid': '76561198162381766', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1539526064}
review:
Un gioco simpatico che non fa rimpiangere la mancanza di un tasto di salto, anzi, il level design sposa proprio questa mancanza. Le musiche sono carine e c'e un p√≤ di variet√† nelle meccaniche, non √® sempre un platform, diciamo che lo √® all'80%. Il target del gioco sono bambini dai 3 ai 5 anni massimo. Per via della grafica colorata e del mondo di cartone apprezzato in quella fascia di et√†. E' anche piuttosto duraturo se cercate tutti i penelli nascosti nei vari livelli o voler fare tutti gli achievement in una sola partita. Se non fate queste cose il gioco durer√† sulle 6-7 ore totali, non di pi√π. 

A chi consigliare questo gioco ? Ai bambini a prezzo pieno, si divertiranno, anche perch√® la storia tratta il valore dell'amicizia tra tribu diverse. Tutti gli altri potrano anche non prenderlo, solo yoka laylee lo supera in tutto. Senza contare che devo segnalare dei freeze e una schermata blu durante la mia partita, cosa mai successa con il titolo sopra indicato. Oltre a un calo di frame rate nella zona del mercato con poche persone. Segno di non ottimizzazione dell'engine di gioco. Ed ho una rx580 con 8gb.

Quindi consigliato solo ai bambini a prezzo pieno o in saldo. Per gli altri, se vogliono un platform colorato con difficolta medio-bassa prendetelo in saldo. Altrimenti passate pure oltre, non √® un gioco per voi. ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198336386479', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1539163298}
review:
Short review: This is a cute platformer about creativity, friendship, unity and all things nice. I recommend buying it.

Long review:
You're the monkey Koru, who also happens to be the Last Tinker, a.k.a. the only one who can save the City of Colours from an unknown enemy called the Bleach. The Bleach wants to destroy the City of Colours, because the inhabitants have divided themselves into a red, a green and a blue nation, who don't want to mingle with each other anymore. So yeah, a kid's game with a simple story suitable for all ages. 

The game can be played with both mouse+keyboard and the controller, but I only tried mouse+keyboard. The controls are simple enough: use wasd to walk, f to interact with objects, space to run or overcome obstacles and your mouse move the camera or attack. You can unlock several attacks by buying them with the gems your enemies drop, and unlock special abilities by discovering and helping the color spirits. 
The camera is a bit weird at times, but overall I can't complain.

There are several fun minigames and puzzles within the game, but nothing too hard. In fact, the Last Tinker is not a challenging game and unless you want to unlock every piece of concept art and every attack, you can finish it in less than 9 hours. But I think it's nine hours and 9,99‚Ç¨ well spent. The game is simple but fun, it's optically charming, and the soundtrack is very nice and catchy, too.

So if you're looking for a game for your younger sibling/child/grandchild, or if you simply need a break from being a grown-up all the time, The Last Tinker is definetly a good choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078832360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1535185749}
review:
I came into this game pretty much blind. I didn't bother watching gameplay videos or anything. I saw the 3D Platformer tag, bought the game on sale, then finally got around to playing it a long time afterwards.

Tinker isn't what I was expecting from the tags. I think of this as more "parkour" than platformer. If you're looking for something along the lines of A Hat In Time or Yooka-Laylee, this definitely isn't it.

The game is well-made, and it's clear that a lot of time and effort went into making it. I encountered minor graphical glitches, but nothing too jarring, or which would stop progression. The game isn't too hard, and I think the length is just about right. I love how you can use Tap to show you the way to your objective (I find the lack of direction in some games rather frustrating), and the puzzles are fairly well-balanced.

On the other hand, the combat is pretty bland. Also, the linear direction, limited movement and lack of jumping all make this feel like less of a platformer. The "collection" aspect of this game is also pretty weak, and the unlocking of extra moves/power-ups is grindy to the point of being not worthwhile.

It's a good game, but I'd definitely suggest watching some gameplay videos so you know what you're in for before deciding whether it's your thing or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013723081', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1534897788}
review:
Hello friends! Welcome to another review, brought to you by RPG Gamer Man. This time i am reviewing The Last Tinker: City of Colors. First off, this game is great for young people. There are even great messeges in the game about working together and uniting together with others to solve problems. Also, the game is quite easy, except for some of the bosses. A child about 7 and up could enjoy this game without any problems. Anyways, here is my pro's and con's:

PROs:

-Nice storyline
-fun platformer
-great messege
-funny characters
-controller support
-hidden collectibles add to replaybility of levels

CONS:

-Well, alot of people on the forum complain about the auto-jump feature. It took me a bit to get used to it, but it is no problem to me. I am only posting this here because people seem mad about it towards the game
-As with other games, repetition can cause bordem to any games. Please play it in moderation.

As you can see, the pros outweight the cons. I really enjoyed this game. It was quite fun to play it and i did enjoy it. I really recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078488811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1534397931}
review:
brilliant game, good sound track, lovable characters. wasn't sure what to expect going in, and was so happy finding this delightful game that brought me back to the aesthetic of olda, brightly-colored, side of comedy platformers like spyro or banjo-kazooie.
that said- this game is a very different kind of platformer and if you want complicated platforming mechanics you might be dissapointed. jumping is semi-automated, yet at the same time has just enough risk it's not too easy, and to be honest works surprisingly well. the mechanics can take some getting used to, but I adapted fairly quickly.
the characters are lovable and have enough depth that you want to see more of them (or i do at least). the character design is brilliant, bright, and frankly adorable, and the story premise has some obvious morals but not so much it's preachy, and the presentation made me smile many times. it's relatively short (i beat it in a bit under 8 hours) but i much prefer the rich, if somewhat short story to one crammed with fillers.
all-in-all recommended if you want a game with the same feel of older adventure-platformers but that isn't afraid to take off in it's own direction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125951873', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1497408085}
review:
This game is an interesting beast. It boasts a world typical of platformers yet this games version of mobility is often more akin  to the Assassins Creed series with how automated the movements are. The real meat of the game is in the fairly simple puzzle and combat systems. Overall the world created here is very unique but it does suffer from a few things.

For starters, this game's idea of scaling difficulty modes seems to be entirely based on adjusting enemy damage outputs. This is common in games, but incredibly lazy. I would have prefered if enemies were maybe faster, or more of them spawned during important combat sections. The hardest difficulty is still a cakewalk for the most part.

My other gripe is that most of puzzles or challenges based around the game's parkour mechanics boil down into timing your movements. I compared its movement to Assassins Creed, however unlike those games I don't feel it works well here. The linear nature of the game make me feel like I'm never truly in control of where I'm headed when it comes to these parkour-like movements. I would have honestly preferred a jump button.

Aside from those, I don't really have much else negative to say. The OST quite decent, the world is very vibrant and the character designs are creative. Even the story was able to hold my attention for the most part.

If you don't mind this game being horribly easy and you get past the unnessecary feeling feeling parkour mechanics, I'd say give this game a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280904665', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1532817725}

The levels are very linear and there is no jump button so that would be an accurate discription, but there's so much more going on here. Great story, great characters, great atmostphere, challenging if you want it to be, there's a painter called Rob Boss and a stoner lizard chilling out in his hidden smoke spot doing smoke tricks while jamming to the catchy melodies mother nature sings to him. Great game.

review: The Last Tinker: City of Colors took me about 5 hours to complete.   Of course I played straight through the story, not worrying about collectables and unlocking abilities.  I don't typically write reviews so I can't give you excellent analysis, but if you are looking to spend your afternoon playing through a quirky platformer-puzzler,  I think this would be a great game to check out.  The biggest draw for me was the atmosphere of the game.  It totally matched the vibes of some of my favorite games from my childhood on the glorious gamecube, like Billy Hatcher, Rugrats Royal Ransom, Spongebob Battle for Bikini Bottom, etc.  I will definitely be returning to this game in the future, when that itch comes back.  TWO THUMBS UP

review: Quando comprei este jogo n√£o esperava que ele fosse t√£o bom assim, e s√©rio comecei a jogar sem compromisso e qndo vi j√° era de madrugada e eu j√° tinha passado da metade da hist√≥ria sem nem perceber... sinceramente foi um dos melhores jogos que j√° tive o prazer de conhecer assim do nada, ele √© muito perfeito, os gr√°ficos s√£o lindos e coloridos e a jogabilidade √© tranquila e intuitiva... √© uma mistura de plataforma com puzzle e uma pitada de hack and slash, mas tudo aplicado de maneira t√£o criativa com uma trama que te prende do in√≠cio ao fim. Os personagens tamb√©m s√£o super carism√°ticos, vc√™ pega amor por cada um deles, e o final te abre a mente pra v√°rias reflex√µes que podem ser adequadas √† nossa realidade, pois n√£o deixam de ser verdadeiras!! O que me fez ficar vibrada a todo instante foi a forma como esculpiram cada fase, sem repeti√ß√µes e sem quebra-cabe√ßas chatos ou √°rduos de resolver... achei sensacional ter que invadir um museu de arte passando escondida dos guardas que ficam fazendo rondas, ganhar poderes m√°gicos com diferentes efeitos nos oponentes (um causa bastante dano, outro faz com que os inimigos fujam e outro paralisa eles), enfrentar um kraken usando bombas de cogumelos, explorar uma caverna onde tudo se movimenta conforme a m√∫sica, escalar um moinho gigante repleto de armadilhas s√≥ pra despertar o esp√≠rito aventureiro de um amigo traumatizado... enfim.. amei demais tudo neste jogo, e embora ele seja curto (5-7 horas de dura√ß√£o) vale a pena cada segundo e te deixa cm uma saudade de todo aquele mundo fofo repleto de personalidades incr√≠veis... que aventura encantadora... fascinante e agrad√°vel para todas as idades!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977855912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1529128830}
review:
This is the type of game that wants to evoke your nostalgia or be good for children, but manages neither. This is the type of game where, if you're really into this type of stuff, you should go for the real deal and buy Yooka-Laylee, or better yet a Nintendo console. Because it's no fix for any seasoned gamer's 3D platformer cravings, and it's too buggy and poorly optimised to give to the kids.

Tinker makes a point of comparing itself to Banjo Kazooie and Jak and Daxter, so lets see what Tinker is missing that made those games so great. You'll know right away from the jerky controls and the low framerate on your high-end PC that the devs are either not as skilled or as conscientious as the people who made the classic platformers, despite having access to newer technology and software. Banjo Kazooie plays as smooth as butter after playing this. The controls to the rail system are so poorly designed, that children will get stuck and disappointed. These segments of the game are nothing but frustration, and shouldn't exist. There are odd little bugs aplenty elsewhere too, too many to mention.

After playing the game for a bit, we find an incohesive mash of characters that simply lack charm. The art department has gotten stuck in a pit as the areas of the game are divided by colours, meaning everything is red then everything is green etc. Instead of using this as an interesting way to implement texture shading, or even gameplay mechanics, Tinker has simply whacked the same Rayman 2 style patterns over each area. The basic colour idea is a bit of a dud in itself, as instead of the levels having interesting and varied themes like say, the four season (Banjo Kazooie), or an island covered in mist (Jak and Daxter), the only difference between the themes of the levels in Tinker is that of the difference between a primary and secondary colour. The overall effect is tedious and annoying,

The progression of the actual gameplay itself follows a solid structure, it's not repetitive, it builds upon former mechanics and the level design has a rapid pace. But this shrouded in derivative (not inspired) art and poorly programmed gameplay make this another bland face in Daedalic's astoundingly mediocre selection of mid-range games.

Someone who's never played a platformer before might enjoy this. But if you're getting this for your kids, start them with a good education, and buy them a 3DS instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088387173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1527650978}
review:
The world is full of chaos and uncertainty, volcanos and gun violence, and the AAA, AA and indie titles are flooding in with themes of stressful walking try not to die from the cold simulators, unending world domination RTS, zombie/alien/monster apocalypses, games where the Nazis won or the Orcs rend other orcs innards out.  

This game however is about none of that. And that is why I like it. Fun, well made, easy to pick up, the kids can watch or play, simple yet thoughtful story, cute yet cheeky. Reminds me of Jak and Daxter, Spyro, Crash Bandicoot and Ratchet and Clank, games that destress not simulate stress. Thanks Mimimi!

review:
Child-like colourful aesthetic, simplistic controls (although running/jumping mechanics and limitations are similar to Assassin's Creed games, as other reviews note), and a nice long story, even if the pacing doesn't seem to fit at some parts. Wouldn't call it boring, unless you plan on sitting and playing it nonstop for more than 2-3 hours at a time.

(Collecting enough collectibles unlocks God Mode, if you ever find the combat and teeming hazards (literally white goo everywhere) tiresome.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999938574', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 590, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1526232448}
review:
The Last Tinker is surpisingly good for what it is: essentially an adventure for children. Even though it's easy and doesn't have much gameplay depth, the game is really fun and offers a story and characters even an adult will love.

If you are looking for a great family platformer/adventure game, look no further.

P.S. At times the game really reminds of Psychonauts: it has a similar colorful and bizarre world, and also lets you get into someone's dreams.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998455537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 809, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1524313889}
review:
The Last Tinker : City of Colors is a child's action game. The style is very reminescent of Psychonauts. You play as the Last Tinker and your objective is to save the world of Colourtown. It's a 

Gameplay-wise, it's meant for controller play. Keyboard play is slightly confusing with interaction keys on F, run on Spacebar, Ctrl for aiming and Jump on Shift. Most of the gameplay is similar to any action game, like Assassin's Creed, Alice, Tony Hawk. 

Combat is similar to games like Batman : Arkham Series, where you dodge and punch. However, there are very interesting mixups like using colours to defeat your enemies. Depending on the colour you use, you can make your enemy's mood change. Red is for angry, Blue is for sad and Green is for fearful. Blue makes your enemies depressed and you can do a critical strike from behind. Green makes them fearful and causes them to run away in fear.

Conclusion, do try The Last Tinker : City of Colors. The design of the game encompasses many of the common topes seen in other games while creating a twist on the gameplay. The varying monster mechanics ensures that the game doesn't dull over time.

Note : The developer is Mimimi.

[h1][b]PROS[/b][/h1]
1. Beautiful World of Colourtown
I loved the imaginative world even if it was for kids.

2. Railriding
Sure, it's a trope. You can find this in Tony Hawk and almsot every other game now but it is still one that is enjoyable.

3. Different Creature Combat Mechanics
I love it. I think the various game studios all share their rigging and AI triggers but I loved every single type of Bleakness, except the Worm Machine. You have your 

a. Minion Bleak (meh) 
b. Ranged Bleak (meh)
c. Shield Generating Bleak (getting interesting)
d. Strong Punching Bleak (meh)
e. Smashing Bleak (meh)
f. Laser Eye Bleak (meh)
g. Boss Bleak that requires colour differentiation (most interesting as I had to stop and pause to colour differentiate)

4. Non-Punching Combat
You can fear your opponents, depress them for a critical strike

5. Boomber and Bob
I love the 2 mushrooms and how you can vary the different actions.

6. Bob Race
I loved it. I loved the running mushroom race.

[h1][b]CONS[/b][/h1]
1. Dojo Moves Don't Matter
Meh. Did I even need the Dojo powers?

2. Only 1 Stage of Sneaking?
You made a sneaking level at the very start of the game and that's it?

[h1][b]NEUTRAL[/b][/h1]
1. Blue Harbour Boss Battle
It was okay but not great. I felt like I was just doing this cycle, use mine, use cannon, release cannon, switch target, rinse and repeat.

2. Tropes
Sticky Jumping, Railriding. Nothing wrong with them. I enjoyed railriding a lot. You can see Sticky Jumping in Assassin's Creed a lot. So, I was hoping for new mechanics. Refer to Suggestions.

[h1][b]SUGGESTIONS[/b][/h1]
1. Other Types of Bleaks
a. Temporarily Invisible Bleak
b. Exploding Bleak
c. Dividing Bleak
d. Aura Bleak
e. Colour Draining Bleak

2. Colour Camouflage
You had 1 sneaking level, that's it. How about chameleon colour camouflage? Imagine a sneaking level where you had to match your colour to the walls. Red skin on red wall, green skin on green wall. If the colour mismatches, the guards catch you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048312377', 'num_games_owned': 1774, 'num_reviews': 332, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1524245303}
review:
A very colorful game... And by writing this... LMAO xD

The story is appealing and feels EPIC and MAYHEM, you just keep on playing. Little humor is subtle, just the right amount of Salt. And the cuteness is overwhelming.

Game controls are a bit weird, but understable, knowing what options you have in total. What I mean is, normally we use SHIFT for running, this game uses SPACEBAR for that.

When characters are talking, you see text bubbles and you hear them talking in a fantasy way. But not annoying like in most of these types of games. Funny but not boring.

Visual effects are very well done, little challenges were interesting...

A very nice action adventure game, very suitable for kids for sure. I am an adult but I do have to say, this game brought a smile on my face while playing and also some little rage moments when I failed over and over. Great for killing time while not feeling guilty by doing so.

So yeah, I recommend it from the bottom of my heart!

author: {'steamid': '76561198155945288', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1522387883}
review:
Let me start this by saying that this game is not difficult, nor was it intended to be difficult. There are multiple, conscious choices the developers made to have this be a story, not a challenge. I would consider it the halfway point between a visual novel and a full-blown action platformer like Banjo Kazooie. Understanding that this game is not designed for people looking for some Wings of Vi level of precision platforming, or even to be as punishing as Spyro, is going to help you enjoy this game for what it is supposed to be: a story, a lesson, an adventure.

This game is not designed to facilitate failure after failure for the player. Sure, the actual platforming is automatic as long as you're pressing the right button, and the boss battles are somewhat underwhelming. But basic combat and the powers you gain are a ton of fun. Smashing enemies with a paint covered fist and saturating them until they explode is highly satisfying. Punching something and watching it turn and run in fear - off a cliff if you aim it right - is funny and enjoyable. You can even buy new moves and upgrade them to really make a (paint) splash.

The story premise is very reminiscent of Dr. Seuss, and to me it was like working my way through The Sneetches if Pixar made it a game. People are discriminatory based on colors, but it's the lack of color and difference that saps away life. Honestly this is a pretty cool and magical game. It's just not what some people expected who wanted a modern BK, Crash, Spyro, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009334801', 'num_games_owned': 996, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1518266451}
review:
Guardate le immagini di The Last Tinker‚Ä¶ cosa vi sembra? Un platform, ovviamente.
Invece NO.
Non √® un platform, √® un.. action adventure pi√π o meno lineare in cui si salta automaticamente, ci si arrampica automaticamente, si dondola automaticamente e solo nei posti in cui si pu√≤ fare.
Chiarito subito questo importante aspetto, passiamo al resto.

La storia riguarda Koru, un ragazzo-scimmia che concorre per il posto di personaggio principale pi√π brutto che abbia mai visto, che vive in una citt√† di colori dove gli abitanti sono divisi in rossi, blu e verdi, ognuno col proprio quartiere e col proprio aspetto fisico. Koru non somiglia a nessuno (infatti √® una scimmia) quindi, oltre a essere giustamente bullizzato e nel caso non fosse chiaro gi√† cos√¨, ha qualcosa di speciale rispetto agli altri: √® infatti un Tinker, uno in grado di usare i colori per fare [i]delle cose[/i]. 
A seguito di alcuni brevi avvenimenti, la citt√† viene invasa dalla Monocromia, ovvero il bianco, che cancella tutti gli altri colori e genera mostri. Il nostro Koru quindi deve andare in giro assieme al suo amico Tap, una specie di maialino-pignatta volante che funge anche da navigatore, per recuperare i poteri dei tre colori primari e riportare la citt√† alla normalit√†.

Come detto, Koru non √® granch√© come personaggio, √® anonimo, non ha alcuna storia degna di nota e il suo mutismo a-l√† Link non aiuta a caratterizzarlo, mentre Tap e i tre spiriti dei colori sono gi√† meglio, almeno sono simpatici e danno vita a diversi siparietti anche meta-gioco abbastanza azzeccati.

Il gioco si snoda attraverso i tre quartieri della citt√†, con una serie di micro-aree nelle quali risolvere brevi enigmi o altri micro-eventi relativi ai NPC, combattere contro alcuni nemici e saltare dove √® previsto che si salti per raggiungere qualcosa. Al termine di ogni zona principale c'√® anche un boss, pochi ma perlomeno ben pensati.
Il sistema di combattimento √® invece il pi√π basilare possibile, con una manciata di mosse e poteri da utilizzare per aver ragione dei piccoli gruppi di nemici. Preciso che il gioco ha anche diversi livelli di difficolt√† che non servono assolutamente a niente, visto che ci sono un sacco di checkpoint e per morire ci si deve davvero impegnare.

Lo stile grafico √® sicuramente la parte pi√π riuscita del gioco, √® bello e colorato, con alcune idee davvero simpatiche (i balloon dei personaggi sono di cartone) e anche la diversa suddivisione cromatica dei quartieri ha un suo perch√©. 
Le musiche sono passabili, le voci sono solo dei miscugli tipo Banjo-Kazooie, e per quanto possa sembrare incredibile √® interamente tradotto in italiano, e pure bene.

La longevit√† √® piuttosto bassa, in 6-7 ore si riesce a portare a termine la trama principale dopodich√© non c'√® molto altro da fare a parte, volendo, rigiocare liberamente i vari livelli per raccogliere i collezionabili ancora mancanti.

The Last Tinker quindi √® un gioco simpatico, senza grandi guizzi, che cerca di scimmiottare (eheh!) altri classici del genere, ma che sembra riuscirci solo sul lato artistico e nei dialoghi. Il resto del gameplay e della trama, complice la scelta di non renderlo un platform libero e di limitarsi alla ricerca dei tre colori in un'area relativamente ristretta come i quartieri della citt√† e dintorni, danno la sensazione che l'intero gioco sembri un preludio a un'avventura molto pi√π grande che per√≤ non arriva mai.
Consigliato, ma solo in sconto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290904383', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1517713894}
review:
Reminded me a bit of Mario Sunshine and Epic Mickey
I like this adventure, it was fun and unique and the story and gameplay were well executed. I plan on going back to get all the collectables and harder modes. I went through on normal and there was some challenge but not enough. Good mode to get to know the game.

On the rail system. 
Those *&^$^%^ rail systems.

Not sure if its just that the controls aren't tight enough (I used a controller and don't get me wrong the controls are decent) or its just awkward but the most challenge I had with this game was trying to survive those *(&@#*$^ rail systems. 

Great title, well worth the play

author: {'steamid': '76561198109654131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1516429153}
review: The game is a bit slow, and not just in terms of the frames. I would love if the motion blur was completely removed from this game. It adds no positive effects to gameplay, and it makes rail-grinding unnecessarily difficult. Motion blur makes the game harder to look at, and obstacles covered up. I am glad that Tap was able to show me the way to my quest marker, or else I would have never completed this game.  Also, holding down the right trigger, and punching, is about the most you'll do in this game. There are better moves that come along, and the spirit powers are great, but red punch will get you through almost all of the enemies. Unless it's the ridiculous beast with color coded crystals on his shoulders and head. I had no idea how to beat that mini-boss, until after dying several times; I figured out that whatever color he has, shoot the opposite at him. Targeting enemies is off kilter as well, until the target finds the enemies itself, which can take a while. There were some fun moments, but I don't recommend playing this game. The voice acting for the blue and green spirits were annoying, but thankfully there is an option to mute all audio. I had more trouble with the crystal bleak monsters, than I did with the end boss. That I don't mind so much, as I don't need much of a challenge to enjoy a game. Another gripe I had was that the platforming was automatic, and if you weren't standing in just the right spot, you would miss the jump spot and lose a life. I also wish that the skip button would fully skip all the conversations that were necessary, instead of just making the words go by more quickly.

review:

Es gibt eine nette Story, die auch mit unserer Welt und dem immer wieder pr√§senten Rassismus gleichzusetzen ist. Gek√§mpft wird nach Schema F gegen strunzdumme Gegner und die verschiedenen F√§higkeiten m√ºssen auch nicht gerade √ºberm√§√üig genutzt werden - man k√∂nnte fast meinen das Spiel versteht es ein wenig zu langweilen. Ich vermute mal, dass "es selbst zu spielen" eindeutig mehr Spa√ü macht als "einen Zuschauer zu haben". Es ist kein Uncharted, aber es ist als L√ºckenf√ºller ganz okay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106249040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1513964862}
review:
It's a bit of a travesty that this is only "mostly positive" (as I write this), considering the amount of rubbish on steam that ends up with a "very positive" rating.

I think the negatives people have can be summed up as:
1. Cannot jump manually
2. Is not banjo kazooie
3. Is somewhat easy/simple/straightforward

If you can cope with the above, then I would highly recommend playing this.

The soundtrack is great, the characters are lovable, the world is charming. I've had a lot of fun with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023923673', 'num_games_owned': 994, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1417978467}
review:
Also das wichtigste f√ºr den Anfang, ich bin unfassbar leicht zufrieden zu stellen was Spiele angeht.
Sprich, mir sind die ganzen Probleme die bisher von anderen genannt wurden, vermutlich nichtmal als Probleme aufgefallen,  aber ich kann zumindest mein Erlebnis des Ganzen beschreiben.

Und ich w√ºrde es ein Erlebnis nennen, so ganz erkl√§ren kann ich das allerdings auch nicht. Meine Wenigkeit hat schon sehr viele Spiele gespielt, aber als Liebelingsspiel w√ºrde ich trotzdem The Last Tinker nennen. Nicht, weil es f√ºr mich einen sonderlich hohen Wiederspielwert hat, oder weil so viele moralische Werte vermittelt werden...

Sondern aus dem schlichten und einfachen Grund, dass dieses Spiel das Einzige ist, bei dem ich mich erinnern kann, beim spielen (fast) gegrinst zu haben, weil das Gesamtkonzept vermutlich einfach gestimmt hat, oder so.

Wie gesagt, ich kann es selbst nicht ganz erkl√§ren, aber muss ja trotzdem mal gesagt werden, und vielleicht ... selbst wenn es ein kleines vielleicht ist, geht es ja auch mal anderen so. Deshalb f√ºr euch diese vollkommen unprofessionelle und mehr als stark subjektive Rezension.

Und damit w√ºnsche ich allen die das Geschreibsel ausgehalten haben noch einen sch√∂nen Tag.

review: This is a game like Ratchet & Clank, Jak & Daxter, Skylar & Plux, etc. One of those you can play completely stress-free thanks to that style that reminds of Bob Ross' (yeah, he IS in the game!!) happy little clouds with the green friendly trees.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051956777', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 997, 'last_played': 1670247230}
review:
This is a great enjoyable game to play. The story is well planned out. And the levels are very well designed.

On a positive but a negative note. Some levels though didn't explain certain things though. Especially for explaining on how to defeat a tougher enemy. Which took awhile to understand what the crystal bleak monster weakness was. But other than that that's all I found that wasn't explained.

It would be nice if the whole Tinker World was open up fully after finishing the story. So you can freely explore other areas. That you couldn't explore during story mode. And to visit purple district.

I would love to see some extra story DLC added as well. With more puzzles to solve. And another boss enemy to resolve. Like a dark character that takes the words from speech bubbles. And it uses the black ink text that the new boss enemy has stolen. To make Tinker World dark. And you need to find a word that rhymes with the missing word from the speech bubble from every character. Each word would be a key phrase. Once stolen words are in the right order. It actually tells you where and how to find and defeat the black ink spirit. Which turns out to be a bad black spirit. That feels unwanted because black isn't an actual color. 

Another DLC story they could add is trying to get information about that girl traveller. That knows more about the Tinkerers. And where the others are. That the current main story had mentioned.

Other puzzles they could add are paint by numbers, coloring in book, color toning colors. And even building a Tinker World from scratch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170310923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1510084872}
review:
I didn't know what to expect from this game except that I loved the look of the graphics in the trailors.
It's a mixture of platform and puzzles and quests and I can say I am really surprised at how beautiful and  endearing this game is.
I have only just started playing it and have spent a couple of hours on it but for me I know that is enough time to say that I am loving it!
I don't like platform games either that much but this is a mixture of all sorts of things and I stuck at it and have discovered a beautiful new world with a great story line  and  humour and some sadness in amongst the people of Colour town it is an origional game with great graphics.
I bought it on sale for ¬£1.69 and It's more than worth it!
The controls are easily managed everything flows nicely.
I have been pleasently surprised by this game and I am very glad I took the chance and bought it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1509812871}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : tr√®s bien.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Un jeu d'aventure/action qui pourrait faire penser √† un platformer, mais on ne peut pas sauter, tous les sauts sont automatiques quand on se dirige dans la bonne direction.

La graphismes color√©s et la direction artistique sont plut√¥t sympa, le jeu ne pr√©sente aucune difficult√©, et la musique est vari√©e et agr√©able. L'histoire d√©gouline un peu trop la guimauve sur la conclusion, mais j'ai pass√© un bon moment !

[h1]Rejouabilit√©, achievements[/h1]

Aucune difficult√© pour les achievements.

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Recommand√©.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente, √† un point pr√®s. J'ai du d√©sactiver les reflets sur l'eau dans l'un des niveaux (alors que... c'est pas comme si y'en avait beaucoup ni que √ßa changeait vraiment quelque chose), sinon j'avais des baisses de framerate assez aga√ßante. A part √ßa, pas de probl√®mes. Le support manette est nickel (avec le Logitech F710 du moins).

OS: Linux Mint 18.2 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, un seul screen X.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043707055', 'num_games_owned': 949, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1518615221}
review:
No esperes un plataformas 3D a lo Crash Bandicoot o Super Mario 64. En este juego no vas a saltar de plataforma en plataforma pulsando un bot√≥n. Compr√© este juego pensando que ser√≠a un plataformas pero me encontr√© con un Zelda con toques de Assassin's Creed de lo m√°s peculiar. Empecemos:

Jugabilidad: Es bastante simple y est√° muy pero que muy bien pensanda: Con la Y interactuas, con el B usas el poder rojo, con la X el poder azul y con la A el poder verde. Simple y f√°cil. Los poderes son b√°sicamente pu√±etas que al darle a un enemigo este reacciona de una forma u otra ingeni√°ndotelas para que los enemigos se maten solos o dej√°ndolos aturdidos. El RT tiene la misma funcion que en los Assasin's Creed: Lo mantienes pulsado para correr y soltear obstaculos cual Ezio Auditore de forma autom√°tica.
El RB sirve para esquivar y si lo usas estando quieto saltas, pero ojo, este salto solo sirve para combinarlos con ataques, ya que como he mencionado antes no vas a saltar de plataforma en plataforma. No es esa clase de juego.
Por el camino nos encontraremos puzzles muy sencillos de resolver y algunos bastante ingeniosos. En sin el juego jugablemente es muy bueno y c√≥modo... tanto que a veces el juego se har√° demasiado f√°cil en algunos momentos, por suerte tiene un modo de dificultad en el que si mueres una vez se te borra la partida. 

Sonido: Est√° bien, sin m√°s. Algunas canciones recuerdan a piezas musicales de viejos plataformas pero como he dicho, el juego no es un plataformero pers√©. Los efectos sonoros est√°n bien y poco m√°s.

Gr√°ficos: A ver, es un juego del 2014 hecho en Unity, para lo que es est√° bien, tiene un apartado art√≠stico curioso cuanto menos y no est√° mal, normalito. Eso s√≠, algunos personajes son un poco feuchos.

Historia: Por normal general, no deber√≠a de dar importancia a la historia en este tipo de juegos, pero quiero mencionarla porque me ha parecido en su conjunto algo bastante original y francamente es una historia decente. No te toma por imb√©cil y es cuanto menos disfrutable e incluso en algunas ocasiones llega a sorprender sobretodo teniendo en cuenta que parece un juego hecho para que los m√°s peque√±os lo disfruten ya que algunas partes de la historia son un poco... oscurillas por as√≠ decirlo. 

Y ya. El juego est√° guay y como he dicho, es un Zelda + Assassin's Creed. Por 2 euros que me lo pill√© est√° m√°s que recomendado.

review: Giochino da bambini non solo per lo stile cartoonesco , la storia √® davvero basilare e il gameplay non presenta particolari difficolt√† , l'ho preso in un momento di saldi per pochi euro pu√≤ anche starci ma ci passerete ben poche ore sopra , in generale gli darei un 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198019838342', 'num_games_owned': 1070, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1243, 'last_played': 1506129650}
review:
This game is great.  It's a game that me and my 3-5 year old son have been playing off and on for the past year or so.  It has a kid-mode so he can experiment and learn without being too hard, yet the game actually has some interesting platforming and combat.  The platforming is assassin's creed ish, where you have to move and hold the "hop/jump" button to complete the jumps.  It's great for kids learning the basics of platforming, they can focus on timing, or positioning, but don't have to worry too much about both ALL the time... although sometimes.  I help him with some of the combat and with some of the harder platforming sections, but the combat is also really nifty.  You use different colors, red/green/blue based upon which button you press matching that color B/A/X and can do combos, leap smashes, hard punches, etc.  The red is just damage, the green is fear, and the blue is a stun.  It's actually pretty fun and cool.  There are also little puzzles where you move a little mushroom buddy, play music, and other little things along the way.

My only gripe is that the saving system is too far apart for me, and especially for a kid playing.  Sometimes you have to play 30mins or so between stretches before saving, which is waaay to long without a manual save method.  I also wish the dialogue was voiced!  I know that was probably a budget constraint, but it would have been pretty cool, especially because my kids can't read yet (although when I was sitting with them I would read it to them, which is not the worst thing in the world).

I am so glad that I found this game and have had a blast playing it with my kids.  I was playing the Shadow Tactics game demo, looked up the developer, and just so happened to be looking for a game to get for me and the kids to play.  The music is fantastic too!  Which it was separate DLC and I would buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969926099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1580251039}
review:
A very nice 3D exploration and action/adventure game. Not really a platformer, due to the lack of a jump button, but the game mechanics work very well with that system (and would be way too tedious with a standard jump button).

Pros :
+ beautiful and colourful environments to explore.
+ nice music and good art direction.
+ okay controls and fighting mechanics. The game is well balanced from beginning to end.
+ interesting coloured attack system (with a different purpose for each colour).
+ nice puzzles (for example, with Biggs the explosive/resizable mushroom).
+ okay storyline (with its funny moments, thanks to the color spirits and their attitude).

Cons
- too short. One or two additional levels would have been nice.
- camera controls sometimes annoying.
- maybe a tad too easy for veteran gamers (but still nice to play).

author: {'steamid': '76561198052264607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1499629616}
review:
A fun, colorful adventure. I would recommend this game if you enjoyed games like Crash Bandicoot or Banjo-Kazooie!

--------------------------------------------------------------------

The game (to me) is somewhat short and the gameplay is very one-directional. You can go back and play previous stages but I haven't delved into that aspect of gameplay yet as it says that all progress you've made on that file ahead of the stage you wish to replay will be lost. I'm not sure I want to have to '100% collection rate' beat the game from the start just to play a later stage with some of the things you unlock from the "collector" items in this game. 
The combat, to me, felt very gimick driven with each new enemy basically having to be defeated in a very specific way or in some cases take excessive damage while you're only able to get hit by them once or twice before you're about to die. Which (to me) made each combat instance feel like a mini-boss.

review:

Un des rares jeux de plateforme 3d potable. Par contre cela reste une petite production, les graphismes font penser √† de la ps2 avec un antialiasing.
Mon principal reproche, c'est le manque de vari√©t√©, que ce soit des niveaux ou des ennemis.
J'ai √©galement regr√©t√© le syst√®me de saut automatique, car on peut peut quasiment pas tomber.

ps : le jeux reconnait bien l manette xbox 360, mais pas avec le steamlink.

Bref, je recommande fortement ce jeux, √† condition de le prendre en solde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080857899', 'num_games_owned': 884, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1498882388}
review:
Antes de tudo, devo ressaltar que esse jogo recebeu algumas reviews e cr√≠ticas negativas por parte de alguns jogadores. E o principal motivo √© simples: The Last Tinker [b] n√£o √© [/b] um jogo de plataforma como muitos √† princ√≠pio tendem a pensar. √â um jogo que envolve explora√ß√£o, a√ß√£o, aventura e resolu√ß√£o de puzzles. O jogo at√© possui alguns fundamentos b√°sicos que lembram um 3D em plataforma, mas seu conceito difere principalmente na jogabilidade. Sua mec√¢nica √© baseada no freerun em que por vezes, pode-se correr e transpor obst√°culos sem interrup√ß√µes. Tamb√©m n√£o h√° movimentos acrob√°ticos control√°veis e coisas do tipo. Esclarecido isso vamos ao jogo.
 
The Last Tinker: City of Color √© um jogo baseado em cl√°ssicos como [i] Banjo Kazooie, Jak & Daxter [/i] entre outros. A hist√≥ria se passa no mundo de Tinkerworld, na cidade de Colortown que est√° sendo amea√ßada de desaparecer por conta de uma praga - The Bleakness - Para entender melhor, imagine um belo desenho exposto sobre uma mesa, ent√£o vem algu√©m e come√ßa a pincel√°-lo com errorex! √â mais ou menos isso o que ocorre em Colortown. 

Colortowm tem como caracter√≠stica ser uma cidade feita unicamente de papel, cola e tinta, e suas cores s√£o como a alma viva da cidade. O √∫nico entre os seres que parece ser capaz de poder salv√°-la √© Koru, um garoto de tra√ßos s√≠mios conhecido por ser um Tinker, criaturas diferenciadas e dotadas de algumas habilidades. Koru por√©m, foi o respons√°vel por liberar a praga ap√≥s ser enganado por conta de sua ingenuidade. Agora, ter√° que juntar for√ßas para reparar o mal que causou. 
 
The Last Tinker √© um daqueles jogos super coloridos que tr√°s aquelas criaturinhas meigas, fofas e carism√°ticas al√©m de altamente emotivas. Tanto a cidade quanto os seres que nela habitam foram feitos para retratar a arte do papel mach√™. N√£o √© √† toa que tamanha simpatia possa tornar o jogo um atrativo para crian√ßas, pois tudo √© muito f√°cil, desde os combates at√© a jogabilidade em si e a compreens√£o da hist√≥ria. Al√©m disso, o jogo emprega o m√≠nimo de viol√™ncia poss√≠vel, passando a adotar uma postura voltada √† hist√≥ria que apesar de modesta tem um sentido moral muito forte. O jogo n√£o possui voice action, mas os devs se esfor√ßaram para fazer algo de qualidade. Os personagens apenas murmuram em loops de som e as falas s√£o representadas em caixas de texto em 3D, como bal√µes que parecem feitos de papel√£o. A trilha sonora tamb√©m √© algo magn√≠fico possuindo m√∫sicas muito expressivas que se adaptam de acordo com a situa√ß√£o ou cen√°rio. 

Falando sobre Koru, Ele praticamente n√£o fala! Apesar de sorrir e esbo√ßar rea√ß√µes, toda interlocu√ß√£o entre ele e os personagens s√£o feitos pelo seu companheiro Tap, um bichinho corajoso apesar de seu tamanho e fragilidade. Koru √© capaz de lutar e usar certos poderes que lhe s√£o atribuidos. N√£o vale √† pena falar muito sobre isso. O que d√° pra dizer √© que durante as lutas, ele pode ficar cercado pelos inimigos e at√© um sinal de alerta (ponto de exclama√ß√£o) aparece quando um inimigo est√° prestes a atac√°-lo. Koru tamb√©m pode lan√ßar proj√©teis; (jatos de tinta) fazer inimigos fugirem por curto tempo e at√© usar um time-lapse para deixar o mundo mais lento. Cada habilidade por√©m, e adquirida com tempo e n√£o de imediato. A verdade √© que a parte de combate √© bem simples e infantil, semelhantes as lutas da franquia de Lego. Entre outras coisas que Kuro pode fazer √© surfar sobre monotrilhos e usar um free rum para saltar automaticamente entre plataformas na √°gua e se agarrar em barras para atingir pontos elevados.

 The Last Tinker √© um jogo muito bonito, simples, e tr√°s uma historinha bacana recheada de doses de humor devido ao comportamento das criaturas. Assim como muitos indies, n√£o possuiu um or√ßamento milion√°rio como o das grandes produtoras para ser feito. Por√©m ele demonstrou grande comprometimento dos desenvolvedores para fazer um jogo de qualidade. E s√≥ isso j√° vale √† pena para entrar nesse mundo de papel, cola, tinta guache...

author: {'steamid': '76561197968748110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1499020124}
review:
A cool concept with a lot of love

The Last Thinker is a fun action/adventure game that holds it's own with an interesting set of characters and designs and borrows from classics we know, such as Wind Waker, and Jak & Dexter.  Game is about Koru, a Monkey who was one day just trying to win a race, and landed up down the road causing the apocalypse of colors.  You are set on a journey to restore the colors, and restore peace to the land, as you battle white and grey monsters with the power of color.  It's a cool concept, and a lot of fun!   At times, the camera can be a little clunky, causing loading issues, but the game runs really good for the most part. Sometimes the story can feel a little bit like cardboard, but it's not a big deal, because where it lacks, it still comes back into.  There's not much voice acting, besides the intro. The characters make funny sounds to talk in their dialogue bubbles.    I got this on sale, and it's well worth it. It's well produced, and fun to play, and worth your time if you love a good action/adventure game.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198052941330', 'num_games_owned': 1051, 'num_reviews': 472, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1430089185}

review: this isnt a platformer but feels like one at first, this game yes, it does take inspiration from Banjo-Kazooie series with the voices (less annoying and lower volumed), Jak & Daxter with the brushes you collect much like the precursor orbs (in Jak 2, 3 and Lost Frontier) but its inspiration for the spirits being based on Eco isnt the case and feels like each its own seprate mechanic and not just a optional item making the player have to use thier whole "arsenal" as they progress not forcefully like Jak & Daxter but progressivly, although there was a reduced number of bosses I was expecting, I would suggest this to anyone looking for a creative "indie" (mainly "" because of the creator company) title inspired by Platformers but feels more like a freeroam exploration game that doesnt force you to go certian places everytime like most modern games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058706108', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1490837798}
review:
Please do not be deceived as I was by the promises of Jak and Daxter and Banjo-Kazooie, which I believe only inspired the developers to make A game, not a game like the ones they mention. As you can see, I only played 30 minutes but that was enough to tell me that this description is false advertising and that is why I really dislike this game.

Other that that, here are the bullet points:

- I can see "inspiration" from LittleBigPlanet, which this game's art style and overall theme feel like a cheap knock-off of.
- I was not looking forward to several more hours of the story, which I imagine would be like watching a cheap after-school special on racism on a loop for hours. Koru seemingly has no personality, he's just automatically great because every person you see says so, except for the antagonist.
- THIS IS NOT A PLATFORMER!! It's a somehow more boring version of the traversal system from Assassin's Creed. Hold a button and move the joystick.
- Combat is not at all challenging. It's button mashing and it feels weak.

Summary: I feel like this is a game designed for younger players, but the developers are trying to cash in on the nostalgia of people that are a lot older than that. If it hadn't made this comparison, I wouldn't judge it so harshly. And I miss Rare so much.

Just wait for Yooka-Laylee folks!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983186143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1490729220}
review:
IN SHORT: This is a wonderful game if you like colorful worlds, a nice (and surprisingly touching) story and easy-going gameplay. It is a smooth ride with the occasional challenge here and there. Clearly the makers put in a ton of love and it shows this everywhere.
Full review below.

Pro
+ Vibrant and colorful world, bitesize levels which fit together coherently.
+ An easy and relaxing ride.
+ Nice story with some clever morals (great for kids as well!)
+ If you look carefully, eastereggs + collectables.
+ Good mechanics around fighting and solving puzzles.
+ Amazing soundtrack!

Con
- Not for people who look for the ultimate challenge.
- Not exactly "platforming", this is automated platforming.

Playing The Last Tinker was a great experience. It reminds a lot of the platform games of old, like from the N64 period. But let's get one thing out of the way straight away: this game took a simpler approach to platforming. In terms of gameplay this means 2 things.
1: It removes all challenge for the real platforming fans out there.
2: this means the game needs to deliver in different areas to make it up.

In my humble opinion I would say it does the latter nicely. The charm of this game is unmistakeable. The game is set in one big colorful world split up in bitesize levels and is really fun to explore. At some point in the story the world is attacked by the "bleakness" which is draining all colors. This means you usually get to see 2 versions of a level. One filled with bleakness and one where it has been cleansed. It is rewarding to return the world to its original looks.

The game has a great story which dares to touch our world's problems (racism for one). Also I could not help but start caring for the inhabitants. Even though communication is done via simple text clouds, it manages to convey the message how the creatures feel about all the happenings. Some are scared, others angry, others sad and hopeless. Not only does this fit with their colors, but it also makes sense and is relatable.

Apart from the "platforming" the game offers just enough combat varience and puzzles to be entertaining. Think along the lines of opening doors by pressing buttons, lowering bridges, guiding helpful creatures with their own abilities (like exploding), finding keys or items, etc. Nothing new, but entertaining anyway.
I also like how the creators experiment with different genre types (even trying "noir" at some point), and how they created some mini-games which actually complement the story.

To top it all off, this game has an amazing soundtrack. Each part of the world is complemented by its own instrumental style. I especially liked the music from the noir level and the blue world in general.

I would say this game is just long enough for what it tries to accomplish. I have had a great time and even felt some genuine emotion here and there. Technically this game also performs great. I had no bugs or issues at all, had steady FPS (though to be fair my pc is quite strong), and found the controller support excellent.

As I wrote above, this game clearly shows the creators invested a lot of love.
Therefore I would recommend The Last Tinker to any gamer looking for a relaxed experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331310816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2557, 'last_played': 1707238257}

author: {'steamid': '76561198269389479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1484104349}
review: This game claims to be a platformer inspired by games such as Jak and Daxter, which it is neither. I can't help to compare it to Jak, and it comes up short. First off, if you're looking for platforming it's not really here. The game does pretty much all of it for you. Second, the story is mind numbingly boring. Characters are boring and uninteresting. Third, the gameplay and combat suck. It's just unfun to fight enemies. Missions are do this or that and seemed boring. Overall, just a boring game. I've beaten Jak and Daxter 5 times and I could play it again while still having fun. This game isnt worth trying if you like old platformers, because it doesn't accurately give the same feel or fun. It does have a good soundtrack and art style though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960318168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1489061992}
review:
This game needs more attention, therefore this review.

The Last Tinker tells a story of a town where people of different colors live seperated from each other, because of distrust and prejudices. It is the players task to overcome the differences and bring the city back together. 
The game is very atmospheric, colorful, funny and is adressed to younger players, although adults can have fun with it too. Besides the vivid colors, there is a great soundtrack which reminds me a bit of Bastion.

The greatest weakpoint is the gameplay. I would not call this game a "platformer" because the jumping is done automatically. Combat is okay. Your punches can have different effects on the enemy, which opens up some variety.

Overall this very kid-friendly game tells a nice story about problems, that we all encounter on a daily basis. If you can bear the lack of gameplay you will enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132872056', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 4026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3649, 'last_played': 1590156891}
review:
The Last Tinker: City of Colors makes a powerful statement with its original level design, its beautiful music, hilarious and unforgettable characters, and its final message to the player. Although the era of plot-driven action adventure games seems to have been in its peak during the heydays of Nintendo 64 and the original PlayStation, The Last Tinker has most certainly raised the bar. After all, the world would be a pretty dull place without colour.

Full review here: https://kkatlas.wordpress.com/2014/07/15/game-review-the-last-tinker-city-of-colors/

Full game guide here: https://kkatlas.wordpess.com/2016/03/13/game-guide-the-last-tinker-city-of-colors/

author: {'steamid': '76561198162918142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1487263099}
review:
Practically a walking simulator.

Jump just happens automatically. So much is scripted. So, I guess it's pretty standard for 201x gaming :(

Camera is difficult to control. (Would be nice to have a 100% manual camera with fixed movement ratio).
IMHO somewhat repetitive music. YMMV. I just turned it off.
Wierdly low framerate on RX 480 (on linux, 4.9 kernel, radeonsi, mesa). Needed to play with low settings just to get above 40fps. Again, YMMV. Other more demanding Unity games run fine. (However, even if performance was flawless I'd still thumbs it down).

Written at ~100 mins, soon after I got [spoiler]red power[/spoiler]. I guess it has to get more complex later on.

On the plus side, the world is kinda inventive and so far the story has some potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024297872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1485650495}
review:
It feels kind of harsh to judge a game on what it isn‚Äôt rather than on it‚Äôs own terms, but like many others I bought City of Colours on the strength of the description. Inspired by Banjo Kazooie and Jak and Daxter. If you‚Äôre going to namedrop to sell, then you can‚Äôt be surprised when you‚Äôre compared directly to those games.

This game shares almost nothing with those classics except for a twee art style. Those games are defined by platforming, collectables and an open structure, where players can take on challenges in whatever order they wish. The Last Tinker is an entirely linear game with no jump button. Platforming challenges consist of nothing more than holding a trigger and moving the stick forwards, similar to Zelda games ‚Äì it‚Äôs almost entirely automated and thus entirely unengaging.

The rest of the game consists of tepid, unchallenging puzzles punctuated by perfunctory batman style combat. Occasionally there‚Äôs an utterly rote boss fight. I know this is a game aimed at children, but even by those standards the game is coddling and witless. It falls in that uncomfortable middle ground where it‚Äôs far too childish for older kids whilst being too mechanically complicated for little ones. If you‚Äôre wanting a 3D platformer of old, give this one a miss ‚Äì it is not what you want it to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971549364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1485820093}
review:
The right trigger doesn't work. Right trigger is also run and jump. It was an interesting five minutes but I can't go any further. 

I spent $3.00 on this during the steam sale and regret it. Stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152066485', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1484984615}
review: I can't give "The Last Tinker" a bad rate ; the graphics are georgous (for an independant game), the music is really good, some parts of the game are quite fun to play. There are also moment of pure art, with a precise work on ambiance, lights, etc. Also, the game is nothing but repetitive : there is always something new to do !... and that can be a problem. There are too many gameplays for a game like this ; as soon as you understand a mechanic, there is a new one. That's why the game gets messy, with too much buttons to control, too much commands the remember. And it's even worse when it comes to fight : they must be the worst part of the game. The color system is perfectly f... up ; maybe it's me, but it doesn't seem intuitive at all. In fact, during the last hours of the game, I felt a bit frustrated. I want to love this game so much, but some moments are annoying as hell. It could have been one of my favorite plateform games... it's just a pretty interesting game ; nothing beyond.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025779198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1485018795}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198015507927', 'num_games_owned': 2053, 'num_reviews': 346, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1667829239}
review:
La pagina di steam dice che ritrae molto i vecchi giochi come "Zelda, Jack and Daxter, e Banjo Kazooie", √® davvero cos√¨?
Niente di pi√π falso, il gioco in questione √® carino, simpatico, ma da dire che √® un platform come quelli elencati sopra √® paragonabile quasi a una bestemmia.
Il Gioco terr√† dei combattimenti e puzzle ambientali semplicissimi, che faranno sembrare il gioco pi√π adatto a un pubblico di bambini.
La trama, nonostante sia sdolcinata e prevedibile, riesce ugualmente a farsela piacere per il bel messaggio che lascia.
La grafica √® molto colorata e per essere fatto col motore grafico Unity hanno eseguito un ottimo lavoro.

[b]Riassumendo:[/b]

[h1]Pro[/h1]
-grafica coloratissima
-Trama, seppure sdolcinata lascia un bel messaggio
-longevit√† lunga per essere un giochino "platform" indie (6 ore)

[h1]Neutro[/h1]
-Combattimenti che potevano essere strutturati in maniera migliore (si sente la rigidit√† nel schivare e attaccare i nemici)
-I poteri sono carini anche se un po' sbilanciati fra di loro

[h1]Contro[/h1]
-Di sezioni platform non ce ne sono, i salti sono automatici (pari pari a quelli di assassin's creed)
-Difficolt√† molto facile anche se si sceglie "difficile" (cambier√† solo il danno dei nemici)

[h1]Voto 6.5/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198079904148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1484060006}
review: I recommend it. The art style and colors are interesting. The story was pretty unique in regards to the characters but was pretty predicitable. The movement of the character is pretty simple, there are some jumping and climbing mechanics in the game that are extremely simple to use, I mean to jump from ledge to ledge you simply hold down the sprint buttton and it jumps for you. I played it on the hardest difficulty, that is one hit is Insta-Death which is frustrating but makes it really addicting. Overall I encourage you to purchase it when on sale as I did, I don't think the game is worth the $20 price tag, but I'm a fairly cheap human being who doesn't like paying full price for most things. I got a little over 13 hours of play time and got all the achievements for it so if 13 hours of playing is worth $20 to you, by all means try out this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982924205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1483982973}
review: The controls were a little frustrating in a couple of instances, but this Super Mario 64/Banjo Kazooie-esque 3D action-platformer was fun to play through, had great visuals and art style, and had an interesting story. Not as much of a collect-a-thon as other games in the same genre, this game relied on it's character, story and gameplay to keep you interested. Definitely worth playing, and well worth the price.
