author: {'steamid': '76561198049238784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1483717798}
review:
TL;DR: Play this for the atmosphere. ~8 hours. Worth the 2 bucks(xD) I got it for during Winter sale.

Numerous games come to mind playing this.
Everything by Rareware, Psychonauts, Little Big Planet, Paper Mario. Yes, I'm using the "it's like <all these great games>" description that's usually a bit scammy. I'll pick one then, it's like Beyond Good and Evil. Linear, not terribly complex, but downright fun.

- It's not a platformer.
- Don't expect puzzles. It's just lever-pulling and repeating a sequence.
- A bit of (self-)referential humor at times, don't expect a lot.
- Linear as all hell, except for a single optional collectible. There's also gems to buy moves with(or as a key item at start), but that happens automatically. There is no backtracking whatsoever. ~8 hours.
-- Possible because of this, an excellent hint system. Just ask your buddy and he will fly almost the exact route you need to go.
- Combat is not difficult,[spoiler]except for the unlockable, optional arena[/spoiler]. I went for the "instant death" difficulty, thinking it to be a cooler name for "nightmare". It is not. Things will gib you continuously, even things that only knockback on other settings. Does not make the game more fun, just more annoying. No achi either. Just don't.
-- The cargo rails. What I thought was a scenic trip through the wonderfully crafted world was instead a quick time event in disquise. Especially on instant death. Bah.
-- Enemies(outside of boss adds) do not respawn. Even instant death is quite doable, the regular levels. Bosses still require a lot of trial and error until you completely know the attack pattern.
-- You gather three colored powers over the course of the game,[spoiler]but they are simply damage, fear and stun[/spoiler]. The first quarter of the game is simply"hit it until it dies, dodge if it attacks". They also give a superpower usable once a bar is filled. But this doesn't add any depth to boss fights, as they still need to be hit X times in the weak spot.[spoiler]Power, Time Stop and Invulnerability. Bosses remain vulnerable until a third of their hp is damaged, so Power nor Time Stop work. Layme.[/spoiler]

- It's cartoony. Some people use that as a pejorative, but it's simply a description. Like romantic comedy. Some people never like romantic comedies, most people need to be in a mood for it. Just like with cartoony. It feels cell-shady, everything is bright and un-brown.
- "Everything in this world is made of paint, paper and glue", and it shows. Text balloons are in gamespace, some are static, so you can view a textbox from the side to see that sinusoid cardboard thing, and you can view them from behind where they're blank.
- The world is beautifully made. There's dissapointingly much lore, as you don't ever see e.g. the inside of a dust refinery, or a rainbow factory where colors are made. On the other hand, you can often peer in a random direction and see detail without the quests ever taking you there.
- The characters. Banjo-Kazooie-like creatures just ramble on in their voice, gesturing, no matter their actual text. Each race has a "voice", and some unique characters have their own. There's quite a few different expressions. The three races look nothing alike, not just their bodies but their districts as well, each has their own architecture. Especially the spirits look great, Green was amazing.

It was a fun experience. I loved the characters, I giggled, I facepalmed at the cheesy story, I enjoyed the scenery, I raged at instant death(just don't).

author: {'steamid': '76561198056530065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1499436330}
review:
The last tinker is a rather short game, but packed with tons of charm. It is clear throughout the whole game how the previous era of platformer games has influenced this game in its design. While it at times really did remind me of games like Spyro and Ratched & Clank, it still managed to keep an own sense of style and expression. Despite me having a bad first impression during the first hour of gameplay, the game managed to charm me over and I really enjoyed playing the rest of the game.

[b] Pros [/b]
[list]
[*]Absolutely charming game with charming characters and charming environments.
[*]Love how the game used the contrast between chaos (sensory overload) and calm to help pace the game and setting the mood.
[*]Love the way the story as well as the visual story was developed and told during the later parts of the game.
[*]I liked the level progression. I didn‚Äôt feel like I was backtracking and the levels, although rather confined, always allowed for some extra exploration.
[/list]

[b] Cons [/b]
[list]
[*]Bad first impression. You, as the player, was dropped into a confusing place of sensory overload, utter chaos and fetch quests. 
[*]The lag! I had some serious frame rate drops and had to toggle the graphics settings and turn some stuff off to even have the game in a playable state. 
[*]Clunky camera and controls which lead to some frustrating situations.
[*]Initial combat felt clunky and unresponsive.
[*]Game was not consistent in telling the rules. Sometimes when you die, all defeated enemies will respawn and sometimes not. 
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197999631984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1482670721}
review:
For two dollars (got it on sale), this is was one hell of a bargain!

As almost every other review has stated, this game reminded me of Banjo Kazooie and Crash Bandicoot. Even though the game has a childish nature to it, there are many deep rooted themes that reflect today's society in America. I usually write lengthy reviews with in depth reviews, commentaries, and discussions, I'll keep this one simple and short, much like the game. 

Pros: 

Visually nice, reminded me of those old school games, and stuff like Paper Mario.
Interesting story
Moral themes reflecting current life and views in America

Cons:

Combat is a little repetitive
Short game (quality over quantity though)
Little to no replayability

Overall, I read quite a few reviews that says the game is perfect to play with a young gamer. I am inclined to agree, however, there are small tidbits where adults will have just as much fun playing it as a kid would. It's like a Pixar movie: designed for kids, but perfectly playable and enjoyable for adults.

The only real downside for me is that I do no think the game is worth $20. If it's on sale, I highly recommend you pick it up. Hope you all enjoy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065644695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1482542120}
review:
Total playtime 5 hours - longer if you go for collections.

Overall I liked the game, it's geared more toward a casual play experience or Y7 age ranges, it also has selctions for kid mode as well as hardcore.

The lack of a jump option is odd to get used to at first, but simplifies gameplay and eliminates precision platforming.  In this case it felt like it worked out.  The Jak and Daxter vibe is there, but not the annoying camera and platform puzzles.  The game is cute overall, and fun, most of the time.

CONS: There were two sections that I had to pull a walkthrough for.  Overall the game is mostly intuitive and the puzzles don't often get frustrating enough that you want to quit, but the Green Security area is not intuitive.  I didn't make the connection that the traffic light and the security were related.  Things of this nature are sparse in the game, but are still present.

I'd recommend it for a casual playthrough, got the game on sale and the sale price feels right.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981588360', 'num_games_owned': 880, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1482439736}
review:
tl;dr: A solid gaming experience!

Ps & Cs:
+ Good graphics
+ Decent controls
+ Cute story
+ Clever ideas
+ Great for kids
- Very easy
- N64-Zelda-esque jumping

This is a great kid's game.  I'm a 33 year old man, and even I'm enjoying it, kind of harkens back to the old N64 days.  The story isn't great, but it's fine for a game about a monkey brining color back to the world.  My biggest gripe is the lack of a jump button, as the game uses the auto-detect ledge jumping ala Assassin's Creed / Zelda 64, however it performs just fine.  At $20 it would be fine.  At $2.99 like I found it, it's a MFing masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049529997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1482178673}
review:
People that give a negative review are way too overly negative. They complain about the game not giving you the ability to jump whenever, or the game not being collectathlon enough. What I have to say about that is: This game is it's own game, not something based off of the old games we know of. It is inspired, sure, but at the core it's it's own game. It has really clever level design and the music + atmospehre is just superb. The fact that you don't have to manually jump whenever it's needed makes the platforming in the game so much easier, as well as pleasant.
This game really brought back good old nostalgia feelings - that you can find in games such as "Ty The Tasmanian Tasmanian Tiger".

I was almost scared away from this game because of how utterly abhorrent the negative reviews on this game were. I'm really glad I didn't though, because this game is a hidden gem and I am SUPER HYPED FOR THE SEQUEL!

Though some moments were actual BS, but maybe that's just because I played on "Insta Death" mode. Though the rail-parts can be improved, because some moments the moment you need to jump isn't obvious or difficult to nail down and the camera sometimes disorients you like crazy.
But they were simply minor annoyances.

I rate this game 93/100. It made me smile almost the entire time I played it (On the HARDEST difficulty possible, I might add)

author: {'steamid': '76561198085030183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1482003314}
review:
Ho appena finito questo platform e devo dire che sono rimasto piacevolmente sorpreso, l'ho acquistato in super saldo (circa 1‚Ç¨) e non avevo nessuna aspettativa (ero rimasto colpito dallo stile grafico) invece l'ho trovato un gioco molto buono che vale la pena giocare!!

POSITIVO:

grafica molto colorata e stile unico (a me √® piaciuto molto!)
storia e narrazione di ottimo livello
abbastanza longevo (9 ore circa per finirlo)
diversi collezionabili da trovare all'interno dei mondi 
musiche carine ed effetti molto presenti (ottima gestione del canale subwoofer)

NEGATIVO:

semplice e limitato nelle azioni (il salto √® automatico pertanto la sfida √® quasi nulla)
controlli non precisissimi
personaggio principale con 0 carisma (in compenso tutti gli altri sono ottimi)

VOTO: 7,5


PC in uso:

Processore Intel Core i7 6700K 4.00GHz
Memoria ram 16 Gb 2133 Mhz
scheda madre MSI Z170A GAMING M3
scheda video GTX 970 Asus Strix OC
sistema operativo Windows 10 64 bit

author: {'steamid': '76561197985668557', 'num_games_owned': 1514, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1481995910}
review:
I should open by saying, do not be fooled by the 'inspired by Jak & Daxter and Banjo Kazooie' line in the description. The devs openly say that the game is an Action-Adventure and not a Platformer. Anyone who felt that they were lied to shouldn't feel that way since the devs didn't say they were making a clone of that game.
Ultimately though, this game is essentially a Batman Arkham game for a younger audience.

Pros:[list]
[*]Amazing aesthetic. This is a great example of art direction over fidelty.
[*]Excellent soundtrack.
[*]Cute story. This is a game aimed at a younger audience and the story is something that teaches the power of friendship and sharing.
[/list]
Neutral:[list]
[*]The game slowly feeds you upgrades. Some aren't useful at all and some are given to you far too late.
[*]Combat depth is pretty low, you will manage to get through almost all encounter just be mashing the attack button despite have TONS of other options. That being said, this is a game for a younger audience, so that's acceptable.
[/list]
Cons:[list]
[*]The games uses the Assassin's Creed method of platforming, this is something I don't like especially when to find certain secrets you have to just fall off ledges.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198046365218', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1481660452}
review:
Nice game.

Enjoyed because it remembered me of my PS2 games, going arround, exploring things, good story, has some puzzles and nice collectibles...

There's only one thing though, the game doesn't offer quite a challenge for the "normal" difficulty (wich I am used to), and it is easier to die confronting normal enemies than the bosses, but I think is part of the gameplay, "let the flow guide you" or something.

Otherwise, nice game to chill and get some glimpses of my childhood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168722840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1529629182}
review:
para la audiencia correcta, si es un buen juego, es decir, para ni√±os de 9 a√±os, casi preescolar

pero para adultos o preadolescentes no lo recomiendo, pues la historia es muy √±o√±a, el mundo muy empalagozo, la moraleja muy obvia, no hay un gran sentido de urgencia o de verdadero riesgo, aunque claro, todo eso se pasaria por alto si el gameplay fuera atractivo y divertido, (como raiman o super mario), pero tampoco lo es

el combate es simplon y no tiene mucho reto (aunque jugue en normal y hay 2 dificultades mas arriba) y tampoco es un gran juego de plataformas pues nisiquiera hay un boton de salto, si no que dejas precionado espacio y el personaje saltara automaticamente por donde este predeterminado que se puede saltar o hacer acrobacias, es super tolerante al fracaso y los acertijos son casi obvios

solamente te atoras cuando te aburres de jugar en piloto automatico y no prestas atencion por lo que te equivocas

lo que si tiene a su favor es que se ve muy bonito y pues... que existe, pues considero importante que siempre existan opciones para todo publico, y aun cuando me enfado despues de unas horas, es por que sencillamente no es para mi, pero disfrute explorando y para ni√±os peque√±os sera muy divertido, como un juego con llantitas entrenadoras

muy convencional, pero en este caso es bueno por que sabes que esperar de el, como de una caricatura del discovery kids, si lo recomiendo pero para ni√±os, no para gente mas grande que quiza espere algo como rayman, mario o ratchet y clank

Los mundos son totalmente coloridos y divertidos de explorar, ademas de una historia que parece sencilla pero que al final se pone super buena. author: {'steamid': '76561198025741744', 'num_games_owned': 3507, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1434245989}
review:
The Last Tinker is a charming game which quickly got me emotionally engaged and made it really easy for me to relate to the protagonists on my journey.
The story is an all-ages adventure with exciting characters which all have their own motivations and place in the game world. I really liked the colors and the animations. 

There is no jump-button. All you need is to step off a ledge for example and your character will jump automatically. Similar to the jump mechanics in Zelda games.
Almost all of the negative reviews for this game are complaining about this aspect because buyers were not aware of it beforehand.

It is a solid game with easy puzzles, a bit of character leveling, some secrets placed around the levels and enemies to fight. 

This kind of game is rarely found on the PC and I thoroughly enjoyed it.
I suggest this game to players that are open towards all-age stories that come with lots of humor and some popculture references.
It is uniquely charming and gave me a warm fuzzy feeling inside.
Buy it cheap on sale or at full price. You will likely not regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172376906', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1481180159}
review:
When i saw the description "inspired by classics such as Jak & Daxter and Banjo Kazooie" i thought this game would be good as them, but no. Thought "A" button on Joypad(Controller) gonna jump, but not again.  I mean you just hold RT for jump? really? after that we just seeing the animation play. The combat was soooo boring and repetitive, should have more combos or another animation. Was thinking a lot of interaction in the game but yea again, not much. Yea we can hit every people but they dont give a fuck mate except for the quest.


But yea, the art and soundtrack very good no doubt and i like it.

PS: Gonna update the review after playing 4-5 hours more.

review: Ê∏∏ÊàèÂºÄÂßãÊó∂ÈªòËÆ§ÁÅµÊïèÂ∫¶ÂæàÈ´òÔºåÈº†Ê†áÂä®‰∏ÄÂä®ËßÜËßíËÉΩÈ£òËÄÅËøúÔºåÂè¶Â§ñÊÑüËßâÊ∏∏Êàè‰ºòÂåñÁöÑ‰∏çÂ•ΩÔºå‰∏éËßíËâ≤‰∫íÂä®Êó∂Â≠òÂú®Âç°È°øÔºå‰∏çÁÅµÊïè„ÄÇÂÖ∂ÂÆûÁîªÈ£éÂæàÊ£íÔºåÈü≥‰πê‰πü‰∏çÈîôÔºå‰ΩÜÊ∏∏ÊàèÊÄßÂ§™Â∑ÆÔºåÊï¥‰ΩìËØÑÂàÜ6/10Âêß

author: {'steamid': '76561198070832679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1480042427}
review:
Fun little game here. I enjoy it and the kids love it! It's not really anything like what it says it's inspired by game play wise.

(There's no jump button. You auto jump like you would in Ocarina of Time and any other recent Zelda title, so you wont get any true platforming like you would in Banjo Kazooie or Jak & Daxter.) 

Due to that reason alone I think it's regulary priced a little too high at $19.99. It should probably be more around the $10-$15 price range but it was definitely worth the $1.99 I paid during the 2016 Black Friday Sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116100475', 'num_games_owned': 4747, 'num_reviews': 597, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1479746654}
review:
[h1] This game made me feel like an 8 year old playing Spyro on the PS1 for the first time, all over again. [/h1]

This is a really good game!
If you have any love for games with a charming world like the old Playstation and N64 platformers, this game is for you.
I felt that spirit i have been missing for a long time while playing the game.
It might have small flaws but i can easily oversee them considering the joy i currently have with it.

The Last Tinker absolutely oozes classic Sony platformer charm in a way that I haven't seen for a long time. Yes, the game is easy and the puzzles are simple but that's not a bad thing, it makes it a relaxing and purely enjoyable game to play through. The low difficulty level also means it's accessible to kids which is great because this is exactly the type of game I would want my kids to be playing. 

So glad I didn't miss it. Also this game is a lot longer and has way more gameplay in it than i thought I would see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051890685', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1479149502}

L'histoire tourne autour de la n√©cessit√© de s'entraider malgr√© nos diff√©rences, et transmet de belles valeurs d'amiti√© et de courage.
Id√©al pour les petits, et pour les grands ayant gard√© leur √¢me d'enfant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020506980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1432324876}
review:
TL;DR : Description gives wrong expectations, but the game is still fun. This is more an adventure game than a platformer.

Many people complain that this is not a difficult/challenging platformer. But it's not meant to be. It's a kid-friendly, easy platformer. So of course most of the platforming and combat is easy, and a lot of things are automated. The problem comes from the "inspired by" part of the description. This proves once again it's rarely a good idea to say your game is inspired by this or that because people will expect a very similar game and be disappointed.

The game may be wrongly advertised, but that doesn't mean the game is bad. You just have to expect a fun and colorful, kid-friendly (both in terms of content and difficulty) adventure game with platforming elements. Not an actual platformer like the two games this one is said to be inspired by.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164382571', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 422, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1476784425}
review:
Mettons nous tout de suite d'accord : m√™me si les apparences sont trompeuses, [i][b]The Last Tinker : City of Colors[/b][/i] n'est pas vraiment un jeu de plate-forme. Il vous rappellera peut-√™tre les plus belles heures qu'ait connues ce genre, en particulier en 3D, mais ce n'est d√©finitivement pas ce qui le caract√®rise.

Apr√®s tout, aucun bouton ne permet √† proprement parler de sauter. Il suffit d'activer le sprint pour que notre personnage - un singe nomm√© Koru - encha√Æne les plate-formes, la plupart du temps sans qu'il soit question de pr√©cision ou de timing. Hormis pour certains passages : sur les rails, par exemple, ou lorsque les plate-formes disparaissent momentan√®ment. Que ces sauts soient g√©r√©s de fa√ßon quasi automatique l'exclut donc d'embl√©e de cette cat√©gorie.

[i][b]The Last Tinker : City of Colors[/b][/i] est avant tout un jeu d'aventure et plus pr√©cis√©ment d'action. Le coeur du gameplay r√©side dans un syst√®me de combat bas√© sur des coups et des couleurs. Et √ßa, √ßa ne se discute pas mon ami... *tousse*. Bref, notre protagoniste est un habitant de Couleurville. Oui, bon... ils ne sont pas all√©s la chercher bien loin celle-l√†. Toujours est-il qu'il r√©veille malgr√© lui une calamit√© : la Grisaille. Cette entit√© malfaisante met alors un point d'honneur √† chasser de la cit√© les autres couleurs. Qui s'√©taient d'ailleurs tant et si bien √©loign√©es qu'elles ne parvenaient plus √† travailler ensemble.

Chacune est incarn√© par un esprit, qui gouverne en quelque sorte son peuple : les Bleus, les Verts et les Rouges. Et c'est l√† que vous intervenez. En effet, vos pouvoirs de Tinker vous destinent √† contrecarrer ce plan diabolique. Mais pour ce faire, il faudra d'abord rallier ces trois esprits. Divers ennemis vous barreront la route, du p√©on de base √† la bestiole qui attaque √† distance, en passant par le gros costaud qui encaisse les coups. Pour les affronter, on r√©cup√®re au fil de l'aventure un certain nombre d'aptitudes qui enrichissent le gameplay.
 
[i][b]The Last Tinker : City of Colors[/b][/i] propose aussi une dose d'exploration tr√®s appr√©ciable, d'autant plus que le level design est impeccable. Il s'agira pour l'essentiel d'amasser une monnaie - des pierres pr√©cieuses - ou de d√©nicher les pinceaux dissimul√©s dans les niveaux. La premi√®re permet d'√©toffer votre panoplie de coups, leur puissance, voire d'allonger la dur√©e des capacit√©s sp√©ciales, tandis que les seconds d√©bloqueront des artwork ou des modes de jeu particuliers.

Quant aux graphismes, ils sont soign√©s et bien s√ªr tr√®s color√©s. On retrouve le c√¥t√© mignon de ces vieux jeux de plate-formes o√π m√™me les vilains avaient de bonnes trognes, pour ne pas trop effrayer les jeunes joueurs que nous √©tions. Un aspect un peu enfantin, qu'accentuent d'ailleurs les bruitages produits par les diff√©rents protagonistes lorsqu'ils s'expriment. Le jeu dispose en outre de quatre niveaux de difficult√©, tous plus ou moins faciles compte tenu des nombreux checkpoints.

En r√©sum√©, [i][b]The Last Tinker : City of Colors[/b][/i] est un jeu d'aventure/action accessible, √† la r√©alisation impeccable et au doux parfum de nostalgie.

[h1]Verdict : 4/5 - Tr√®s bon, une valeur s√ªre ![/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198098098839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1439478769}
review:

This game reminds me and was inspired by Banjo Kazooie which is a good thing, level design is great, cities are filled with life, almost every citizen has something unique to say, sound is good, artwork is awesome, the developers even got to the trouble of implementing a color blind option for disabled people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097890318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1476009312}
review:
If you want a cute game you can relax and play for 6-8 hours and get a cute story in a cute setting this is a game for you. 

I think it does this job very well, it doesn't overstay its welcome and is pretty good at giveing you a new mechanic or puzzle every now and then to keep things interesting, and i even got a few chuckles from some of the jokes. Its a quality game for a fair price in a category of games (3rdperson adventure with platform like mechanic?) that doesn't often have this level of polish (in my humble opinion).

However, if ur expecting a platformer with the depth of and Collectablity (is that a word i dunno) of banjo or mario 64 (or incert ur favorite 3d Mario) ur probably gunna be dissapointed.....or not...mabey u'll be like me and just find the world charming enough you forget about why you bought the game and start throwing red colorballs and bunnies to make them angry...or throw blue shit at lizards to make them cry....i dunno i'm not you though.....also if you wanted a jump button there isn't one.....but hey if u're pissed about not being able to jump i'd like to remind you that windwaker doesn't have a jump button and fuck you if you don't like windwaker

i'd give it a solid 8/10....its a safe game that acomplishes what it sets out to do and never seems like a slog...but i didn't feel like it did anything too impressive to stand next to the 3d adventure games of Lore

author: {'steamid': '76561198039921055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1403259085}
review:
The Last Tinker: City of Colors
Geschichte:
Der junge Affe Koru lebt in einem Land namens Tinkerworld, das in letzter Zeit durch Unruhen beeintr√§chtig wird. Die Bewohner von Farbstadt, die eins friedlich zusammenlebten, haben sich zerstritten und sich in ihre Bereiche zur√ºckgezogen, die einstigen Tugenden der Farbgeister wurde in Gegenteil gewandelt: Aus Mut wurde Wut, Neugierde wurde zu Angst. Das alles entstand aus der Frage heraus, welche Farbe die beste sei. Der Farbgeist, der eigentlich f√ºr den Ausgleich und die Harmonie zwischen den Farben zu sorgen h√§tte, wurde vergessen und sah nur in der Ausl√∂schung der farblichen Ungleicheiten eine L√∂sung und so rief er die Bleiche um Farbstadt zu vernichten.

Spiel:
The Last Tinker ist ein Action-Adventure aus der Verfolgerperspektive. Manche m√∂gen es als Jump'n'Run bezeichnen, ich w√ºrde mich dem auch generell anschlie√üen, wenn da nicht das durch Upgrades erweiterbare Kampsystem-System und die Tatsache w√§re, dass man Spr√ºnge und Kletteraktionen nicht selbst ausl√∂st, sondern der Charakter diese bei dr√ºcken in die jeweilige Richtung selbst ausl√∂st. Klingt simpel? Bis zu einem gewissen Grad stimmt das auch, allerdings erfordern viele Passagen ein gewisses Timing, da Anlaufstellen beispielsweise unter Wasser verschwinden, was den direkten Tod unseres Protagonisten zur Folge hat. Bis auf diese kleine Timing-Geschichte f√§llt der Jump'n'Run Aspekt allerdings recht simpel, aber auch durchaus sehr spa√üig aus. Das Kampsystem ist ebenfalls relativ einfach gehalten. Anfangs besitzen wir lediglich normale Angriffe, mit derer wir uns gestaltlichen Gegner erwehren k√∂nnen. Gestaltlich? Dazu z√§hlen die klassischen Bewohner Farbstadts, prim√§r die Vertreter der Farbe Rot, die durch den Konflikt zu relativ aggressiven Zeitgenossen mutiert sind. F√ºr die Bleichemonster reicht diese einfache Art des Nahkampfs allerdings nicht aus. Mit Hilfe der Farbgeister, die wir im Spielverlauf finden und einen m√ºssen, werden unsere Angriffe allerdings verst√§rkt, zus√§tzlich erhalten wir f√ºr jeden Farbgeist eine zus√§tzliche Spezialf√§higkeit. Rot beispielsweise erm√∂glicht uns das Angreifen und Vernichten von Bleichemonster, w√§hrend Angriffe mit der Farbe Gr√ºn Gegner in die Flucht schlagen, um beispielsweise robustere Vertreter zu einem Suizid durch ein Bad zu treiben und Blau l√§hmt Finde kurzzeitig, damit wir sie im Sinne einer Hinrichtung mit einem aufgeladenen Schlag in den R√ºcken niederstrecken k√∂nnen. Zu en Spezialf√§higkeiten geh√∂rt unter anderem ein Bullettime-Move, der unsere Umgebung im klassischen Matrix-Stil verlangsamt, damit wir beispielsweise Timing-Events einfacher und unbeschadet √ºberstehen k√∂nnen. Das Kampsystem l√§sst sich im Verlauf der Handlung an einem Automaten durch Upgrades, wie st√§rkere Kombos und l√§ngere Dauer der Speizalf√§higkeiten oder Gesundheitsupgrades aufr√ºsten. Besondere Gegnertypen, wie beispielsweise ein Gigant, den man nacheinandere mit unterschiedlichen Farben treffen muss, damit er besiegbar wird, runden das ansonsten recht simple Kampfgeschehen ab.

Grafik:
Grafisch bietet das Spiel eine bunte Pappwelt, die von den drei Hauptfarben Rot, Gr√ºn und Blau dominiert wird. Alles ist recht putzig gemacht und vermittelt den Eindruck, dass man mit etwas mehr Wasser Gefahr l√§uft, dass einem die Welt in sich zusammenbricht. Ein sehr innovativer und gelungener Stil, der mir so bisher nie begegnet ist. Allein die fliegende Pinata, die uns als Freund, Ratgeber und Wegweise zur Seite steht, muss man direkt ins Herz schlie√üen.

Sound:
Das Spiel bietet einen umfassenden Soundtrack, der teilweise sehr harmonisch ist und die Atmosph√§re der einzelnen Gebiete treffend in Szene setzt. Wunderbare Gitarrenst√ºcke mit etwas Funk im Ballungszentrum vom Markplatz bis hin zu schummeriger Hafenmusik im blauen Gebiet. Alles wirkt stimmig und l√§dt zum Verweilen in Farbstadt ein.

Fazit:
The Last Tinker: City of Colors ist ein sch√∂nes Action-Adventure, das sich eher an den Casual-Gamer richtet. F√ºr Jump'n'Run-Fans sind diese Passagen zu simpel und Freunden von Echtzeitkampfsystemen wird auch dieser Aspekt zu simpel ausfallen. [diese Meinung bezieht sich nur auf den regul√§ren normalen Schwierigkeitsgrad, da der einzige, der gespielt wurde] Es bleibt also in beiden Kategorien sehr einsteigerfreundlich. Des weiteren ist es recht kurzweilig, in meinem LP brauchte ich 22 Parts mit einer ungef√§hren Spielzeit von 17 Minuten pro Part, womit man zu einer ungef√§hren Spielzeit von etwa 6/7 Std kommt. Das mag zu erst wenig klingen, bedenkt man dabei allerdings den Preis ca 20 Euro bzw. 22 Euro, wenn man den Soundtrack mit kauft, bekommt man doch viel Spiel f√ºr wenig Geld. Vor allem, da es sich um einen Indie-Titel handelt.
Schlussendlich ist The Last Tinker: City of Colors eine gut gelungene Mischung aus unterschiedlichen Designelementen, mag zwar f√ºr Hardcore-Vertreter der einzelnen Spieltypen zu einfach sein, aber diesen zu gen√ºgen wird wohl kaum der Anspruch der Entwickler gewesen sein. F√ºr alle Freunde eines innovativen Grafikstils, einer sehr netten und interessanten Story und eines putzigen Hauptcharakters mit niedlichem Anhang eindeutig ein Spiel, das man sich angeschaut haben sollte.

Artikel mit Video auf : https://thethorgain.blogspot.de/2014/07/the-last-tinker-city-of-colors.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198062366951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1475333660}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048859652', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1475407003}
review:
As many people did, I bought this game thinking it was a 3D platformer akin to the games of old, the games it was inspired by. I was severely disappointed to find that I am glued to the ground and that the platforming is simply holding down a button. The game is incredibly simple and easy. Combat is braindead, the path is extremely railroaded, and collectibles aren't very difficult to find for the most part. Because you are glued to the ground and the paths are railroaded, you will often find the collectibles right in front of your face. The "specials" I have gotten have mostly gone unused, as they are unnecessary (unless the game requires them to be used). Your "life" and "health points" are pointless considering you respawn about 2 feet from where you once were due to generous checkpoint placement, and the fact that there isn't a "gameover".

However, the game isn't a bad game. Being simple and easy does not mean that the game isn't fun. Contrary to this, I have been thoroughly enjoying the game once I got out of the "This isn't a 3D platformer" mindset. The designs of the characters are very interesting and cool (you can't tell me that Koru's scarf isn't awesome). The art and music both are beautiful! Colors are vivid and lush, sound effects are satisfying, and the story is interesting enough to me that I want to know what happens. And even though the combat is incredibly simple and easy, I still have fun with it due to the sound effects, colors, and animations. The animations being incredibly fluid and fun to watch.

Some complaints, other than "too easy" and "not a platformer":
[*]The sound that Lil Bomber makes when affected by Green is [i]incredibly[/i] uncomfortable and disconcerting. Especially the ones he makes while still being held.
[*]The whole meeting with Blue Spirit is incredibly abrupt and jarring. There's only a couple lines of text before he joins you, with nothing being said by Green or Red Spirits.
[*]The lack of using dodge to get off of jumping puzzles being used. RB allows you to dodge off of ropes, spires, pillars, and other such things that you autojump on to. However, not once did I find this ability effective in finding a collectible or advancing along. I have yet to complete the game or even beat the game, but I doubt it will come in handy in the future...

Most other complains fall under the "too easy" and "not a platformer" categories. But once again, this game is still good. It's fun, it's relaxing, and it's pretty to watch as you play. It's a great game for a younger audience as well as those not very skilled. I can definitely recommend this game to those who can sit back and enjoy a simple romp through an interesting and beautiful world.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975695277', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1473635259}
review:
First let me state, this isn't the first game I'd played that uses a wide range and depth of color.

When I first came upon The Last Tinker: City of Colors, my though was this would probably be a fun game to play. Well, I'm not saying it isn't fun. It's not a bad game at all. If it wasn't for the not so minor issues, it would have definitly been better.

What issues may I be refering? The main problem has to do with the camera sensetivity combine with the amount of colors in the game. For some people, it may not be a issue. For those of us whom falls well within the realm of percieving every darn possible colors and more, at once, it is quite painful to look at this game with it's rapid camera movement. Lowering the senstivity didn't help much at all. 

Droping the senesitivity all the way down would made the game impossible to play since the camera rotation becomes too slow. If I was to suddenly turn Kuro around and walk in a differnet direction, there would be several second of not seeing where the charater was going due to extremely low camera rotation. Puting the sensitivity up just by one click from the lowest is still pretty fast. It rapid speed isn't only in the camera rotation, but it in every motion you make. Come on, why is there no inbetween impossiblely slow and omega fast.

I understand the Kuro is suppose to be fast, but that camera movement causes all the colors to vibrate more than it needs too.

The second issue, I ran into, was the delay from the players excuting the Input to the event being perform by the character. For example, after pushing the jump button or key I would expect it to jump right away and not 1 second later. I can understand giving a bit of delay for various reason, but 1 second of delay is too long. This makes the game less enjoyable when you know you need to jump or rotate to dodge, but nothing happens and you took damage.

Those were pretty much the only issue I had. It took awhile to complete the game since I had to stop playing, quite often, to readjust my eyes.


As for the story, is pretty much a familar story. A story of segeration, and how an insprational figure helped unified the people. The approach to the story was a intriguing one. There seems to be an hidden messages in the story base on how the story was told. Of course, this message may not have been intended, but it some how worked it's way in.

Oh Conspiracy! 

Would I recomend this game? Sure, why not, it's a good game after all. Plus, you  get to see the concept art for the game if you unlocked them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066015859', 'num_games_owned': 2988, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1479261873}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 798, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1400851079}
review:
[h1] Information [/h1]

The Last Tinker ist ein heiteres, liebevoll gestaltetes Action Adventure, inspiriert von zeitlosen Klassikern wie Zelda, Jak & Daxter und Banjo Kazooie. 

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Eine unheimliche Macht, bekannt als die ‚ÄûBleiche‚Äú, hat sich erhoben und droht die Farben zu entzweien und der Welt alle Freude und alles Leben zu entziehen. Du spielst Koru, ein Junge aus den Slums von Farbstadt. Dein Ziel ist es,  in einem epischen und einzigartigen Abenteuer die Bleiche zu bezwingen und deine Heimat die Freude und die Farben zur√ºckzugeben. 

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ kann mit Tastatur/Maus und Controller gespielt werden, beide Varianten funktionieren super
+ Grafik ist stimmig und bunt
+ Sound passt gut in das Spiel
+ Spiel erinnert an fr√ºhere Zeiten, wo der Spa√ü an erster Stelle stand und nicht wie realistisch das ganze auf einen wirkt
+ Errungenschaften und Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- schlecht platzierte Speicherpunkte, h√§tte besser gel√∂st werden k√∂nnen

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

The Last Tinker entf√ºhrt dich auf ein farbenfrohes Abenteuer nach Farbstadt, in eine Welt, die ganz auf Kreativit√§t, Gef√ºhlen und Zusammenarbeit aufgebaut ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993671036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1473303055}
review:
A cute silly game with well made enviroments and characters. 

The game is very forgiving with death while keeping up enough a gradually escalating challenge at various sections to prevent me from falling asleeping. Outside of those challenges, navigating the enviroments and panning the camera around to glimpse the way forward has an intrinsic joy to it. Things are pretty, and the layout of places themselves remain interesting. 

I got it on sale for $4, and I'll say it has probably $20 of worth. It might depend if you audibly "aww" everytime the baby goat pinata speaks and wiggles its nose or not. I mean look at him. 

LOOK. AT. HIM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050896286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1473171402}
review:
I enjoyed this game, although it was quite short. The developer cites Jak & Daxter and Banjo-Kazooie as inspirations; I have not played the former, but I can say that the game does not have much in common with the latter, as it's neither a collectathon nor a classic platformer. It reminded me more of Rayman 2 with its linearity (there's no hub map) and its whimsical characters.

The game has all the basics of a good platformer. The story is especially cute. All in all it's a good first outing for Mimimi Productions on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991362740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1472687112}
review:
[h1]About[/h1]

A sweet adventure game with light atmosphere and a colorful world. It's not too deep, but it's a very plesant experience with a decent story. It's a great pick for people inexperienced with the hack'n'slash genre as it teaches them the basics of hack'n'slash combat mechanics.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*] Very lightweight gameplay
[*] Great atmosphere
[*] A colorful world with exciting locations
[*] Silly and sweet story that gets a bit emotional towards the end
[*] Chilly music with some great tracks
[/list]
[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*] Too easy for the experienced gamer
[*] Platforming sequences are automated
[*] Sometimes it gets too repetitive
[/list]
[h1]Rating[/h1]

7/10 ‚Äî Good

author: {'steamid': '76561198064005074', 'num_games_owned': 1665, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1471818100}
review:
Nessuna premessa per un gioco che, realmente, non avevo mai sentito neanche per sbaglio e mi son ritrovato in libreria grazie ad uno dei classici bundle preso a caso nei siti "dell'Internet"

COMPRALO PERCHE:
-Graficamente il titolo si presenta coloratissimo e con una realizzazione artistica d'insieme davvero interessante. Il gioco √® stato realizzato con l'ormai famosissimo Unity Engine quindi ha dalla sua sicuramente un discreta ottimizzazione per PC (seppur il gioco pecca di qualche rallentamento di troppo non danneggiando comunque il giocato). Per lo stile utilizzato invecchier√† molto lentamente pertanto mi sento sicuramente di premiarlo
-Seppur nella maggior parte degli Action-Platform la componente Storia √® solo un palliativo per portare a compimento i vari livelli proposti dagli svillupatori devo dire, che seppur colma di cliche, la Storia di Koru vi colpir√† non tanto per la sua narrazione tanto per quello che cerca di comunicare (seppur nulla di eccessivamente profondo)
-Pur essendo un indie la longevit√† si mantiene su dei buoni livelli visto che, essendo un platform, l'obbiettivo √® puntare al 100% di collezionabili....nulla di trascendentale ma sicuramente una dozzina di ore ve le porter√† via sicuro

LASCIALO A STEAM:
-Comparto sonoro di Basso Livello con OST ridondanti ed eccessivamente mal calibrate nel loro volume. Doppiaggio totalmente inesistente se non per mugugni qua e la dei personaggi. Anche la campionatura dei suoni ambientali lascia un p√≤ a desiderare. Non di rado comunque vi potranno capire bug a questo comparto che, mischiato a tutto il resto non possono sicuramente farmelo promuoverlo
-Ludicamente parlando il titolo non √® un Platform! Descrizione degli sviluppatori ingannevole visto che un platform in cui le fasi di piattaforma fondamentalmente non esistono (totale mancanza di salti e corsa totalmente automatica degli ostacoli) e pertanto √® tranquillamente considerabile un banale Action. Purtroppo anche in questo genere non riesce sicuramente a brillare soprattuto nelle fasi iniziale quando la ripetitivit√† d'azione si far√† parecchio sentire e lo sblocco dei relativi poteri non riuscir√† a migliorare l'impressione d'insieme visto il livello di difficolt√† del titolo non propriamente eccelso. Certo qualche trovata interessante, soprattuto lato enigmi √® sicuramente da premiare ma √®, in generale, un comparto insufficiente visto anche ad un cervellotica mappatura dei vari tasti d'azione e non.
-Personalmente ho riscontrato un fastidioso bug che non mi faceva selezionare le voci nei vari men√π con un controller XBOX che, stando all'intro, √® totalmente compatibile

In definitiva un titolo sicuramente da provare ma, legato a doppio filo alla sua presenza o meno in bundle perch√®, con tutta onesta, vi son almeno un centinaio di titoli nettamente superiori usciti negli ultimi 5 anni ed una miriade se prendiamo in esame l'intera storia videoludica degli action-platform

VOTO: 55/100
Peccato visto che una miglior cura anche solo nella difficolt√† avrebbe alzato l'asticella di almeno due punti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076887452', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1468169376}
review:
Si buscas (como dice en la descripci√≥n del propio juego) un plataformas del estilo Jak and Daxter, The last tinker no es tu juego.

[b]No es un plataformas convencional[/b], de hecho, no dispone de un bot√≥n para ejecutar los saltos tal y como los conocemos en los juegos plataformeros. Disponemos de un sprint que realizar√° los saltos autom√°ticamente y de un bot√≥n para rodar; simple. Vamos adquiriendo poderes de combate y nuevas habilidades seg√∫n avanzamos la historia.
Contiene algunos puzzles sencillitos y la historia tambi√©n es sencillita.
El juego cuenta con una tienda donde comprar mejoras de combate y de una serie de √≠tems colecionables escondidos por cada escenario con los que desbloqueamos arte conceptual y algunas modificaciones en el juego (como las cabezas gigantes o enanas, mundo espejp, etc...).

[b]La m√∫sica y los gr√°ficos son lo que m√°s destaca de este juego[/b], teniendo un apartado gr√°fico de excelente calidad y colorido, y una banda sonora que har√° que tararees sus canciones mientras juegas.

Quiz√°s no es un gran plataformas, pero es [b]divertido[/b] y sin duda [b]merece la pena[/b].
Es una gran opci√≥n para los mas peques de la casa.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980308184', 'num_games_owned': 3459, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1468631178}
review:
A beautiful, charming, and fun "platformer" game... But why the quotation marks?
Most complaints seem to be that it has no real platforming, as it is all done automatically while holding the jump button, and that apparently makes it a bad game because it's not like the games it says it's inspired by.
However, that is pretty much the only thing missing, but even then, it's only a problem if you're closed-minded enough that it stops you from caring about what the game IS.

The world and characters are beautifully colourful and varied. Cartoony looking, and yet still so detailed and smooth. Playing this game is like eating candy with your eyes!
The gameplay is fairly linear and easy, but addictive. While I can appreciate the desire for the accurate platforming of old (I love the PS1-2 classics myself), the auto-jumping helps the game flow nicely, while you focus on exploring, and figuring out how to proceed through obstacles, with occasional small puzzles and alternate paths. There are also multiple collectibles hidden in the levels, which unlock fun little extras, like big head mode, concept art, and more!
The combat, while simple on the surface, grows more complicated and fun as you learn different attacks and powers, and encounter new enemies that require different strategies to defeat.
And finally, the story is light hearted without being childish, yet the theme is deep in ways that are very clear.

So don't focus on what it isn't, look at what it is. When a game is inspired by something, it doesn't need to be 100% like that something in every way in order to be a worthwhile and memorable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027038417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1494718001}
review: It's okay, and the art style is really neat, but all the platforming is automatic. You just hold the "parkour" button and hold forward. Therefore I am dissapointed, because I was expecting a more traditional 3D platformer that actually has a jump button (it is currently advertised as being inspired by jax and daxter and banjo kazooie, both of with have actual platforming). Also, I know this is an idie game, but the music is extremely bland and repetitive. Investing a bit more in the sound is really needed considering it is not very skill based and more of an adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974417162', 'num_games_owned': 1599, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1467794282}
review:
I enjoyed this game and will come back to it to finish. I have made it far enough into the game to feel I would comfortably recommend this game. It's a fairly inexpensive title which I wasn't sure about in the beginning. It feels like a Jack and Daxter as far as the silent protagonist, loud mouthed best friend, colorful levels, and quirky supporting characters. However, it's sort of a platformer with no controlled jump and Arkham Asylum style combat. This makes for more of a beat em up with a few flaws but overall a quirky story, solid combat, and a fun world.

Graphics: They set out to create a specific style and succeeded beautifully. For the overall aesthetic, they nailed it. Everything looks like it's painted and when the world starts going "bleak", the lack of colors is very apparent. As you take damage, you seem to be drained of color which is a nice effect. The speech bubbles are actually cut out signs on cardboard which are only written on the front of. I do have a problem with the speech bubbles, as fitting as they are. Sometimes, they don't appear until you are right next to a character. They are large enough that I find myself having to move the camera to read them. This could have been corrected by making them pop up a bit further out, but then it wouldn't feel like the characters were talking to you. Overall, it's my only gripe about the graphical presentation.

Music: This soundtrack is amazing. From the stealth areas where the music changes dynamically when guards are getting closer to you to the standard area themes being unique and fitting. The music you get on the farm feels very twangy and laid back while the combat music is more up beat and intense. Every area's music is not only appropriate, but also something I would go out of my way to find and listen to while relaxing at home. It's a stellar example of matching the visual aesthetic to the auditory aesthetic.

Gameplay: The game offers a variety of difficulties without forcing you to unlock them which seems less common these days and I am glad to see it. The difficulties range from Kid, where most attacks are one hit kills, to One Hit Death, where every hit you take kills you and HP means nothing. That being said, all the difficulties seem to be arbitrary increase in damage against you and damage enemies take. There are no AI modifications or spawn rate modifications which I noticed. The AI, in general, is very basic, but this is not a bad thing. Each monster acts it's own way and never react based on other monster's movement. It's a very NES/SNES style of programming AI. The smaller melee guys just rush you. The larger AI guys rush you. The ranged guys stay ranged and never move. The shield guys disappear and reappear waiting for you to stun them. No monster will surprise you by doing something you don't expect. But it works Trying to time your attacks so you hit the small guys, dodge the big guys, ranged attack the ranged guys, it all adds to that chaos that made those earlier games fun. The issue I have is the checkpoint system. It doesn't maintain a state that the game is in, merely a respawn point. What this means is, if you are in a particularly nasty fight, you can run in and kill as many guys as you can until you die, respawn near by, run back in and the only monsters there are the remaining monsters of that wave. Every fight can be done like this, including boss fights as far as I can tell. There are no numbered lives so there is no way to lose the game. As far as the platforming with no jump button, it works. There is a run button. If you are holding it and you reach a ledge with something you can jump to, it will jump. They work in a lot of timing systems into when to progress to the next platform and when to stay back. With ranged enemies covering these platforms, sometimes you find yourself bouncing from one platform to the next and back again while waiting for another platform to come up and trying to not get hit by the ranged guy. The challenge is there if there was an actual reason not to die.

Overall: I really do like this game and would recommend it, if only as an example of a game with a fully fleshed out concept. My issues are generally surface level. It could use a life system or a full respawn of enemies on death. As it stands, maybe playing it on One Hit Death can serve some challenge, but I see it ending up as more of a test in ones patience, really. Ultimately, a fun experience, albeit an easy one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025380165', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1467725494}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988376808', 'num_games_owned': 682, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1468192482}
review:
Not sure how I missed this one. Just picked it up on sale and am enjoying it a lot more than some of the reviews would have you believe. Me and my nephews are having a blast with it.

I've read a lot of people complaining about the jump thing, which isnt really a huge deal. I've seen some reviews stating that the autojump goes against everything they were trying to recreate, but you can use something as inspiration without copying everything that thing did down to every little detail. The auto jump while not ideal works in this game and thats important to note. 

I would say this game set out to recreate the feeling of games of old and in that respect they certainly succeeded.

While I have yet to get anywhere near finishing the game I can say without a doubt this will be a title I enjoy until the end. From a development team I've never heard of this is an amazing job on a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046776459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1467255275}
review:
This is an intriguing little game that starts simply and progresses nicely.  The story is very enjoyable for all ages.  The use of color in the game shows a developer with serious creativity and a desire to create something non-cookiecutter.

The controls are easy and very linear progression.  However I did have some difficulty with the Steam Controller (see the discussions to determine if your controller would work).  But, I needed to revert to Keyboard/Mouse in only a couple situations.

I would recommend this game to others who enjoy games for their beauty or story.  This game is similar to Jak & Dexter and Spiro.  Thank you to the developers for making a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040673927', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1464124819}
review:
This was a wonderful game. It has a light hearted story but still has an important theme that it shows in ways that haven't been seen much since the beginning of the ps2 era. Playing through this gave me a lot of nostalgia for the original Spyro, Ratchet and Clank, Jak and Daxter, Ty the Tasmanian Tiger, and Sly Cooper games. The controls are nice, even with a mouse and keyboard and it has a pleasant, even if somewhat youngish art style which just makes me remember the games that I mentioned before even more. 

As you can see from my play time, it is not a super long game, but I also didn't attempt to get 100% completion. The amount of time it takes does not take away from the fact that it is a very nice game to play. And during the 2016 Summer Sale it is only $4, which for those that worry about amount of play time compared to price, this should put that worry to rest.

I definitely recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990909917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1491221703}
review:
Wirklich ein sch√∂nes Plattform JumpnRun Spiel.

Das Game ist sehr farbenfroh.
Die Welt, indem der Tinker lebt, ist eine bunte farbenfrohe Welt.
Leider verstehen sich einge Farbenst√§mme nicht so gut, mit den anderen.
Darum muss Tinker auf eine abendteuerliche Reise gehen , um dies zu √§ndern.
Er lernt K√§mpfen, F√§higkeiten einsetzen,zeigt sein K√∂pfchen und kann Hilfe rufen, wenn er nicht richtig weiter kommt.

Auf dem Weg zur verbesserung, kommt er zu einem Geist.
Er hat seine Hilfe angeboten, doch leider, wurde Tinker hinters Licht gef√ºhrt.
Somit ist die Farbwelt verblasst, es sieht aus wie etwas Schnee.
Keine Farben mehr, alles trostlos grau-wei√ü.
Jetzt f√§ngt das Abendteuer richtig an.
Tinker muss die Stadt wieder f√§rben, er muss sie von der Bleiche befreien.
Doch wie er das anstellt,k√∂nnt ihr nur Erfahren, in dem ihr dieses sch√∂nes Game spielt.
Es lohnt sich aufjedenfall und ich habe keinen Cent bereut :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198117054702', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1463506414}
review:
The Last Tinker est l'exemple parfait du jeu pour lequel on souhaiterait une autre possibilit√© que recommander ou non le jeu. Vous l'aurez donc compris, je ne recommande pas ce jeu mais il n'est pas inint√©ressant pour autant.

Dans sa narration, le jeu est destin√© √† un public tr√®s jeune malgr√© que la morale derri√®re puisse s'adresser √† tous. J'ai donc eu un peu de mal avec √ßa, je ne m'y attendais pas. Ceci dit, ce n'est pas ce qui est le plus p√©nalisant.

La maniabilit√© est... tr√®s d√©cevante. On finit par s'y habituer, mais qu'est-ce que c'est frustrant... La cam√©ra n'est pas toujours bien calibr√©e, notamment dans les phases de combats ce qui peut √™tre handicapant. Par ailleurs, un jeu de plate-forme o√π le perso ne sait pas sauter... c'est p√©nible de devoir contourner un talus plut√¥t que de sauter dessus....

Le passage des dialogues n'est franchement pas pratique (avoir 5 mots et devoir appuyer sur "f" √† chaque fois pour afficher les 5 mots suivants...............).

Ah, et ne vous attendez pas √† un monde ouvert. Il s'agit d'une suite de chapitre √† suivre. Dans chaque chapitre, des zones sont inaccessibles. Et c√¥t√© dur√©e de vie, ce n'est pas √©norme : comptez une dizaine d'heures.

En dehors de ces aspects n√©gatifs, le jeu est plut√¥t r√©ussi. Graphiquement, il est plut√¥t sympa. Le th√®me est plut√¥t sympa. Dans son gameplay, il rappelle d'autres jeux du genre... mais il est loin de les √©galer. (le budget n'est sans doute pas le m√™me non plus)

Autre point positif, je n'ai pas test√© : le jeu propose une option pour les daltoniens.

Au final, en promo vous pouvez vous laissez tenter bien que l'exp√©rience puisse √™tre assez frustrante. Par contre au prix fort, non je ne le recommande pas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990939508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1680744046}
review:
This is a fun and peaceful game.
At first I wasn't sure if I wanted it.
But I took the gamble and it was worth it.

The story is about reuniting the colors that once lived to gether red, blue and green.
Something has changed them and you must fight the evil that has done this.

The game has allot of parkour in it and it's mechanics work very smooth.
Do I do wish they had added voices as it doesn't have that.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8eBd8dHY0LA

I really appreciate this game and hope to let others discover this gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971617923', 'num_games_owned': 1824, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1507987863}
review:
This is NOT PLATFORMER, even despite it try to look like it! Im so dissapointed, i was looking for old school platformer like in old good PS1\PS2\Xbox days but this game cheated me with false advertising, it just looks like old school platformer, but does not feel neither old school nor platformer. So much of wasted potential!

Game looks nice, has creative art direction and ideas, i want to love it, but cant, because for frack sake - a platformer without JUMP button with automatic jumping and sticking to hotspots? Very very very bad typical modern yourh oriented brainless approved (y.o.b.a) design decision that ruins all the fun of game and makes it feel monorail and restricted, basically all you do is walking and holding "context" button, game does the rest for you. Reminds me a lot recent Thief reboot in terms of restrictions. I really wish devs to redesign it and give us freedom of vertical movement, but im pretty sure this will never happen, most of game devs never admit and correct their mistakes. And its a shame, game really has potential to be a Spyro, Crash, Jax, Banjo etc, but it lacking challenge and vertical freedom of movement, which is what makes platformer a platformer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973230221', 'num_games_owned': 14245, 'num_reviews': 849, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1458644916}
review: First Steam game from developer Mimimi Productions and there are only a few questions where can i get a DLC with PURPLE/ ORANGE/ BROWN/ YELLOW/ RAINBOW TOWN PART? This game is from a small developer studio (look the credits and see how small the team was) so i can only hope they work on a second part (maybe this time we get more colors for our team and 2 enemies like black and his little brother white? I cant await it like white has ice levels where you take care to run not to far (ice effect) and stages with lighnings, care that you dont get blinded from mini suns and black which gravity black holes, traveling black holes, black holes that let fall things on you, earth traps like walls that close because chainging grativiyies or something else. I couldnt await a 2nd part <3. So this game has a really epic story core (sure its not so much story, but it has a great message and the end is really suprising. I LOVE JUMP AN RUNS AND I LOVE THIS CHARMING GAME. Its reminds me on good old times. Sure this game could be bigger but its fine and it could have more achievements (10 golden brushs, 20-70, cleaning a level and/ or cleaning a level total, more collectible items, some rare items to find or spots (easter eggs) but that one it has, has its charme). So sure its not a 100 % jump and run (jumping is more an automatically part) but for most fans it should be good, the game has i think 4 difficulties so for some i has a challenge too. Since i really enjoyed this game i give 92 %. If you rush the game you can get it trough in 7-8 hours so think about if you need a disocunt of 33 % or higher, but its worth the full price. Thx for reading.

Cons:

author: {'steamid': '76561198027372201', 'num_games_owned': 1131, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1456405499}
review:
The Last Tinker - City of Colours is a wundersch√∂nes spiel. Die Welt und die Charaktere sehen allesamt als w√§ren sie aus Pappmache oder Pappe gebastelt und dann angemalt worde. Die Detailverliebtheit is so gro√ü das man √ºberall sogar die vereinzelten Pinselstriche sehen kann. Sogar die Sprechblasen der Charaktere sehen aus als w√§re sie aus Pappe gemacht. Auch die Musik kann sich h√∂ren lassen. 

LEIDER ist das Spieldesign daf√ºr absolut unsinnig. Das Leveldesign ist absolut stocksteif linear. So linear das man schon mal stecken bleiben kann weil man eine von den Designern ungeplante Richtung eingeschlagen hat und der Rhytmus von Platformen dann nicht daf√ºr gedacht ist den Weg wieder zur√ºckzu finden. 
 
Als w√§re das nicht gut genug nimmt einem das Spiel fast ales ab. Zum Himmel noch mal das Spiel nennt sich Platformer hat aber nicht mal einen eignene Knopf f√ºrs springen. Statt dessen h√§lt man den einen Knopf gedr√ºckt und dr√ºckt die Steuerung nach vorne. den rest macht das Spiel dann von alleine. 

Zwischendurch k√§mpft man gegen kleine Ansammlungen von Gegner die jedoch auch keine wirklich Herausforderung bieten. Nicht nur sind diese gegner viel zu leicht auch fehlt der Steuerung hier jeglicher Eindruck von Kraft oder dynamik. Das muss man erst mal schaffen das einem gewaltsamer Komflikt langweilig erscheint.  

Den Vogel hat das Spiel f√ºr mich dann abgeschossen als es mir ein neues "R√§tsel" vorsetzte ohne mir jegliche erkl√§rung zu liefern. Statt dessen bot es irref√ºhrendes Leveldesign an (sprich Barrikaden mit L√ºcken die in der Situationen aussahen als w√ºrden sie als Deckung dienen) und eine Situation die nach einem Treffer zu sofortigen Spilelerversagen f√ºhrte. 

Ich wollte dann nachgoogeln ob es irgendwo eine L√∂sung dazu gibt als mir bewusst wurde was ich da tat und das ich eigentlich keinen Spa√ü hatte. Ein so anspruchsloses und stocklineares Spiel das dann auch noch darin scheitert mir einfache R√§tsel zu vermitteln... ich musste dann einfach aufh√∂ren.


Es ist wirklich eine Schande.Ich w√ºnschte wirklich ich k√∂nnte schummeln und einfach das herrliche Grafikdesign und die bunte Welt und seine Charaktere und Geschichte erforschen. Leider ist das Gesamtpaket einfach zu langweilig und unterdurchschnittlich um mich weiter durch die Level zu ziehen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048632839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1455118085}
review: Un grazioso action-platform che riporta la mente indietro di un paio di generazioni videoludiche. Lo stile √® tecnicamente semplice, colorato e cartonesco... adorabile, con versetti al posto del doppiaggio, un protagonista muto e con una strizzatina d'occhio allo stile MediaMolecule per quanto riguarda le nuvole dei dialoghi e alcuni elementi ambientali come i cespugli, che sono in stile cartone ritagliato,  a suggerire che si sta leggendo uno di quei libri per l'infanzia con le immagini 3D che escono fuori dalle pagine. Lo stesso protagonista, Koru, le cui fattezze scimmiesche farebbero pensare al WuKong di "Viaggio in occidente" √® un Tinker, cio√® un artigiano aggiustatore, apprezzato sin dall'inizio del gioco per le sue doti. Purtroppo di queste sue abilit√† riparatorie non si vedr√† nulla, non vi √® possibilit√† di craftare oggetti e in stile tipicamente platform  non si avr√† nemmeno un approfondimento sulla sua gente, di cui lui sembra essere rimasto (serenamente)  l'ultimo in vita. La giocabilit√† √® solida, ma piuttosto basilare, senza guizzi di stile e abilit√†. I pulsanti sono stati adibiti all'attivazione delle leve e all'uso dei tre colori (rosso,verde,blu) acquisibili, coi rispettivi spiriti guardiani, durante l'avventura. La croce direzionale servir√† unicamente alle special dei suddetti colori,tecniche di attacco e difesa che consumeranno mana fino all' esaurimento della barra,ma che non potranno essere usate fino al suo completamento ne fermate per risparmiare energia. Un falso problema a dire il vero, dato che verranno utilizzate abbastanza raramente. I grilletti superiori invece sono dedicati alla corsa e purtroppo al salto. Dico purtroppo perch√® oltre la maggior durezza del tasto RB, il salto di Koru, con tutto che dovrebbe essere un'agile scimmia non √® degno nemmeno di un giovane essere umano. In verit√† il salto √® utile unicamente a schivare goffamente i colpi nemici, che spesso viaggiano in gruppo, mentre per arrampicarsi e superare torrenti vi sono movimenti semi automatici legati al grilletto Rt della corsa. Per farvi capire meglio, Koru saltella su sporgenze rocciose, barche e pali come un personaggio di Assassin's Creed, ovviamente con molta meno libert√† di esplorazione. Il mondo di ColorTown infatti  √® ben curato come disposizione degli alleati Funghi (trasformabili) e disposizione dei percorsi, ma √® anche un mondo con micro zone ben delinate e non particolarmente vaste, che visiteremo pure con una certa linearit√†. The last Tinker riesce a non farsi sentire troppo stretto grazie a varie diramazioni, simpatici trampolini e un buon uso di barriere dannose che sono estensione del nemico del gioco, ma salta comunque all'occhio come lo stile generale sia monotono nonostante i quartieri dei colori abbiano caratteri fortemente differenti. Riguardo alla difficolt√†, il gioco si attesta sul medio facile, e dico medio perch√® l'ho fatto a livello difficile, con nemici che facevano danno elevato stile Hero-mode di Zelda, anche con piccoli istant-death con alcuni di quelli da distanza, ma che fondamentalmente, senza dover usare poteri speciali, erano facili da aggirare in quanto; lenti, poco vari e davvero stupidi, inoltre i checkpoint sono numerosissimi. Le capacit√† fisiche di Koru saranno ampliabili collezionando cristalli da spendere nei distributori, che √® meglio precisarlo, non elargiranno mosse nuove, ma semplici aumento di danno e durata degli effeti. A proposito dei danni... devo dire di non aver avvertito grandissimi cambiamenti di potenza durante l'avventura, ma forse ci√≤ √® dovuto solo alla legnosit√† delle animazioni di Koru e dei suoi patetici pugnetti. A parte alcune corse su bianari, in stile Ratchet e Clank, gli unici nemici a impegnarmi un minimo sono stati, un mid-Boss acquatico e quello finale. Con l'ultimo ho dovuto anche sorbirmi un paio di volte alcune scenette d'intermezzo, senza possibilit√† di saltarle. Tra i pregi del gioco, oltre allo stile visivo allegro sottolineerei il comparto audio di alcune zone e al tempo stesso nei difetti la scelta di alcuni versi fastidiosi per i personaggi, in particolar modo con lo stridulo Tap, lo svolazzante amico d'infanzia di Koru e con lo spirito Blu, fastidiosamente lagnoso. Nel complesso The Last Tinker √® un bel gioco, uno di quelli in cui senti l'impegno del team, ma anche tutti i loro limiti, un "vorrei ma non posso" dal ritmo blando, ma dalla resa perlomeno discreta. E' un gioco che non ti invoglia particolarmente a riavviarlo per continuare, ma che una volta fatto, segui con discreto piacere. Considerando una durata breve ma onesta, di circa 8/10 ore, mi sento di consigliarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125664030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 381, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1138, 'last_played': 1453643035}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197998118312', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1453655362}
review:
Rating 6/10
Overview: Third Person Platformer

The Good:

+ Vibrant, colorful graphics

+ Charming story 

+ Easy Achievements

+ Controls well

+ Over 20 levels 


The Average:

Boring main character 

Level Design is linear and basic.  

Combat consists of punching and dodging. You can punch enemies with different colors producing different effects. Dodging is somewhat useless as you can just run away before the enemy attacks. 

"Platforming" is done automatically holding down a button  

Conclusion:

According to the description "A joyous action adventure lovingly crafted in the image of all time classics such as Zelda, Jak and Daxter and Banjo Kazooie"...except this game is nothing close to any of those games mentioned. On the one hand this is an indie game that appeals to a younger demographic, on the other hand this game is very average compared to so many other games on the market. In the end, it's hard for me to recommend this game when there are so many other great games in the genre you should be playing.

No jogo voc√™ controla [b]Kuro[/b], o √∫ltimo funileiro, um macaco que vive na "favela" da Cidade das Cores (Colortown) e tem [b]Tap[/b] como companheiro, um animal voador que faz *miu* e *piu* (realmente agoniante). Tap √© atacado por uma gangue e um dos esp√≠ritos fundadores da Colortown se oferece para ajudar. Ent√£o a aventura come√ßa (o jogo come√ßa antes, mas √© a partir da√≠ que "de fato" come√ßa).

Kuro √© um macaco porr.adeiro, ele pode correr, rolar, dar um "pulo" e fazer algumas sequ√™ncias bem legais. A parte de "plataforma" √© quase terci√°ria, sendo mais free-run com alguns obst√°culos. Voc√™ controla tamb√©m tr√™s tipos de poderes a agressividade (vermelho), o medo (verde) e a afli√ß√£o (azul), bem utilizadas em diferentes tipos de inimigos (j√° quase no final do game). 

A trilha sonora √© ok, mas n√£o √© marcante. Quanto √† dificuldade, o jogo peca bastante: tem um n√∫mero baixo de inimigos, tornando-o muito f√°cil. Talvez apenas a luta com o boss final seja um pouco desafiadora (sendo que h√° 2 ou 3 chefes). O tempo de jogo √© curto, entre 5~6 horas (e isso porque eu finalizei o jogo no dif√≠cil), para os 100% sobe para 7~8 horas. Os controles s√£o f√°cies, a mec√¢nica √© ok com uma fluidez ok (voc√™ n√£o ver√° nada de espetacutar).

O chamativo est√° em seu gr√°fico, cada cen√°rio √© muito bem feito (e disso o jogo disp√µe de um bom n√∫mero), as personagens s√£o bem caricaturizadas. Os gr√°ficos do jogo remete √† pinturas, fazendo voc√™ se sentir em um desenho animado.

Temos assim definido o p√∫blico alvo do jogo: [b] ADIANTA DAR UMA CHANCE [/b] jogadores que gostam de jogos de aventura bem feitos, mas que n√£o se importam de n√£o ter grandes desafios (isso colocando no dif√≠cil), ainda assim espere uma promo√ß√£o: o tempo de campanha √© curto demais para o valor atual do jogo. review:
Alles in allem ein sehr spa√üiges Spiel, welches viele Erinnerungen an alte Werke, wie beispielsweise Jack & Daxter, weckt. Vorallem zu Beginn erscheint einem das Spiel als ziemlich simpel und tr√§ge (was auch an den teilweise holzigen Animationen liegt), entwickelt seine St√§rken aber vorallem im sp√§teren Verlauf, wo die R√§tsel- und Kampfkomplexit√§t zunimmt. Auch Profir√§tsler werden sp√§ter an der einen oder anderen Stelle, zumindest kurz, stecken bleiben und gefordert werden. Die Geschichte ist einfach gehalten, hat aber trotzdem viel Tiefgang. Vorallem wenn man sich die heutige Gesellschaft anschaut, findet man viele Parallelen.
