author: {'steamid': '76561198096888128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1584197993}
review:
Ich habe das Spiel f√ºr meine 7 Jahre alte Tochter geholt. Und f√ºr die ist es auch wunderbar, da es einen "Kindermodus" gibt, in dem man praktisch weder richtig sterben noch irgendwo stecken bleiben kann.
Ganz nebenbei konnte sie durch das Spiel auch noch ein wenig lesen √ºben, aber das nur am Rande bemerkt.

Ob mir selbst das Spiel l√§nger gefallen w√ºrde, wage ich zu bezweifeln, aber die Grafik im farbenfrohen Comicstil ist stimmig und passt auch gut zum Sound, die Story ist simpel gehalten und passt ebenfalls zum Rest des Spiels. 
Insgesamt wirkt es ein wenig wie ein "Baby-Assassins Creed" f√ºr Einsteiger.

Daher h√§lt das Spiel auch, was es verspricht, ich w√ºrde allerdings nur im Sale eine Kaufempfehlung aussprechen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047646510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1451377819}
review:
[b]Overview[/b]:  This is one of the best spins on adventure games i've played in a while. It reminded me of ye ol' Jak and Daxter and Ratchet and Clank, where you have just a simplistic complication, but don't let that fool you as there is more to this game then it seems.

[b]Story[/b]:  Being one of the few members of the town outside the major districts, your little community takes in all kinds of color'ed people and the town acts as a neutral settlement for people afraid of their own districts. Majority of the game revolves around the complications each of the 3 colors present to one another;
[u]Red[/u] most commonly known for anger and rage is well represented through the Red characters.
[u]Green[/u], the curious types of people who turned coward, have more of a technological side with their robust defenses and how they live boarded up in their homes away from all the outsiders.
[u]Blue[/u] was the trading hub of color, which in this world was the biggest product that everyone needed and used. Although due to complications they all turned sad and depressed.

At the very start it may seem slow, but if you pull through the excellent tutorial that is given and move towards the big twist that even I did not see coming, the game draws itself a quite nice narrative.

[b]Gameplay[/b]:  The combat after you reach the fighting part of the tutorial seems very bland, sort of a button mash really to kill most of the enemies early game. But I digress as the further in the game you play you can purchase upgrades and combo's for your attacks and also increase duration of abilities. This allows for people with different playstyles to work more efficiently and perhaps change the gameplay to suite individual people.

The parkour element, a MAJOR part of the game is very well produced. The smooth maneuvering of jumping around on boxes and planks really feels fluent. It may be hard to understand at first but once you get through the basic of how to jump around without stopping to look around it becomes a fun experience jumping around and exploring to find collectibles.

[b]Controls[/b]:  A combat/parkour game must have a big majority of the focus on the controls, without doing so it could make the game feel troublesome to control and overall a bad experience. From what I have played of the game using my Xbox 360 controller ([i]Yes it supports xbox controller which is a big plus for me[/i]) it is very difficult to get used to from the average buttons. The interact button is what would strike most people as the most unusual, as on the 360 controller it is (Y), and you will see why it is as you progress through the game.
The combat portion of the controls amongst the parkour is also very fun to play with. It has a dodge mechanic which seems very functional when needing to dodge attacks, and can also be used to initiate combos and reach platforms if performed correctly.

[b]Sumarrising Statement[/b]:  This game may not be as extensive as the old PS2 games that this game seems inspired off, it does bring a nuance in this genre with its unique parkour concept and the difficult combat found later in the game. I greatly feel this game is well worth the $4 spent and is a must pickup if it goes on sale for lower.
8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198033280875', 'num_games_owned': 638, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1424723267}
review: Fantasievolle Welt, gespickt mit kleinen R√§tsel, netten Easter eggs und absolut liebevoll designten Charaktere. Die Jump N Run Passagen sind etwas zu vereinfacht, was durch das Kampfsystem mit verschiedensten Gegnern und Bossen ausgeglichen wird. Story, Ton, Musik, Atmosphere, alles top f√ºr Indieliebhaber!

author: {'steamid': '76561198168847315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1450629670}
review:
A very cute game, and though simplistic in controls, enoguh challenging puzzles to motivate you to play through the game.

If you are looking for a game that is going to make you pull your hair out while you spew curses at the screen, while beggin for mercy- look elsewhere. If you want to have bragging right on the top of leaderboards; again look elsewhere. 
If you want a fun action platformer, where you don't need to really hone your skills to have a bit of a good time, you may like me enjoy this.

Though at it's core a platformer, you don't really have to worry too much about complex jumps or mastry of timing to be able to play this. jumping is done for you so long as you hold the action button- which i'll admit I initially thought i would dislike, but there are enough timing element in the level design, that this strangly doesn't get boring, but is a welcome relief if you are looking for just a quick escape from reality. 

the style is adorable and it reminds me of some games of old in some ways, being very design friendly for a youthful audience, but as a n adult it is also a peaceful, quirky hand painted environment. There are the occasional seam, of meshes clipping through in the animation, but if you aren't looking for it, you may never notice.

Overall: a great game for a younger audience, or an audience of the young at heart. This should challenge you too much, but I did have my fair share of trial and error, especially if i got too cocky. the story is a feel good romp similar to a childrens book fairy tale, and i'd recomend this game to any who are looking for a game to play when they just want to escape the bleakness of the world sometimes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116816455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1509113296}

I have no words, I just finished and I'm too excited! A really excellent game, especially a small masterpiece from an artistic ... is fantastic. This rare gem, in its simplicity, teaches much and from which we should take example. Anyone even vaguely interested, I encourage the purchase because it deserves ... really deserves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247010618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1448941666}
review: Although seemingly oriented to a younger audience, the story carries surprisingly mature themes that speak to all. The visual style is crisp and consistent. The game is beautiful aesthetically which just adds to its charm.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971473481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1451273474}
review: This game has a great story, and is easy to play. I bought it while it was on sale because I liked the art style of it and the art themes. Very nice visually. I played it with a keyboard and mouse, which took a few minutes to get use to, but after that I had no problem with the controls. The game did a nice job of introducing something new throughout the game so that the gameplay never bacame boring, and it offers extra bonuses to players that want to explore a bit. Overall I thoroughly enjoyed it. Took me about 7 hours to complete and I hope the developers create more games like this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198260282960', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1449951821}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978454124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1450146605}
review:
Yes, as some reviews state the game is "easy". But difficulty is not what this game is about.
It's an eye candy platformer for kids and adults alike. The art style is beautiful, colorful, and vibrant. 
If you like eye candy and causual gameplay this game will be right up your alley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263768027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1450819423}
review: The Last Tinker is definitely reminiscent of the vibrant and lush adventure games of the past in both it's look and feel.  It doesn't quite fit under the genre of a free-range adventure game like Zelda, nor does it fit strictly under a 3D platformer genre like Crash Bandicoot- it's somewhere in between.  The game is on the easier side, but it's still enjoyable.  The developers did a nice job of mixing up the gameplay between puzzles, exploring, fighting, and other more unique gameplay features such that they're all easy, but you don't get bored from doing the exact same thing the entire time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042371291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1449626448}
review:
I do recommend the game highly. I have played it for two hours total, and that's all the game might get out of me.

That sounds hypocritical to you? Let me explain.
The games environment is wonderful, the combat is simple yet fun. The characters are also fun and I just had a smile on my face for the most part. The game mechanics are fun and has a bit of relaxation to them yet it gives you a bit of adrenaline from time to time. I enjoyed the story thus far too.

The problem is, if you have any controller other than the 360 controller, you're going to have a bad time starting this fun game. The first time is fine, second time maybe too. But after that, you won't be able to load your game. They have a major bug with other controllers (Xbox One for me) that forces you to scroll through the menu to the left constantly. Also any other settings you'd want to change with the controller are impossible. I set my controls in the beginning to controller only and even if I pull out my Xbox One controller, to try and navigate, I won't have much luck. Some button placement is also not properly linked with any controller other than the 360.


So if you have a 360 controller, you'll love this game. If you have any other controller, it's better to skip the buy and wait for the company to fix it. I will just hope they'll fix it. Because it might be a game I'd want my future kids to play, but there won't be any 360 controllers around anymore by then, so they game would literally die out at one point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043953783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1451411187}
review:
If I were to describe this game in 2 words, they would be: Spyro Nostalgia.

Yes, this game is simple, easy, short, limited and childish; but the same could be said for most classic childhood games. It has small subtle elements of games like Jak and Daxter, Ratchet and Clank, and Crash Banidcoot but more than any other game, it reminds me of Spyro. The gameplay, the progression, the story, the characters, the enviroment, the little annoying squeaky follower that talks on your behalf because your character is either a mute or an asshole. The list goes on...

Back in the day when games were short and simple this could fly but nowadays it is much harder to compete with modern games. There I both recommend and not recommend the game based on the following:

-IF you never had a childhood (Probably adopted by sterotypical overachieving Asian parents) and never got to play Spyro or other games like it then this game is probably a waste of your time and money. 

-IF you did have a proper childhood (Thank your parents) and/or still are a child AND played similar games such as Spyro or whatever then I definitely recommend this. Let's face it, the older games seemed like classics because there was nothing better to play then and in many ways are just plain and simple great fun. In many ways those games are arguably better than The Last Tinker and actually have more to them BUT they don't make them anymore. If you're anything like me you've milked those childhood games dry over time through Playstation 1, Playstation 2, Playstation 3 HD remakes and even Playstation emulators. The Last Tinker is the closest you'll get to reliving those types of childhood games.

That nostalgia aside (the main selling point), the graphics aren't bad. The game has a very colourful, vibrant look but that is also due to the story line. No framerate issues that I've noticed nor any pixelation. No bugs or glitches. Simple controls, enemies and powers to learn. Decent soundtrack. Replayable missions if anything was missed. Easily completed steam achievements. Fun unlockable visual modes (Small heads, Big heads, Black & White, Colour Reverse, Mirror World, God Mode, Arena). No real overall downside to this game, only things that not appeal to your game tastes.

P.S. This is my first review. Sorry if it was unhelpful, unagreeable or too long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047402570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1035, 'last_played': 1449919878}
review:
I had really low expectations going into this game, but I was surprised by how good it actually is. There is a lot of variety and cool ideas in terms of gameplay, it doesn't really get boring. The story is definitely not the best thing about this game; it's a bit inconherent and simple (it's a kid's game after all), but it does convey a nice message and is definitely heartwarming. The controls and especially the camera can be a bit annoying at times, I too would have liked if there was actual platforming, but I think the movement is done well enough overall. One thing that's also worth mentioning is that this does have its infuriating moments, where you will die seemingly for no reason until you understand the unintuitive logic of the game, but these are quite rare and usually the game is rather easy (though there is a difficulty setting).
All in all it's a great game that reminds me of games I really liked on my GameCube and that just don't really seem to get made for PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009662092', 'num_games_owned': 3450, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1449219394}
review:
They claim this game is crafted in the `image` of classics like Jak and Daxter and Banjo Kazooie.

The thing is, both of those games are fluid action platformers where you can jump.  

This game is a clunky brawler where navigating any set piece with a gap involve holding the easy button until it works.

So the image of those games are just bouncy visuals wrapped around a Zelda like game with minimal interactivity and mediocre design.  

It would have been a lackluster introduction during the time of it's inspirations, and hardly a rebirth of the magic of yesteryear.  It's just a mediocre game that tries to oversell itself by mentioning big names undeservedly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030702683', 'num_games_owned': 960, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1449454334}
review:
This is probably one of the more interesting titles I've played this year. The concept is fun, the idea of color spirits affecting emotions is really neat (there are few things funnier that I've found than terrifying an enemy into running straight into an instant-death-trap), and its all done in a cartoony papercraft style that I'm finding really endearing.

Controls are tight, combat is good, and the puzzles are fun (while a couple can be a bit of a bitch to do). If you want something to tide you over until Yooka Laylee this is a good buy. I nabbed it on impulse when I saw it on sale and I find I'm quite glad I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062536434', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1453561686}

author: {'steamid': '76561198083100143', 'num_games_owned': 1638, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1449008929}
review:
[h1]Uno dei migliori giochi creati con unity che io abbia mai giocato.[/h1]
Un BIG UP per questi sviluppatori indie che hanno fatto davvero un ottimo lavoro :)

+ Grafica (a parer mio punto forte del gioco) davvero molto carina e colorata
+ Personaggi molto carini
+ Ambientazione fantastica
+ Musiche ottime, non particolarmente ma sinceramente mi aspettavo di meno per un gioco del genere
+ Ottima trama
+ Narrazione fantastica

- Talmente semplice da diventare a volte noioso
- Controlli scomodi e in certi casi frustranti che a parer mio potevano essere tranquillamente migliorati
- Il level design non √® proprio il massimo

Voto: 7.5/10
Un platform semplice e graficamente molto carino, che a tratti mi ricorda giochi come Banjo Kazooie per N64. 
Il gioco nel suo complesso mi √® sembrato forse un po troppo da bambini ma consiglio assolutamente di dare un'occhiata se vi piace il genere. Sconsiglio comunque di prenderlo a prezzo pieno, 20 euro √® abbastanza eccessivo per un gioco del genere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190516778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1694913021}
review:
Let me start off by saying this:

If you're a PC player with an X-Box 360 controller, or a Mac player with a PS3 controller, this warning doesn't apply to you. I hope you enjoy the game!

Unfortunately for those of us playing on a different gamepad, this game will not work. I tried work-arounds to get it going, with no luck. Looking at the Steam forum for this game, there is a large quantity of other buyers that faced the same predicament, and a number of them just chose to hide the game from their library. I guess this is what I'll do.

The devs apologize, but haven't found a way to accommodate these players, and seem to blame buyers in the forum for not looking at the fine print of the support details. Fair enough.

Aside from the fact that I won't be playing it, the game does seem interesting, and the visuals are very nice. Hopefully if these developers put out another game in the future, they won't make the same large oversight.
developer_response:
Hi there,

we have just released a patch that addresses some of the problems that customers have experienced with the game's controller support.
We would like to encourage you to check out the game with this latest patch and let us know if we were able to fix your problem with the game.
Sorry that it took us so long.

You can check out the patch announcement details here: http://steamcommunity.com/games/thelasttinker_cityofcolors/announcements/detail/2484169392182318923

Greetings from Germany,
The Mimimis

author: {'steamid': '76561198104237636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1438321697}
review:
I went into this looking for something along the lines of the Nintendo64 games I grew up on. 
I was not disappointed, it plays like Banjo & Kazooie or the first Jax and Daxter game. It is a solid action-adventure game with good combat mechanics and a wonderful art. The story, if a little tried works well and the worlds unique nature and setting carries it well. As to the art, it feels perfect for the game, the cardboard, paper and ink fit the story so well. 

My only real dislike was the short length of the game, I was just starting to get invested in the game and the characters when it ended. 

Overall, it is a nice little tribute to the classic era of 3D games and a fun nostalgia trip worthy of a try. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198081691855', 'num_games_owned': 10859, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1445000510}
review:
Mimimi Productions wei√ü wie man moderne 3D Plattformer macht. Leider gibt es davon zu wenige heutzutage.
Charakterdesign ist gro√üartig, lustig und die Story/Dialoge nicht immer f√ºr Kinder verst√§ndlich 

F√ºr √§ltere aber gro√üartig und unterhaltsam.
Kampfsystem sowie F√§higkeiten sind anfangs noch selten, baut sich aber extrem gut auf und es entsteht ein verdammt guter Flow.
Der einzige Nachteil beim Sprungsystem, es ist sehr vereinfacht und wurde sich an aktuellen Spielen orientiert. Aber selbst Triple A Titel wie Batman haben so ein "casual" System, von daher nur eine Randnotiz.

Anfangs dacht' ich "Ein weiteres Unity Indie Spiel? Neiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiin" Da bisher zu 90% nur M√ºll produziert wurde. Hier haben sich die Entwickler aber verdammt viel M√ºhe gegeben und im Bundle war es eine mega √úberraschung!!!
Klare Kaufempfehlung, vorallem f√ºr die, die auf 3D Plattformer in den 90ern liebten. 

Es hat echt viel zu bieten, gerne mehr Mimimi Productions!!!!!!!!!!! :) 
Mit Daedalic Entertainment hat man da auch einen perfekten Publisher gefunden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005779695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1468637587}
review:
I found this game as I looked under the description Banjo-Kazooie and Collect-a-thon and things of that nature. I guess that would've been my first mistake, because I should've assumed that it wouldn't live up to my expectations of Banjo-Kazooie. However, I was dead-wrong. The Last Tinker: City of Colors has this sense of uniqueness that you just don't find in many other games. The heavy use of colors as the symbol for the entire storyline really spoke to me on a deeper level. The interactions between each color group pre- and post-unity is really spectacular, and going through Purple's memories really sealed the deal for me.

Also, plenty of props to the music team on this one. You all really know how to get a mood flowing in each stage of the game. Excellent job.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972918264', 'num_games_owned': 11679, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1444936742}

Controls 9/10 - Full gamepad support
This is a cute and well made game for kids of all ages.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043579969', 'num_games_owned': 951, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1443739313}
review:
Una critica sociale. Un gioco che parla di razzismo, emotivit√† e differenza tra i popoli; temi che vengono "occultati" dalla presenza dei colori e da altri artifizi...avrei molto altro da dire, ma io preferisco che lo giochiate.

Il gameplay √® molto semplice, ma ben costruito: si segue un percorso abbastanza lineare su zone platform con pochi bivi ( giusto per cercare gli EXTRA ), ma dal sistema di movimento si evince di avere tra le mani un assassin's creed molto semplificato; stesso discorso per il combat system, che altri non √® che un "Arkham like" semplificato ma completo ( ci sono anche gli upgrade ).

Il punto forte del gioco √® sicuramente la direzione artistica a cui bisogna solo che applaudire, i dialoghi e la storia ti fanno seguire la vicenda senza scollarti un momento, i temi elencati di sopra poi chiudono il cerchio.

Lo consiglio a tutti... dal canto mio, √® perfetto come "primo gioco" per il "Gamer neonato". Quando avr√≤ un figlio, lo crescer√≤ a suon di Super Mario, Zelda, Final Fantasy...e Last Tinker.

Trotz der vielen positiven Punkte, wird teilweise die Abwechslung vernachl√§ssigt, das hei√üt wiederholende K√§mpfe. Aber ich habe etwas dar√ºber hinweg gesehen, da der Rest einfach stimmt.

Der Vollpreis ist etwas zu hoch, wartet auf ein Angebot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241847162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1498079151}
review:
[h1][b]Game for being united[/b][/h1]

I originally got this for my yougest to play, she's 8yrs old, but after watching her play it seemed really interesting.
I play it now and it is really cool.\
[list]
[*]Controls are very smooth and use full controller support.
[*]Graphics are very clean and crisp
[*]Audio is very nice
[*]Game reminds me of a different era when games were about fun. Not about how realistic it is but gaming enjoyment.
    It's not supposed to be real. :)
[*]Has an amazing message about racism in game. I personally agree with this games message do to the fact i'm white and my woman is black and we have 'mixed' kids.
    ([i]Don't like that word 'mixed'[/i]).
[/list]

The game is actually fun and has a color-blind mode that really does work. (I'm color-blind myself)
So if you are looking for something kid friendly and still can be played by all, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075134989', 'num_games_owned': 764, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1441816718}
review:
A nice adventure game, albeit short, it took me about 7.5h to beat it. I still need to get all the collectibles.
Here's the pros and cons:
Pros:
-Very well written storyline
-Beautiful art
-Unlockable artwork and visual "cheats"
-Awesome music
-Powerups
-Good controller support
-Enemy diversity

Cons:
-Controls (sometimes it can be a bit clumsy, especially during combat)
-Short story
-Speech bubbles can get off-screen too fast

author: {'steamid': '76561198043282874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1647650503}
review:
"Ein buntes Prince of Persia f√ºr die Kleinen und Junggebliebenen unter uns. Ein Plattform-Sammel-Abenteuer, das vor allem durch seine k√ºnstlerische Pr√§sentation und einen gro√üartigen Soundtrack √ºberzeugt " BlackCat 2015 ~

Story:
In einer Welt die aus Papier, Farbe und Kleber besteht exisitiert die Stadt der Farben, in der die neugierigen Gr√ºnen, die starken Roten und die sanften Blauen friedlich miteinander leben. Doch mit der Zeit geht diese Freundschaft in die Br√ºche, die Farbenleute m√∂gen sich nicht mehr und gr√ºnden eigene Bezirke, in denen nur ihre Farbe als sch√∂n gilt. Als dann noch eine wei√üe Bedrohung die bunte Welt zu zerst√∂ren droht, muss der letzte Tinker losziehen, um diese Missst√§nde wieder geradezubiegen.

Eine recht kindliche Geschichte ohne gro√üe Plottwists, die allerdings motivierend genug und durch abwechselnde Umgebungen aufregend genug ist, um sie bis zum Ende erleben zu wollen. Auch k√∂nnten sich einige gerade zur heutigen Zeit die Moral der Geschichte, dass ALLE Farben sch√∂n sind und Anderssein nicht zwingend schlecht ist, mal wieder ins Ged√§chtnis rufen.

Gameplay:
Der oben gebrachte Vergleich mit Prince of Persia trifft es eigentlich ganz gut, wenn man sich das ganze etwas kindlicher, sprich einfacher, vorstellt. Die Plattformpassagen k√∂nnen durch das Gedr√ºckthalten eines Knopfes und eines einfachen Richtungswechsels gemeistert werden und die Kampfpassagen k√∂nnen gr√∂√ütenteils durch simples Buttonmashing gel√∂st werden. Allerdings muss das gar nicht negativ gewertet werden, da das einfache Plattforming das Erkunden der kunterbunten Welt beg√ºnstigt und auch das Kampfsystem durch erlernbare Farbf√§higkeiten etwas Tiefgang gewinnt. Nach eigener Erfahrung kann ich den Gebrauch eines Controllers empfehlen, doch ist dieser nicht zwingend notwendig.

Pr√§sentation:
Man kann es wohl nicht anders sagen: Dieses Spiel ist eine Augenweide. Das Thema "Farbe" zieht sich durch das gesamte Spiel und wurde gro√üartig umgesetzt. In den einzelnen Farbgebieten dominieren die angesiedelten Farben und bringen die gewollte Stimmung r√ºber. Von den Schaupl√§tzen reicht das Spiel von fr√∂hlich gr√ºnen Wiesen √ºber bunte M√§rkte bis hin zu d√ºsteren H√∂hlen und wei√üen Traumpassagen, in denen es eine wahre Freude ist, sich umzusehen.
Was die einzelnen Level noch lebhafter macht ist der Soundtrack, der so stimmig oder harmonisch ist, dass ich mich oft dabei erwischt habe, zu Beginn eines neuen Levels erst einmal innezuhalten, die Augen zu schlie√üen und die Musik auf mich wirkenzulassen.

Fazit:
The Last Tinker ist ein Spiel f√ºr alle, die mal keine gro√üe Herausforderung suchen ( es sei denn, ihr wollt alle Errungenschaften ohne Guides erreichen ), sondern sich von einem bunten, humorvollen und entspannenden Spiel berieseln lassen wollen. Das fl√ºssige Gameplay, die Atmosph√§re und die Tatsache, dass man nicht wirklich sterben kann erzeugen ein stressfreies Spieleerlebnis, das f√ºr den vollen Preis f√ºr Kinder durchaus ein tolles Abenteuer bietet, im Sale aber eine fantastische Reise f√ºr Jedermann bereith√§lt, die man in knapp 8 Stunden erleben kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 1451, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1441535835}
review:
A non-biased quick look @ the game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QQ2HnGF2FUY

Fans of games like Jak and Dexter, Banjo Kazooie and Zelda will have a lot of fun with this game. The Last Tinker is a joyous action adventure. It's a colorful journey through Colortown, a world built upon creativity, emotion and collaboration.

A dark force named The Bleakness has emerged and seeks to tear the colors apart, draining all joy and life from the world.
Koru, a young boy from the slums of Colortown, is forced to act. He embarks on an epic and one of a kind adventure to combat the Bleakness and to restore joy and color to his home.  - Highly Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017607906', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1441566314}
review: Great platforming, visuals, story and everything, but the fighting makes it awful :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198001794713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 427, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1441402520}
review:
Unfortunately bland and boring. Also broken as hell. I experienced a game breaking bug making it impossible to play through.

Pros:

+ the story is okay, its more likely something for younger kids
+ some variety in gameplay
+ okay soundtrack, nothing memorable
+ controller works fine and has a nice layout

Cons:

- I constantly came across bugs, it went as far as not being able to progress anymore, ( a security robot keeps shooting me as I spawn, no matter what I do, you are supposed to avoid cameras that will detect you, but its impossible)
- this is a plattformer without plattforming. Everything is automatically done a la Assassins Creed, which is a bad thing
- fight system is rather pointless, as there is no punishment for dying whatsoever, making it boring and giving no challenge at all
- there is only one boss battle that is recycled multiple times......just lazy and boring

I think even kids will find this underwhelming as its so boring and dumbed down. It could have been a cool game, but without any challenging gameplay whatsoever its not much of a game.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198018664486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1441070242}
review:
Wish there was a "maybe" feature (again)

This game is beautiful - has it's own unique and stunning aesthetic. And the story is interesting enough! I like that it plays similar to games like Zelda & Banjo & Kazooie. I should stress that it only plays similarly, but not that similar. I also like how it's a platformer that doesn't rely on you pressing jump at the right times - it adds a nice fluidity to the game that zelda got right! jumping can be stressful in a 3D platformer. You're either going to hate this mechanic, or welcome it.

What I DON'T like about this game is how incredibly easy it is, with random spikes of "wtf do I do?" thrown in. Where you're not sure if it's the difficulty, or a bug. I feel like this game is aimed at a much younger audience, so I can't be too critical of the level of easyness. But I kept getting stuck at 1 or 2 parts - the first was because I didn't look around enough (fair enough!). the 2nd is what made me uninstall because it seemed to be impossible.... and in my mind, if what was waiting for me after that was another long stretch of "ho hum hold r trigger" then I just can't stay motivated to see it through.

Buy it on sale. Buy it if you have kids. The quality is definitely present in this game... just not 100% throughout

author: {'steamid': '76561198117225156', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1462485225}
review:
Allow me to explain;
You play as "Koru" a human-like being in Colortown, who is also a Tinker, the last of his kind.
You play through many levels where you use familiar styles, such as Sonic, Mario and Zelda.

The Sonic aspects consist of: Running, slowing down time/speeding yourself up, grinding on rails.

Mario aspects: Platforming and very uplifting.

Zelda: A story that goes deep and is worth playing through, with puzzles and different forms of fighting other than using your fists.

On the surface of this beautiful game it looks peaceful, like a child with a kind heart drew it and put it on the fridge door.
But beneath the surface lies a dark and twisted truth, one that resembles real world struggles, such as racism, steriotypes and generally just how our world is, blue is sad, green is afraid, and red is always angry, they dislike the other colours, much like some of us dislike other races and people's beliefs.

The Bleakness may seem evil, but Bleakness is what resides in us all, the feeling of no hope, like there's just no other way, so you destroy, just to start anew...
When others would ask; "Why start over? It's already perfect how it is."

Listen to the story and you will most likely relate to some of the problems going on, don't let the surfaces of this world fool you...

author: {'steamid': '76561198011221192', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1440780388}
review: I liked this game, its not a precision platformer, more like a casual platformer with a decent flow in the gameplay, combat was fun, kinda felt a bit unfair sometimes due to the lack of invincibility frames on hits meaning multiple enemies can stunlock you pretty easily, that said with the unlocks it makes the combat fairly quick and some decent combo potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134304874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1581, 'last_played': 1670297747}
review: This game is amazing. Just as inspired from Zelda, Banjo and Jak. It mostly reminds me of Jak and Daxter with the amazing environment. Even without AO the game still looks good. Don't trust the negative reviews and buy this game. Not alot of games are like this on Steam and its worth the 20 dollars if you love 3D platformers with perfect models and graphics and extreamly fun gameplay. Go buy it already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085548416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1438965697}
review:
Whoa!  This is probably one of the best games I've seen in years.  The attention to detail is amazing, and all the elements work together perfectly.  I played this with my flatmates for a bit and the story and colour make it a great game to watch as well as play.  It brought back memories of those old 3D games Nintendo brought out - Zelda, Banjo Kazui, etc.  A lot of fun, and well worth the price.  There are a number of different difficulty settings, including one for kids.

Sorry this review is a bit all over the place.  The game isn't.  It's slick and beautiful, and still light and fun.  Awesome fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081581433', 'num_games_owned': 941, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1438871148}
review: No jump button.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007039384', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1420110721}
review:
An unbelievably beautiful game with great gameplay, but the level design is at times infuriating. Infuriating to the point of hating the game. I never found the game even remotely difficult, but I did find myself trapped because I managed to get on the wrong side of a gate, or wall, or be otherwise separated from something important that forced me to restart the level.

This didn't happen once or twice.

EDIT: There is a menu function that I was not aware of at the time of writing that lets you reset the player.

I also think that the game needs to think about how it pitches itself. I bought the game based on the description, and the games that it mentions in that description. It isn't sufficiently reminiscent of any of those games for the references to be anything other than misleading.

EDIT: The description has been changed.

Patch the glitches
Rewrite the description

author: {'steamid': '76561198067005465', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1438774245}
review:
[h1]Mentiroso y aburrido.[/h1]

Es horrible, horrible. S√≠, cuando empiezas el juego es divertido, art√≠sticamente es muy bonito, el mundo es colorido, te da tareas para hacer y quiere dar la sensaci√≥n de que se pueden hacer cosas m√°s all√° de la trama principal y que los escenarios son lo suficientemente abiertos como para poder ser explorados. Pero s√≥lo eso, da la sensaci√≥n y ya est√°. Conforme avanzas la diversi√≥n se desvanece y el juego pasa al tedio, al cansancio, al aburrimiento. 

En la p√°gina del juego en Steam 'The Last Tinker' se describe como "un colorido juego de plataformas que sigue la estela de cl√°sicos como Jak and Daxter y Banjo Kazooie". Mentira. En los juegos mencionados se puede saltar cuando quieras, en 'The Last Tinker' no. Hay un bot√≥n de salto, pero s√≥lo se puede utilizar cuando el juego te lo permite, esto es para saltar hacia una plataforma o superficie dise√±ada para que se pueda alcanzar mediante un salto. O lo que es lo mismo, no se puede saltar cuando quieras, no podr√°s alcanzar la parte m√°s alta de una caba√±a subiendo a distintas plataformas u objetos. Para que lo entend√°is, son saltos semiautom√°ticos como los de un Assassin's Creed. Y cuando llevas varias horas avanzando √∫nicamente hacia delante, con casi nulas posibilidades de poder fallar un salto en escenarios poco explorables, realizando una y otra vez la misma tarea, resolviendo puzzles sencillos que se repiten una y otra vez y enfrent√°ndote a enemigos est√∫pidos que te atacan por turnos con un sistema de combate que se quiere parecer al de los Batman, cuando llevas tiempo haciendo eso acabas hasta las narices. Al final, y para romper la monoton√≠a, casi te ves en la obligaci√≥n de buscar los t√≠picos coleccionables en forma de brochas flotantes. Que no cambia demasiado la cosa, porque los saltos siguen estando limitados.

Si sent√≠s curiosidad, compradlo cuando est√© muy rebajado o en un bundle. Pagar m√°s por lo que se supone es "un juego de plataformas que sigue la estela de cl√°sicos como Jak and Daxter y Banjo Kazooie" es tirar el dinero.

review:
The Last Tinker - City of Colors richtet sich zwar an die J√ºngere Zocker Gemeinde aber dennoch f√ºr meine 27. Jahre hatte ich mit dem Spiel jede menge Spannende und Lustige Momente und mit dem verschiedenen Figuren und ihren wirklich witzig und charmant designt. Auch die Musik die in jeden Bezirk warteten  schon richtig sch√∂n, man f√ºhlte sich wie bei Benjo und Kaazo zur√ºck versetzt.

Die Sprungpassagen sind zwar vorgezeichneten Weg mit dem schnellen Lauf aber das st√∂rte mich weniger. Die Gegner sind zwar unterschiedlich, doch man kann fast immer mit seinen Farb Moves bek√§mpfen. Die Zwischen- und Endgegner sind zwar kreativ, doch immer leicht zu erledigen.

Fazit: Das Geld das man in diesen Game investiert ist sein Geld wirklich wert. Und wer noch ein bisschen mehr Geld reinsteckt bekommt sogar die sch√∂nen Lieder aus diesem Spiel. Ich hoffe die Erfinder dieses Spiels beeindrucken euch und mich weiterhin mit solche Gerns.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064227145', 'num_games_owned': 1511, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1437290386}
review:
The Last Tinker‚Ñ¢: City of Colors is an extremely charming little 3D platforming puzzle game. Don't expect a platformer in the likes of Banjo Kazooie though - expect more of a simplified Assassin's Creed 'free-running' style of platforming. If you're fine with that though, this game has a lot to offer and is, as I said, an extremely charming game. It took me approximately 5 hours to complete, although I didn't collect every last thing there was to collect, so this time could be extended out a little. AND I used a gamepad, so keep that in mind too.

The most striking thing about this game is its visual appeal. A world made out of bright and colourful paper glued together sets the scene for a very enjoyable experience for all ages. The story really is quite good, and it does have those 'moral-of-the-story' elements that would be quite good for children and, at times, a wake-up call for adults. The soundtrack for the game is fantastic too - something that I was very pleased about!

Now, as I said in the intro, the platforming of this game is quite basic. Simply hold down the 'free-running' button and move your character in the direction you wish to go in. However, that's not to say that the overall gameplay is stale. The puzzle elements of the game are often tied into the platforming, which is what creates the challenge. And where there isn't a crossover between the two, the puzzles were really well-done!

Finally, without giving away too much of the story, I shall talk about the combat. As you progress through the game you will unlock more abilities that will coincide with meeting more challenging foes or coming across areas that require something new to happen. I never felt as though I was doing the same thing over and over like a grind. It's not an amazing combat system, but it is still seriously enjoyable. Simply put, you press a button that is tied to one of your abilities and you punch a guy. These abilities are 'colours', and so pressing A on a gamepad will turn the bad guy green, because, A on a gamepad... it's green... Anyway, this can often lead to some cool strategies for taking out your opponents. Thankfully there is also the ability to dodge enemy attacks!

So overall, this game is the type of game that should really stand out to people who are drawn to colour! It's a game that has lots of it - but unfortunately the bleakness is taking over, so you must defend Colourtown!! Apart from the story, there are collectables to collect... heh... and upgrades to buy through the gems you pick up by smashing crates and bad guys. I definitely recommend this game to fans of the platforming/puzzle genre, even if the platforming mechanics aren't what you might expect.

Enjoy! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198011733265', 'num_games_owned': 1684, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1446026971}

The only issue I could say is that text can be a tad hard to read at times because it cuts off mid sentence to change text bubbles. 4 out of 5 Matt faces.

review:
the Last Tinker: City of Colors

Great game all in all, not much to tell you without spoiling the story.

The plusses:

+Interesting Characters
+Cute artstyle
+Slowly starting but engaging story
+Nifty combat
+Good cutscenes
+Very optimistic atmosphere

+- A bit too childish at times

- Combat can get dull (What I heard)

If you liked Banjo and Kazooie, Jax and Dexter or even Zelda (Yes it is comparable in my opinion) definetly check this game out.

Final rating: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197994989104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1436217315}
review:
Story: 9/10

The story really shines in the game with lore throughout the levels, and a great main narrative. The only downside is there's an opportunity for a sequel/post-endgame that ties into the lore pertaining to what a Tinker's role is mentioned in the game that they never take advantage of.

Presentation: 10/10

Wonderful cohesive visual style throughout the game. Bonus points for alterable visuals through unlockables. 

Sound: 9/10

Good soundtrack overall, definitely worth picking up.

Controls: 7/10

The controls are a bit challenging, however it's forgivable due to the amount of attacks and skills loaded into the gameplay.

Gameplay: 8/10

This game is just very fun to play. One of the biggest criticisms is the semi-automatic platforming but it's not so much a platformer as it is puzzles and fighting. The gameplay has a great feel, the puzzles are fun and diverse, and even the enemies gradually level to require new strategies to take down. 

Lasting Appeal: 7/10

There are collectables, unlockable graphic modes, cheats, and concept arts, hidden secrets that unlock achievements and more. Aside from adding DLC or more story elements once the game is completed, it has more content than you would expect and plenty to keep gamers returning. A level select mode lets you return to your favorite parts, each unlocked upon completion.

Overall: 9/10

Definately pick it up. This unique game is worth it, especially if you're a fan of N64 and PSX era adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037404923', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1431921612}
review: There was not a single thing I liked about this game. The camera movement is jerky due to high mouse sensitivity, most of the audio is totally grating, the controls are awkward, and many actions are automated (such as jumping and climbing) so you feel limited. The guidance during gameplay is unbalanced, with too much at times and none at all others. But probably the worst thing is the health system. Though it claims you have a health bar and that after so many hits you die, when you take any damage at all, you respawn back at the last checkpoint. This makes progression maddening in certain areas. Even after fiddling with the settings and switching to a controller, any improvement was minimal at best. It definitely isn't worth full price; when I bought it, it was on sale for $5, but it isn't worth even that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044234932', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1434308814}
review:
Si propone come un gioco che prende spunto dai platform come Jak & Daxter, prendendone solo le meccaniche. Ne esce fuori un gioco vivace (se parliamo di colori) e... che altro? Infatti, almeno da quel che ho visto io, si √® rivelato abbastanza noioso e sembra che sia destinato ad un pubblico infantile. I controlli sono banali e poco intuitivi (perch√© per saltare bisogna correre?). Con tutto il rispetto, ma sembra pi√π un insulto a quel che √® stato il capolavoro delle console Sony.

Voto: 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064175610', 'num_games_owned': 900, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1431881686}
review:
The Last Tinker is a very imagnitive and fun game with some issues.
At the beginning I wasn't a huge fan of the platforming, as you just hold down a button and then run towards the directions you want to jump, but after a while it felt natural. It just made the platforming easier. You don't have to worry about making the jump, only the timing.

The combat system is really weird to me. It felt like a less polished version of the Assassins Creed combat maybe. I never really figured out how to block/evade attacks and at some point the combat got really hard for me. But then you gain powers which completely change how combat works and suddenly it was too easy.

The setting is a world, where the colors are divided into their own parts. So there's a red area, a blue area and a green area. Then in the middle, there's an area where they mix. I have to say I got the idea of the story, that there's different tribes for each of the three colors, but only having such strong colors on the screen at all times made the visuals a little tiring to me. The design of the world wasn't 100% to my taste. Some characters didn't look very polished and a little uninspired.

But despite these flaws, I kept coming back to the game until I beat it. It's a very unique experience. The gameplay is mixed up frequently so it never really gets boring, I especially liked the boss battles. While the story wasn't all that gripping, I thought the dialog of the NPCs was quite funny. I just wanted to keep going to see what would happen next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1432318860}
review:
[h1]The Last Tinker: City of Colors est un jeu de plateformes se d√©roulant √† Couleurville[/h1]

Je sais que √ßa n‚Äôa pas d‚Äôimportance dans le choix d‚Äôacqu√©rir ou non un jeu, mais je trouve le nom du studio qui a d√©velopp√© ce jeu d‚Äôultra mignon, le studio s‚Äôappelle [i]Mimimi Productions[/i] !

Vous jouez un singe dans un monde de l√©zards et votre objectif est de prot√©ger votre ville d‚Äôadoption contre la grisaille (qui d√©sire supprimer couleurs et joie de vivre de la ville).

Il y a des points positifs dans ce jeu comme la traduction en fran√ßais, l‚Äôhumour, le graphisme, l‚Äôhistoire, etc.

MAIS, il y a un gros point n√©gatif qui est le fait que le clavier est d√©fini pour un clavier anglais et qu‚Äôil n‚Äôest pas possible de le red√©finir. Si vous jouez avec une manette, cela n‚Äôa pas d‚Äôimportance alors que si vous √™tes tout le temps sur votre clavier, c‚Äôest une torture !

[url=www.graal.fr/2015/05/23/test-the-last-tinker-city-of-colors-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour lire l'ensemble de mes impressions sur The Last Tinker: City of Colors.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198063660225', 'num_games_owned': 1628, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1433687737}
review:
The Last Tinker √® sicuramente un gioco su cui si pu√≤ discutere, ma di sicuro non si pu√≤ dire che sia un pessimo gioco.

Il gameplay stesso non √® particolarmente arduo, qualunque sia la difficolt√† di gioco. Forse √® convincentemente arduo a difficolt√† massima, dove si dovr√† ricominciare dopo una sola morte, ma non ho la curiosit√† di scoprirlo.
Il combattimento non √® particolarmente entusiasmante. Certo, √® divertente schivare ed eliminare i nemici, ma la schivata non √® mai pi√π efficace del semplice muoversi e i poteri, beh, i poteri basilari del protagonista sono parecchio esagerati. Sar√† davvero semplice uccidere un nemico dei pi√π coriacei con una combo. √à forse questo uno dei motivi principali per cui il gioco non rende molto.

La cosa che pi√π diverte nel gioco √® trovare i collezionabili, i pennelli dorati, che saranno nascosti un po' in tutti i livelli e sbloccheranno piccole curiosit√† o strani (e poco utili, ma divertenti) poteri come la modalit√† testa piccola o il mondo speculare. Addirittura, ad un certo punto, verr√† sbloccata la modalit√† invincibilit√†.
Completare gli achievement √® piuttosto semplice, fatta eccezione per quello che prevede di dirigere l'orchestra senza errori, pi√π per sbagli casuali che per altro.

La trama non √® particolarmente originale, ma funziona a sufficienza. Forse un po' infantile per certi aspetti, ma il target √® proprio quello, quindi non c'√® nulla di cui lamentarsi.
Il lato migliore del gioco sono le musiche, molto belle in tutti i frangenti.

Tutto sommato si tratta di un gioco valido, non esaltante al 100%, ma comunque divertente. Forse un po' corta la trama, se si fosse sviluppata un po' pi√π a lungo si sarebbe potuta aumentare la difficolt√†.
Consigliato? Alla fin fine si! Ma beh, NON per 20‚Ç¨. √à un bel gioco, certo, ma non vale quel prezzo. Se credete che vi interessi, vi interesser√†, ma non vi lascer√† con la bocca spalancata, non vi dar√† molto pi√π di quanto immaginate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013706662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1433536932}
review:
Ignoring the fact that the game is falsely advertised as a platformer (read- there is no actual platforming in this game), the actual gameplay is pretty mediocre- too dumbed down for adults (brainless button-mashing combat + no actual platforming, again) and too annoying for kids (the rail-grinding parts and the part with the security robot really could have done with more play-testing). The writing's pretty lame (for kids though so it's not that big a deal), the soundtrack's decent, the presentation and look of the game world's actually quite good for the most part although the hero himself has probably one of the ugliest most unappealing character designs ever.

While the game's pretty short there's a bit of replay value in the form of (mostly useless) upgrades and unlockable concept art, and despite it's short length it still feels dull and padded-out in places (eg. the level where the game suddenly becomes Diet LA Noire for a brief moment).

Overall it's not a horrible game but it's not good either, and from a price standpoint, it's one of those games you should probably get while it's on sale since ¬£16.99 for a 5 hour-long game is kind of a rip-off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054803370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1845, 'last_played': 1432622207}
review:
A truly great game! A city of colorful characters (figuratively and literally) have become segregated over time. There are some inhabitants that merely tolerate some colors as means to survive, while there are others who accept all the colors. A majority of the inhabitants stick to their color only and dislike the other colors for various reasons. 

SPOILERS AHEAD!

[spoiler] That is until the protagonist gets tricked by one of the color spirit gods and the nonexistence of color called bleakness is released. When tragedy strikes and they all start working together, they become more accepting and happy as a whole once more. [/spoiler]

It's such a simple story that can be applied to many real life topics such as racism, homophobia, xenophobia and much much more. If we just stopped and took the time to realize that we're all not so different and were a little more accepting, the world would be a better place.

Of course, this is all open to interpretation but this is definitely what I got out of it.

This game gets a 10 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061624585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1432730976}
review:
I got this game in wintersale 2014 and just played recently (mid 2015). First, I already saw the demo of this game from casual connect Asia 2014 but I didn't have chance to try it. Ok, here is my first impression after 30 minutes of playing:

- first opening scene is great. The narrator explains the current world and who you are
- art is amazing, but too colorful..  I meant I got dizzy after half hour playing it. They put color blind mode but that's not the one I was looking for, maybe something to put the texture back to "less color" would be nice
- music is great, the guitar is kinda repetitive though.  It might be just my preference 
- the visual effect is great

I recommend this game if you like 3D action adventure (can't say it's a platformer without having a button to jump)
But if you have problem with too many colors, I don't recommend this game for you. Let's see if I have some other time and able to play longer, I'll edit my review about getting dizzy

author: {'steamid': '76561197982715407', 'num_games_owned': 2632, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1673561248}
review:
Short, but highly compelling. Don't mistake this game for a platformer, as all of the "platforming" is limited to automatic free-running over ledges, and requires very little skill to pull off. The battles are generally simple, with only two or three types of enemies posing a threat throughout the entire game, and other smaller enemies being used as filler to make encounters feel more interesting. The entire game is rather easy, and I beat it in three sittings.

In spite of these points, though, I found the game to be extremely compelling. The puzzles can be rather challenging at times, and the level design is top notch. Never did I feel that the game was becoming monotonous. Each area brought a completely new and unique challenge. I also enjoyed the story, as well.

I'd definitely recommend picking this game up, but it might be priced just a little bit too high for how long the game lasts. I'd also eagerly welcome a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990785858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1432475287}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005057754', 'num_games_owned': 1274, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 1431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1495545039}
review:
With all the depressing and dull-colored games out there, it's great to find a positive and brightly-colored one.  This game is not only that, but has created a fascinating world to explore filled to the brim with weird and whimsical creatures.  The player is drawn into this fantastic world, and then forced to watch as it is brutally disemboweled.  Of course, it all works out in the end, but still it's quite the gut-punch.

Most importantly though, it not only tackles a moral not often touched on in games, but it tackles it really well.  There's an interactive flashback sequence that lays it on the line, but doesn't hamfist it down your throat.  I'm probably not doing it any favors describing it so vaguely, but I don't really want to spoil it for anyone.  Just know that you'll be thinking about it for quite a few hours after you play it.

While the game shares the same tone as the classic 90's 3d platformers, it definitely doesnt play like one.  It's pretty much the indie game scene's answer to Assassin's Creed.  Whether this is awesome or awful is totally up to the player.  I personally didnt mind it, but people looking for a straight-up platformer might be disappointed.

But if you're looking for a gorgeous world with neat characters and a sweet story, then you should give The Last Tinker a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042838346', 'num_games_owned': 5512, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1431355662}
review:
The Last Tinker est un jeu plein de charme destin√© avant tout √† un public jeune mais qui ne s'y limite pas non plus.

Vous √™tes Koru, un Tinker aux airs de singe qui va malgr√© lui propager la grisaille sur Couleurville. Cette ville se s√©pare en quatre quartiers : rouge, vert, bleu et le quartier du march√©. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=439910717 Les habitants se sont retranch√©s dans leur quartier et ne s'entendent plus, l'agressivit√© des rouges a pris le pas sur leur force, la curiosit√© des verts a laiss√© place √† la peur et le courage des bleus s'est envol√© pour ouvrir la porte √† la tristesse. Koru est bien d√©cid√© √† se servir de ses pouvoirs de Tinker qui lui permettent d'absorber et de r√©pandre la couleur pour r√©parer ses d√©g√¢ts et combattre la grisaille mais aussi pour ramener l'entente parmi les peuples de Couleurville. 

Ce n'est pas un jeu de plateformes, le saut est assist√© mais c'est plut√¥t un jeu d'exploration et d'aventure. Parcourir les diff√©rents quartiers est sympathique et les graphismes color√©s √† souhait et enfantins apportent un charme qui ne peut pas plaire √† tout le monde mais que j'ai personnellement appr√©ci√©. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=440863717 Le character design est tr√®s particulier mais l√† aussi cela ne m'a pas g√™n√©, c'√©tait plut√¥t original et mignon, parfait pour des enfants. 

Pour les adultes je pense que c'est un jeu qui peut plaire m√™me si parfois on sent bien dans les dialogues qu'on s'adresse √† un jeune public. Je ne me suis pas ennuy√©e pour ma part car le jeu n'est pas non plus b√™tement simpliste et il y a quatre niveaux de difficult√© si vous trouvez les combats trop mous. 

Le gameplay est bien pens√© : entre les phases d'exploration o√π vous serez amen√©s √† discuter avec les habitants ou √† chercher les pinceaux √† collectionner vous aurez quelques √©nigmes √† r√©soudre √† l'aide de [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=439912037]Biggs et Bomber[/url].  Ces dr√¥les de bestioles r√©agissent diff√©remment en fonction de la couleur que vous leur jetez dessus : sauter sur un interrupteur, exploser un mur, faire disparaitre une partie de la grisaille pour vous permettre d'avancer etc...

De m√™me, en combat la frappe rouge occasionnera des d√©g√¢ts, la frappe verte effrayera les ennemis qui s'enfuiront (√† vous de les faire courir vers un pi√®ge ou un gouffre) et la frappe bleue les paralysera le temps de les √©liminer en les frappant dans le dos. Vous disposerez aussi d'une attaque puissante qui se recharge en combat et qui servira soit √† donner des coups plus puissants, figer le temps ou traverser la grisaille.

Il y a donc vraiment de bonnes id√©es pour ce Last Tinker on regrettera cependant un petit manque d'inspiration puisqu'un [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=439912581]certain boss[/url] revient au moins cinq fois dans le jeu. En dehors de √ßa les ennemis sont assez vari√©s et les combats sont rendus agr√©ables gr√¢ce aux couleurs. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=440864624 On compte d'autres bonnes id√©es comme des petits jeux musicaux bien pens√©s pour les petits et des phases plus rapides sur des rails o√π il faudra esquiver les obstacles. 

Concernant la musique les [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tA6ZZWNNaug]th√®mes sont de tr√®s bonne facture[/url], les habitants ne parlent pas quant √† eux mais √©mettent des petits sons mignons (qui peuvent devenir aga√ßants √† la longue quand m√™me).
Le jeu propose environ 10h de jeu (+/- 2h) pour un adulte, s√ªrement plus pour un enfant.

En d√©finitive The Last Tinker est un super jeu pour les enfants mais aussi pour les adultes si tant est que vous ayez gard√© votre √¢me d'enfant. Le jeu d√©livre un joli message de tol√©rance pour couronner le tout, pas de regrets pour cet achat !

[quote]Lisez d'autres avis sur ma page de curation : [b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9002662/]Kitsune's Guide[/url][/b][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198103044785', 'num_games_owned': 827, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1506577274}

L'histoire est plut√¥t basique: un m√©chant (la Grisaille), vous dupe et vous demande de l'aider sauf qu'il vole les couleurs de votre monde, et forc√©ment vous √™tes un Tinker donc c'est √† vous de sauver Couleurville.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076721797', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1431052380}
review:
On one hand, this game has decidely little gameplay to it, and even less challenge.
On the other hand, there's so much heart put into it and the presentation is so good that I can't help but enjoy it.
The world is vibrant, even with the use of whiteness so heavily. The soundtrack is diverse and interesting. The character designs are good, the character is passable, the story is pretty throwaway. It's easy, sure, but it's relaxing in a way. The puzzles aren't too tough and the platforming is about non-existent. The combat has at least a little depth, though not too much, and each new color you get simplifies it further. But it makes for a good spectacle. I like watching this game do its thing, even if interactivity suffers because of it. Exploring is still pretty fun, there's a lot of hidden areas and seeking them out is certainly enjoyable. Not too terribly many, though.

The game compares itself poorly to others, though. It's not really like Banjo Kazooie or Jak & Daxter at all. Not a bad thing, but it shouldn't be selling itself like that.
It's also kind of on the sort side, 6-7 hours to complete and under 10 to 100%. Probably not worth the $20.

I like this game, but I don't love it, and I wouldn't recommend it at full price, but it's certainly worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018205146', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1431020718}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126752030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1430221765}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZgXo6PUk3OE

The Last Tinker es un juego de aventura, con peque√±os toques de acci√≥n, plataformas y alg√∫n que otro puzzle.

Uno de los grandes pros es la est√©tica del juego, muy lograda con los colores, muy vivos y que transportan y dan algo de nostalgia a aquellos que jugamos a titulos de N64 como Banjo-Kazooie o Mario 64.
Cabe a√±adir que de aqui surge una contra, la cual es que, por ejemplo, en el distrito rojo solo vemos ese color, y acaba por dar un dolor de cabeza que obliga a tomar descansos para no reventar.

Por lo dem√°s otros buenos puntos son la historia, suficientemente interesante como para engancharte; la jugabilidad, c√≥moda y f√°cil para el usuario; la m√∫sica, bastante buena, y crea un ambiente agradable a la vez que te sumerje muy bien dentro de los distintos momentos y lugares del juego.

La duraci√≥n est√° bastante bien, si nos ponemos a full en un fin de semana (un par de dias) lo acabamos, yo he tardado 10 horas en completarlo en dificultad dificil.

En resumen, es un juego bastante completo y recomendable, especialmente para esa gente que les gustaba tanto esa est√©tica N64 y que buscan un buen juego de aventura.
Como consejo decir que si lo pod√©is comprar con una buena oferta mejor que mejor y seguro que os vale la pena.

Si quieres saber y ver m√°s puedes clicar y ver el video-an√°lisis que os dejo arriba.

review:
Mimimi, mimimi, mimimi. 

+ Very nice graphics. 
+ Lazy kids learn to read. 
+ Combat system is suitable for casual gamers and kids. 
+ A little bit caring about the situation is necessary. 
+ Nice story. 
+ Sex and gender free so that women shut up at least once (just kiddin¬¥: homophobes can suck my ice-cream). 
+ It¬¥s not about racism (as many racists claim...muahaha) in specific but more general:  some want freedom and get angry (red ones), some want security and get paranoid (green ones), some want peace and get sad (blue ones) - no matter because of what. And then there are those who are a mixture of let¬¥s say red and blue, get purple - and when green pops in this gives white (as well as black since white and black aren¬¥t colors but equal mixtures of all three colors). Basically the last boss would¬¥ve been black but in today¬¥s times this would be racist - because the white scum - ah - man is the problem today. Thus the final boss being white is appropriate for the actual context if one wants relate those colors to skin colors. But this motherlover really should¬¥ve been black as no human skin can ever be (except if being burned...but then there¬¥s no more skin there, isn¬¥t it...). 


I got the game from a bundle and was pleasantly surprised - at least it has controls that also work with mouse and keyboard (looking at you Dark Souls...). 


Only downside: you can¬¥t jump.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056992771', 'num_games_owned': 1056, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1509604750}
review:
Has everything you could want out of a 3d platformer, except for good platforming :(

I kind of felt like i was tricked in to buying it, Comparing it to banjo kazooie in its description and from what i saw in videos it looks awesome but unfortunately the platforming is extremely simple, and controls like assassins creed where you just hold down a button and the guy platforms automatically, such a letdown because the world, characters and story have all the charm you could want out of a 90s style BK-like game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009649940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1431288972}
review:
Even though I didn't really care for this game, I'm giving this a yes vote. 

Why?

I'm a big fan of the Ratchet & Clank and the Jack & Daxter series, and that's why I downloaded this game, because that's what it promised to be. It fell short of living up to that promise, but it tried... Which is more than any other developers can say now-a-days... 

It didn't pander to the fps-nazi-zombie-dinosaur-space-marine-mining-simulator re-regurgitated garbage games, nor did it take the path of the quick-to-make-&-churn-ROI-on platform of the lazy 2d 8 bit retro style (which also seems to be producing nothing original)

It took a risk to make something new and other developers to be doing that.

This game would be great if:
- they worked on the ambience and gave more life to the environments
- they added some voice overs instead of read along text
- there were jokes or something light hearted in the dialogue (its VERY dry)
- you could jump on your own in the game
- the music wasn't so slow
- the story line seemed politically motivated (i want to play games to get away from the real world, not live in it)

They should definately make a sequel though if they changed the things above

author: {'steamid': '76561198004550992', 'num_games_owned': 1535, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1430530934}
review:
Disclaimers:
I'm a pessimist.
I lack much of a sense of humor
I dived into the game on the hardest difficulty
I play on Linux

It's really hard for me to give the pros of a game, so I'll just list the cons. Don't take it as a bad thing

At first, the gameplay turned me off. It immediately felt really on-rails with its jumping system (pretty much automatic, uncontrolled). But it didn't bother me much after a short time.

It took some time to learn that there were even enemy projectile impact indicators on the ground, and even when I learned it they were often difficult to see, especially when I didn't explicitly notice the enemy creating them was around.

There were occasional performance problems. They took away from it only a little, but there was only one point where I felt I could blame death on it (The first double sign on a rail).

There were only two points in the game where I felt a little cheated.
First, when fighting one of the spawner mini-bosses, especially the first one as I did not have a ranged attack at the time, the boss would hit me very soon after I threw the last punch before they retreated and started spawning enemies again. It wouldn't have been an issue if I wasn't on the hardest difficulty, but I was, so I would die instantly and have to restart. Once I got the ranged attack I'd just avoid using melee attacks against it, though.
As a rail was curving upwards and I'd jump too early, feeling like I should reasonably make considering the angle.

On that note, cutscenes were generally unskippable (at least, as far as I can tell while playing), so dying repeatedly on some areas felt especially tedious.

For being on the hardest difficulty, the game didn't feel too difficult. Maybe it was immediately getting used to the mechanics like that which made me feel that way. But there were only a few points where I would die (though usually at least a few times before I got through).

The story was fairly predictable, but considering the generally childish theme of the game, my expectations were low. There was a single 'swear' that took me a little off guard.

The game was pretty linear, but that's not necessarily a bad thing.

Despite all of that, I enjoyed playing the game (especially the boss fights) and learning about Colortown and its inhabitants. I certainly didn't regret my purchase and would recommend it if these issues aren't too much for anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994320364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1400254608}
review:
I wanted to like it and love it so bad. I really did. I even picked it up on complete faith, based on the description and such, touting it as being "inspired by classics such as Jak and Daxter and Banjo-Kazooie". It's plainly using nostalgia to sell. The visuals, characters and soundtrack sure do, but something that went unnoticed during development phase, something important that all platformers need, that i don't think Mimimi figured was a big deal. But it is. 

The gameplay and controls of the game, totally clash with what it's trying to be 'inspired by'. A 'classic 3D platformer' has jumping puzzles, jumping skills to traverse difficult sections, and tight controls. This game has none of that. Instead it went for the 'Assassins creed' approach. Or as i like to call it, the "Lazy platforming' approach. You hold a button to auto-jump off of platforms. Yes. That's right. Not only that, there are literally no jumping puzzles you can't solve just by holding the button and a direction. This makes the entire game and indeed, the entire selling point, totally moot. The game treats you as a platforming idiot. Unable to simply time your jumps. This takes all the fun out of the game for me, and probably, alot of you. There is no exploring by platforming or doing tricky jumps here, no sense of reward by finally landing that perfect set of jumps. They give you a beautiful looking world to explore, but limit and hand-hold you into every little thing you do. I wish i could get my money back, but as i said, i really tried to like it. 

The entire game is just one huge slap in the face to my nostalgia, its like the developers didn't even play the games that 'inspired' them. I felt like the game was treating me like a total idiot that needs to be hand-held. I hope this doesn't become the norm for modern 3D platformers. Don't be suckered in, just play the old 3D platformers, and let this modern garbage rot on steam.
